Reviews.Title: “Rather pretentious & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Clif4nyc
Reviews.Content: Hate the bed platforms extending past the mattress, kept banging my knees & shins while getting around these small rooms, last time there, heat wouldn' t shut off, this time it won't come on! Give me a chain hotel over these "boutiques" any day

Reviews.Title: “still even better than before”
Reviews.Author: paultje44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 10 years ago, and it was at that time already a hotel made to our taste, very good situated at madison/31st street, so not far from a lot of things (empire state), shopping (macys). We were lucky to have very nice weather, cold but mostly sunny. Also on saturday the st Patricks Parade, we did not go to the real center of the parade, but saw al around us green, green and green. happy people enjoying that day for the 251st time. Even by taxi it is not far away from Soho, Central Park, meatpacking district with the High Line, of wherever in manhattan. It was 3 years ago we were in NY, as I was operated at one knee, and even now it was a bit more difficult, but in NY you find allover the city seating possibilities, or inside a shop, so I could rest for some minutes. the bed of the Roger was very comfortable and high, nice sheets and cushions, the bathroom had all ammenities needed, a good shower, enough place to put the things we need in a bathroom. For one reason or another we received 3 breakfast for two complimentary, what was very welcome, and nice breakfasts, just what we needed, served at the Mezanine, with a nice view over the crossing of 31st and madison, very nice decorated. A friendly Doorman, who used to open the door coming in or out, taking care about luggage and looking for Taxi. Checking in and out was very fast. The service at breakfast was good, we had twice simple dinner at the Mezanine too, very good, and very friendly servicer again. And for us important too free WiFi allover the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm conflicted...”
Reviews.Author: EricScottReed
Reviews.Content: Chairs are uncomfortable and low, although the bed is very comfortable. As in many old buildings, the heat is through one pipe, so you can't personally control the heat in your room, although they provided a small space heater, which improved the situation about 75%. The lighting is ridiculously low. I will never understand that ridiculous European custom of designing a shower with half a friggin' door?!? Not to mention, the soft water had sucky pressure. They charge you an additional and mandatory $20 per night for the usage of wi-fi, business center (a table and 2 chairs in the lobby) and fitness center. So, you might as well use it all! Other than that, the decor is nice and the staff are polite. For one person on a weekend trip, it was a perfect size (18 feet x 18 feet = 324 sq. ft.) Honestly, for the price, you could do worse in Manhattan. The key is not to spend too much time in the room, especially, if you're a business person. Overall, the vibe was too "slick" and not designed for "comfort"!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariacouto
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute reservation through Hotels Tonight iphone app and we were pleasantly surprised. Everyone from the doorman to the housekeeping staff in the elevator were extremely helpful and very accomodating. The room, for NYC standards, was larger than we expected and very clean. Overall our stay was excellent, only wish we could have stayed longer. Highly recommend and will return. Maria

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: lodiza
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this boutique hotel several times when it first opened. They have not been maintaining the quality they once had. The rates are high for what you get. The place needs updating

Reviews.Title: “Once a nice hotel, no loger”
Reviews.Author: Market2k
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a dozen times over several years so this is a highly qualified review. The place is beat up with stained carpet and scuffed walls and doors throughout. The heating system is horrible and my room was freezing when I arrived. Inept front desk staff told me that the heat would be "coming on soon" and asked if I wanted a space heater sent up. No--I don't want a space heater. I want a frickin' room with heat! This is NYC 2012 and I'm paying $200 on a slow Tuesday night for a hotel room! So they moved me to a downgraded room that was like a sweat lodge and was so hot that I had to open the window. LOL. Just not a nice hotel anymore. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trowland57
Reviews.Content: We stay here often Join Club131. Location is great,. STAFF IS VERY HELPFUL. BREAKFAST BUFFET IS GOOD. They will make better deals on the phone. Get deal with champagne. Higher floor better. Corner room the best.

Reviews.Title: “It's not very nice and I am not your Mama”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuch101
Reviews.Content: I feel better that Iâ€™m not the only one that feels this is very substandard in condition and service. Many positive reviews mention the location and value only. As a business traveler I donâ€™t need to save the last dollar. Also I had a weird and unsatisfactory interaction with the manager who kept calling me â€œmamaâ€� when I complained. If you need this location, there are other better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Berkshirebob59
Reviews.Content: We just did an overnight with friends--theatre, dinner, 9/11 memorial. The location was great; all the staff were very friendly dand helpful from getting us cabs to giving us directions. The room was very small but that was to be expected in mid-town. Definitely recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Any Place Else!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelWell
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is if you get a rate much cheaper than any where else. All the positive reviews must be from people who got a really great deal and wouldnâ€™t spend a few dollars more. My visit wasnt even 3rd rate. The hotel is UNDER CONSTRUCTION as the rooms are very very worn, very small even by NYC standards and were never stylish when they were new 10+ years ago. Itâ€™s not for a business person as it full of back packers and families with small children. My tiny baths was not cleaned well. All the services are lackadaisical at best. While some of the staff is friendly, when I complained about the cleaning and slow service to the manager, Ms. Hassler, she brusquely told me that thatâ€™s what I should expect at that price and location, unbelievable. I guess I agree - so stay here if price is your only consideration and you like construction dust.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel in NEW YORK CITY!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay1212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Roger Williams hotel in NYC Feb 10-16, 2012 and it was awful! The people that worked there were very pleasant, especially the doormen were very helpful and friendly. The problem was that the rooms are super small, so don't plan on having more then 2 people in the room. The beds are very small. The paint in the shower was coming off and would attach to me as I left the shower, the sink taps leaked and soaked my makeup bag and other items. I had to keep a towel around the taps the whole time. There was very loud banging in the morning. I found OLD FOOD in a container in one of the drawers and it was a full container! Hello health codes!! It was disgusting! Room service was horrible, they didn't change our towels or robes on the ground, we had to call up for new ones and they didn't replace our used glasses. I complained all they gave me was a $50 dinner coupon and dinner was late and I only had 5 minutes to eat it! It was a super busy and hectic week for me and I felt even more rushed with this mess. i even asked to be reimbursed one night and they said no but they could give me a discount next time I stayed there. I had 2 other people staying with me and this is unacceptable. The business they lose could have been saved, not now. She wasn't even sorry (Manager I spoke too) I will never stay here again or recommend it to anyone else! And it wasn't even reasonable priced for the small rooms. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MimicoGal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great staff, decent sized room. The bed was very comfortable. Although we were so tired from all the walking that I think any bed would have done. This was our 3rd time to New York and we wanted to stay in a different area. It was great to walk and explore 5th Ave, Lexington and Madison Ave. A bit of a hike over to Times Square (for theatre) but that was ok. A few things: Internet (wifi) in the rooms was a bit sporadic. But they have 2 free computers for use in the lobby. A coffee maker in the room would have been nice. Small things really. For breakfast in the area, I would recommend the Murray Hill Diner. It's only a few blocks away. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Stylish, Comfortable Room!”
Reviews.Author: JulianaVegh
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the Roger Williams. We had only planned to stay one night as a splurge (we were staying with friends the rest of our time in NYC) but we decided to make it two nights after checking in to our lovely room. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. The staff were gracious and helpful, the doorman was friendly. We didn't try the breakfast as there are myriad of breakfast restaurants and deli's in the area - the one directly across the street from the hotel had the best salad bar! Would love to stay there again, even though it's a bit out of our budget - as all nice hotels in Manhattan tend to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: mathsupt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended as in an area that is not so busy as Times Square. The place was very clean and not too expensive with alot to do in the area or just a short walk. Only draw back was the bathroom was tiny. I'm 5'7 165 lbs and could barely move around. So if you're any larger than I am, you'll have a problem. Room was nice and people were friendly, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic staff... definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: eldan2310
Reviews.Content: we unexpectedly stayed here during a visit end of September 2011. we did have another hotel booked but it was hideous! so we spent our first afterNoon walking around New York trying to find an alternative. As soon as we walked in we were greated by friendly staff, and the staff on front desk were amazing! We cannot thank them enough! The hotel itself was very clean, tidy and the rooms were very modern and so comfortable, just what you need after a day or sightseeing! The location is also superb, being only a 5 minute walk from Empire State Building. The doormen also hail cabs for you, and are very helpful with directions! It was quite pricey, compared to our original hotel, but you get what you pay for right?! Superb standard hotel, we will definitely be returning if we have the chance to come back to NY!

Reviews.Title: “Roger Williams Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trotamundo69
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last September and I came back in January. Both times was for a business trip. The hotel has an excellent location, mid way from Union Square as well as close to the Empire state. There are several good restaurants around and even some bar to have a drink or two. The food in the hotel is pretty good (steak is a small but delicious portion, perfect for diner. On the first stay I got a spacious room, second time the bathroom was a little small. Staff is friendly and got upgraded to a bigger bed when requested. Price is affordable and have gym as well a free internet. I would probably stay on the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimboelrod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just had a wonderful 3 day stay in NYC, staying at the ROger Williams. The hotel is being completely renovated which is probably good as it is a bit dated but the rooms were clean, and very comfortable. We booked the hotel through Hotwire so we had an excellent rate for NYC, location was excellent, basically one block from a subway station and also close to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, which makes for easy transport to the airport. The best thing about the Roger Williams was the staff who were without exception extremely friendly and efficient. Kathy at the front desk and Floner, the bellman and the engineering staff were outstanding. My wife and I will stay there again on our next trip to NYC in July. It's not a big fancy hotel but it certainly fit our needs, which is a reasonable rate and a clean and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful NYC hotel with amazing views of the Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: SchulzeM
Reviews.Content: Like most New York hotels, the rooms at Hotel Roger Williams can be a little small but the accommodations are quality and well done. Our room was very comfortable and surprisingly quiet for being on one of the city's main streets. The lobby was nice and the staff was very helpful. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Bevon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in January 2012 and we were very happy with the customer service at the hotel. The rooms were very small and during this time of the year, the hotel was using natural air so sometimes the room can be a bit too cold or too hot. There was a small water problem we experienced for a few hours because a pipe had burst but the staff was very helpful and they got the situation resolved within a few hours. I will stay here again because I liked the location. We can easily walked to 34th Street, Times Square, Broadway and many restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. Looking forward to staying here again, good people, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: zalss
Reviews.Content: We have made a last minute request for a room suitable for handicapped, luckily they have a room available. It was spacious and the toilet has all it needs for handicapped person. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially when we need a wheelchair friendly cab whenever we go around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dieselblade
Reviews.Content: So whats not to like? Perfect location in Manhattan, all the staff from the doorman to the cleaners are exceptionally friendly and efficient only possible thing to complain is that the rooms are on the small side especially the bathrooms but its got everything you need and afterall this is Manhattan I for one will go back again and again

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Reed808
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel offers great value in New York. The location is conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan, only about a 10 minute walk from Grand Central. The rooms were very spacious - especially for NY - and the bed was very comfortable. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff. Nice, Modern & Sleek in Midtown Manhattan. Close to Penn Sta and Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: bagjob
Reviews.Content: The front desk team, houskeeping, and all of the employees at Roger Williams were very polite, helpful, cheerful, and friendly. The hotel is sleek and contemporary, and convieniently located in Midtown Manhattan, just a few blocks from Penn Station and Grand Central. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms well-appointed. Our view was of the wall of another building, but I am sure if we asked to move they would have tried to accommodate our request. The Roger Williams is a wonderful hotel with the only negative being that they charge a $20/day hotel fee per room.

Reviews.Title: “OK, reasonable room and experience”
Reviews.Author: memberUSA
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Roger Williams Hotel. I booked two rooms (we are a family of five). On my reservation form, I noted that we wanted to be as close together as possible-- preferably adjoining. The morning we were to arrive I called the hotel. The person who answered the phone was very nice and told me that the rooms were right next to each other. She said adjacent, which I took to mean adjoining, but didn't. When I arrived at the hotel, the person who greeted us also looked at the request on my form and said, "we've put the two rooms right together." Well, we went upstairs and the rooms were sequentially numbered, but one was down the hall and around the corner from the other. OK, that wasn't a big deal, but it was the difference for me between feeling comfortable having the 2 bigger kids in one room alone (versus wanting to divide the parents into 2 rooms) and the difference between putting all of the stuff in one suitcase vs. not. Also, there was a maid's closet in between, and every time the maid rummaged in closet in the middle of the night, I woke up and wondered whether something was awry in our other room! I really could have lived with it if one hotel person had said, "oh sorry, we didn't have anything right next door". But instead, I just felt they were lazy-- not knowing the layout of their own hotel! The hotel was fine. The beds are pushed against the wall, because the rooms are small. The carpeting, etc. is a bit shopworn, but not bad. One of our rooms had ink scribbles all over the desk-- some child had scribbled on it and the hotel had left it there. The bathrooms are SMALL (at least they were in our rooms). There was one small-ish window. I actually kind of liked they way they covered the windows with Japanese screens that you could slide aside. I will always stay at the Affinia if they have rooms, but they didn't. The hotel was totally totally adequate. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, but not jumping up and down either.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: frankmcs
Reviews.Content: Got to stay at the Roger Williams this past weekend. This trip was booked for me so I didn't pick the Hotel. I was totally blown away by the courteous customer service. From the moment I pulled up in the cab until I departed, I was treated like a valued customer. The room was reallly nice and I had a view of the Empire State Building. My shower was the best I've ever had. In fact I ordered the same showerhead when I got home. Great location in Mid-town!!Enjoyed my stay immensely!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really nice NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: neasel
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams Hotel was very elegant and centrally located in Manhattan. Great location and within walking distance to the Empire State building, Times Square Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, and Bryant Park. The room was very modern with a nice comfy bed and flat screen tv and free wifi. However the bathroom was very tiny and the amenities were a bit pricey. All in all I would stay here again when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tori2007
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old son and I stayed at The Roger last week. The room was very clean the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful; everyone we saw made a point to make my son feel special. The staff also gave great recommendations for dining close-by. The room was quite spacious for NYC. The hotel is centrally located within walking distances to most popular tourist areas or a quick cab ride away. We recommend this hotel and will stay there again. The only downside was we had to move all of the â€œcash bar itemsâ€� into the upper shelf of the closet so my son would not raid the candy and we would be chargedâ€¦.other then that no complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lexi123_11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I LOVED this hotel. They have a doorman, the lobby is lovely and inviting, the staff is so friendly and helpful. The 2nd floor is a cozy mezzanine where you can eat and have drinks. We were very impressed with the room, which was a double. Perfect size for two, nice bathroom, comfy robes, comfortable beds, very clean and just overall very inviting. They even had welcome treats in the room the first night, very classy. The location is excellent. Within walking distance of Midtown Manhattan, near subway stops, and a nice neighborhood. When I go back to NYC, I will definitely stay here again. My friend also agreed that the hotel was excellent. The price was also very reasonable. This hotel helped make our trip extra special.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: lab2323
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend in NYC. My friend found a good deal at the Roger Williams, so we figured we would give it a try. I was nervous about the size of the bathrooms after reading reviews and seeing photos We stayed in room 510 and the bathroom was normal NYC hotel size. So request that room if you are nervous about the tiny bathroom. The bed was comfortable with nice linen (nothing scratchy or rough). The colors in the bathroom and room are kind of McDonald's-esque....mustard yellow with red and cobalt blue. Our room's heater worked a little too well and we opened the window while we were in the room to cool it down some. The front desk was very nice and check in was no problem. We arrived very early and my husband had called to make sure our room was ready and it was except for the champagne he had ordered. The front door got a little hectic and I feel their doormen need some more experience. I always felt like we were in the way both coming and going. The location is truly great....Right on Madison Ave, just a few blocks north of the flatiron district. We walked uptown to the UES, to Bryant Park, Times square, the NY public Library and also down through the flatiron district past madison square park (not the arena, the actual garden).Cabs were easy to come by on such a busy road. I don't remember outside noise being a problem, but its new york...there will always be some noise. Overall I would stay here again, but only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyrigg
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel right on Madison Avenue, footsteps from the Empire State Building and 5 minutes walk to Macy's and shopping area. The hotel lobby is highly attractive and the staff extremely helpful. It has a small bar / restaurant area which I ate in and the food was very good. The only disappointment was the room - not 4 stars! Spacious and well equipped, just not 4 stars. Happens often and is very annoying - fab reception area and then the rooms tick the boxes for 4 stars but that's it. The room was very clean too, just cheaply finished and a little 'tatty' in the bathroom. A great hotel though, and was good for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: sonbax
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in New York for a first time visitor is daunting so imagine my surprise when I found this gem. Situated on Madison Avenue and a 10 - 15 minute walk to Broadway, Park, Avenue and Times Square. The hotel is in the boutique style. The entry and lobby are inviting and the staff are very friendly. The room was what I expected, having spoken to many people who have visited New York, the rooms are small. We didn't have a view but we were only there to sleep and shower, not to sit and watch the world go by. The rooms were well maintained, clean and the beds were very comfy. The bathroom was probably the smallest I've seen outside of Europe but it didn't bother me. The only thing we did not like was that breakfast in the amazingly small (for a 14 floor hotel) breakfast area where we had a buffett style breakfast that was so overpriced it was laughable(ended up paying $44.00 for 2 of us) We also had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. There are many restaraunts around (1 is across the street) that provide a more reasononably priced menu. The other thing was that the room was very stuffy(the cool fan wasn't doing it's job). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitly stay there should we go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great view empire state”
Reviews.Author: Sarahward1970
Reviews.Content: Second time in ny first time in this hotel it was great hotel very clean staff very helpful chose hotel for wi-fi however had few probs getting on line staff were extremely helpful and disnt charge me for the $19 a night fee when checking out didnt even need to ask! Very helpful with giving directions and advice about gettin around too ! I requested the empire state view not thinking for a moment i would actually get it but was amazed to be told was on top floor just under penthouse then looked out window and there it was fantastic made our stay !!! Well done roger williams!!! Will be back!! I would only give 1 negative and that is all the goodies and toiletries in room are priced up it would have been noce get a few bits free like other hotels iv stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need imrovements.”
Reviews.Author: NydiaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Nice reception, lounge, and food. Rooms are small and bathroom extremely uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous stay. Great characters.”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: I can write a whole book about the kindness and willingness of the hotel staff to fulfill my requests and make our stay an unforgettable one. First of all let me tell you that it is more like a boutique hotel, meaning that it has a more personalised and customised approach to the customer. Since this was going to be the trip where I was going to propose to my future wife, travelling all the way from Greece and having booked the flights early enough, I wanted to make sure that everything was going to be exactly as I had it in mind. This is the point where the hotel staff gets into play. I have no words for Shane and Leslie who have done a wonderful job in preparing everything to perfection. We have met Leslie in person who is a lovely young lady with a smile always on her face -- she took care of everything including a room upgrade, the room decoration for the "special" night, as well as keeping my mail until our arrival. I cannot thank her enough! From a practical aspect, the hotel is centrally located at 31st and Madison, making it a perfect hotspot for exploring the city. It's about 15-20 minutes walk from Times Sq. or $8 cab ride. Taxis are cheap which means that even if you are exhausted after a full day of walking up and down the city, you can grab a cab and be back at the hotel, cheaply enough. The room itself was gorgeous, with a splendid corner view and a huge bed! All in all, having been in NYC a couple of times, this has been my most memorable of all, and for sure the hotel itself, as well as its staff has a played a major part in it. Needless to day that next time we are in NYC, Leslie will be the first person to ring up to secure a room! Thanks again guys!

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there a second time”
Reviews.Author: JK1729
Reviews.Content: While the lobby is large and impressive, and the room is not overly small, the hallway had a dingy feel, and the room felt cramped and oppressive. Part of the problem is the problem with all midtown hotels, that it's hard to block out the light and the noise from the outside at night. But I found that it just had a kind of cramped and unpleasant feel to it. The $19 service charge added on top of the bill was also very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Regal boutique”
Reviews.Author: sandiphoto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is regal yet Very homey ,welcoming as there is always someone with a smile to open the door for coming and going. The lobby and upstair bar is tiny but has a comfortable feel with throw blankets even on the couches ! This was our second time staying in the past month and it is clean and yet quaint modern.first time we stayed I think on the 6 th floor corner king looking down Madison but it is mosey at rush hour but great views ! This last time we stayed n the 15 floor(1505?) ,one under the penthouse floor and our room looked within adjacent buildings but still had light and really quiet !we didn't have to worry about someone from across building looking in like the other room.but the bathroom was stupid small in this room , we are talking the sink is the size of a small pot squished beside the toilet and miniature bathtub.the other corner room there was more space in bathroom but sink still on angle and tiny. But great local as you can walk unto 34 h street ,subway stations are close and taxis are always around and easy for them to head on down to Greenwich or Soho or such for dinner as we did alot.the front desk is very helpful and they have two computers to check email etc.Pen elopes is little breakfast jont down around corner on Lexington.we had coffee at the place almost next door on Madison they have strong coffee...no coffee in rooms or readily available at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in nyc without overpaying.”
Reviews.Author: kareneg061
Reviews.Content: I thought for $200 in nyc I would have to settle for a lot less. I was pleasantly surprised with how stylish and accommodating they were. Also location is perfectly central, rooms are quiet except for some roudy neighbors, free wireless, fitness, service is great- they upgraded us and even kept breakfast open longer. The little lounge is perfect for coffee, browsing the internet, meeting up with people. So glad I found this place. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: pumpkypie
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC to help my daughter who had surgery and we stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams during her recovery. What a find! The Hotel is centrally located, so incredibly comfortable, and the staff worked so hard to be certain we had everything we needed from safety pins to cabs. The room was big, by NY standards, bathroom and shower were wonderful. The fitness center was the perfect size and the decor was soothing yet trendy. Next time I go to NYC for pleasure, I will be staying at the Hotel Roger!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Orugco
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean Hotel room at a somewhat reasonable price in a good location in Manhattan, this may be a good choice. I come to New York several times a year and have passed by this hotel many times but never stayed there. Reason has been that in the good old days, when the economy was great, this hotel was booked solid during the fall season. Now I get a good price on a "flight plus hotel" deal on line.The superior room that I stayed in was clean and up to date withe every thing except a coffee maker. The draw back if any is that the superior room, which is less expensive than the Deluxe, is small. The bathroom is extremely small with hardly enough space to move around. However the staff is excellent, helpful and friendly. This hotel has a good fitness center which is not always available at other nearby hotels and though I did not eat at the restaurant, prices seemed reasonable with a limited menu selection. Breakfast buffet is adequate at around $22.00. I was told a "to go" breakfast menu is also available in your room including coffee and coruscant for about $12.00. If you stay here choose a upper level room where it's very quiet. This hotel has a nice modern appearance with happy bright colors that make you feel upbeat- as you should feel- in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Modern living”
Reviews.Author: kimtong21
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with friends. Made me think that I was staying in a European Boutique Hotel. Trendy, with bright colors the stay was nice. The television was an outdated tv, no flatscreen, but the plus was the electric operated blinds, which you could turn on from the convenience of your bed. Black out Blinds for those late risers. Loved the use of plush bathrobes, but also the hospitable staff, that always had a handy umbrella available at the front entrance. It was a RAINY and SNOWY weekend. The location was great, about three blocks from the train station, but the area was not loud with traffic so getting sleep was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Williams Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rod_37_11
Reviews.Content: Just spent an excellent 3 nights at the Roger Williams in Manhattan. We were upgraded to a room with a king-size bed, which was a very nice size for Manhattan, and the price for the three nights was very good value for New York. The room was very chic and modern with beautiful colors, and a very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The hotel reception is also very trendy and boutique style, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is very well situated on 31st and Madison, very close to the subway, and walking distance from a lot of great sites. Definitely would recommend this hotel and stay there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ReneeRichard
Reviews.Content: Well located walking distance to time square and all the stores on fifth avenue . Breakfast is very good excellent variety of food it's a buffet $18.00 Staff at reception is very friendly and efficient will definitely be back on my next trip to New-York

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and pleasant with some minor quirks”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: Reasonably large and attractive rooms for New York, but layout does not use space well. Very small desk area. Bathroom has a huge nice shower but little counter space and you have to lean over the toilet to get at the wash basin. Other than that, a very attractive decor, very clean, and--very important--the wireless internet works well. I find this location to be very convenient to a lot of Manhattan. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: kauaigirl65
Reviews.Content: The Roger was recommended by our daughter who stays there on business. This was our first trip to New York, and The Roger was one of the reasons our trip was so wonderful. Excellent staff who helped with restaurant recommendations. Some rooms can be very small, so make sure you know what you are getting when you book. We found the location very central to where we wanted to go, and loved the fact that there were more than several excellent restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely recommend The Roger!

Reviews.Title: “Short vacation trip”
Reviews.Author: antony p
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were bewildered by the choice of hotels on offer but settled on this one .It was excellent just far enough away from the hubbub of times sq etc but within walking distance of all the attractions makingit quieter in the e venings .There are many small restaurants in the area all were very good ,and recommended by the helpful and attentive .staff. The hotel and bedrooms were.extremely clean ,one small criticism perhaps a slightly enlarged house menu would be a benefit ,but generally a very nice place to stay and thoroughly recommend anyone to go ,we certainly would again

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for midtown New York”
Reviews.Author: Jet18
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel with pleasant decoration Rooms are spacious though bathroom could be upgraded Beds are of very good quality Free Wi-Fi in rooms and lobby is appreciated Restaurant and gym are quite small Sound insulation should be improved

Reviews.Title: “Great view, style, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nhudson88
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Roger Williams for her 21st birthday and we could't have made a better choice. I splurged for the Penthouse rooms with the terrace view and it was well worth it! The room decor was eclectic and clean, and the view was perfect. The hotel is in a quieter part of Madison Ave, yet just a short walk from just about everywhere in that part of the city. The check-in and check-out was very smooth and all the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was delicious! And the bed was probably THE most comfortable I had ever slept on in a hotel. Great stay, value, and location. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Seg800
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and service. For my first stay I was welcomed with a snack tray and a bottle of merlot. Clean and easy to get to. Rooms are smaller - but typical NY size. I love that it's not overly modernized but has all the things you need. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Roger, Williams, Jekyll, & Hyde”
Reviews.Author: EastByNE
Reviews.Content: Like the "two rooms, vastly different" review below, I have had polar opposite experiences in my two stays at this hotel. We were bumped up to the top floor on our first stay and the room was among the best I've had in Manhattan, ..spacious, ..view, ..balcony. On my next stay, I got a tiny room with no view and little light. Both were clean and well maintained, but it was a different hotel experience entirely. I have stopped by their charming lofted bar on subsequent trips, but I haven't flipped the coin on staying there since.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the extra costs!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler40_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and in a convenient location. The rooms were small but comfortable. However, be aware of the $20 daily charge that isn't revealed to you on hotwire until after you commit to the reservation. Also, even after I told them that I had taken NOTHING from the mini bar they still charged me over $20 for 4 cans of pop....very frustrating. Guy & Gallard (just 2 blocks away) is a great place for breakfast and they serve great coffee!!!!! Also, if you ask, you can get off site parking, self-serve, for $20/day!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: KateH2010
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through Magellan Vacations. In doing so I received an automatic upgrade to a Delux room and a complimentary breakfast. (A quick plug for Magellan my room rate was lowered twice before I stayed at the hotel. I just love this reservation service) The room was comfortably laid out and the decor was pretty hip. As others have mentioned the bathrooms are small. (In stretching out my arms I could touch both walls) The bed was comfortable and my room was quiet. The breakfast was fantastic. Every morning, eggs, potatoes and a meat item. Smoked salmon, cold cuts and cheese. Fresh fruit salad and gorgeous looking pastries. Would I have paid $23 if it wasn't included in my rate probably not as I tend to eat a small breakfast. One night I was too tired to go out so I ate in the restaurant. The menu selection is small however the food was delicious. The hotel is about a 30 minute walk from Central Park depending on how you catch the lights. The hotel employees were consistently helpful and courteous. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two rooms, vastly different”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, we asked for a very quiet room. We were put in a window-less tiny, tiny, tiny room at the back of the hotel, with a bathroom similar to the one some other reviewers have described-- the prison cell bathroom-- so tiny that you really have to be a master at maneuvering yourself between a door, a toilet and a sink. Yes, it was laughable (but only if you're in a good mood). In the morning, we asked to change rooms. The gentleman at the front desk was particularly nice. We didn't have to explain much why-- he got it-- and to make up for it, he put us in another room-- a vastly different room-- way upstairs, with a balcony! This one was like Shangri-La. Once it changed to this, we didn't want to leave. So be warned: there are really incredibly different types of rooms and sizes here. The lobby is cool-- the lighting and candles are nice. Morning breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bells”
Reviews.Author: clkane
Reviews.Content: We were in town for our son's wedding and occupied a great deal of the hotel. All of our needs were met in a timely and professional manner. We all received the best service throughout the weekend. From Neal & Lisa at the front desk to Ricky, Joe and Drew at the door, we were treated so exceptionally well that we felt spoiled. The staff in the bar were fantastic and stayed late to accommodate late night wedding revelers. The location is highly convenient. East side subway around the corner and access to other subway lines just three blocks away. The guys at the door were always able to hail cabs when needed. We are looking forward to staying here again when we visit our kids in New York.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkij N
Reviews.Content: like the location, smack in the middle of everthing. Shopping, dining, parks, church. Pleases every one. Only one down side, typical NY city, the rooms are SMALL but so art deco you wont notice exept if you are a space fanatic.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong Here”
Reviews.Author: BBNewton
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and the RW was the perfect place to stay. From Lisa at the front desk to the doorpeople getting us cabs, all went like clockwork. The rooms were very clean, spacious and efficient. The bathrooms are small, but thankfully I try to spend as little time in there as possible. My wife didn't complain about the size. Centrally located, 10 short blocks from GCS, Empire State Bld. We didn't eat there, but drank in the Mezzanine bar. The staff were all friendly. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 19magda88
Reviews.Content: The hotel Roger Williams in well placed in the city. We were there on business and we were able to walk to our appointments as well as restaurants & shopping in the evening. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. They responded to every need and request. It is unfortunate I did not take down the name of always smiling, young lady at the reception because I found her to be exceptional and very professional. The breakfast in the morning was a bonus. We didn`t need to leave the hotel site and spend extra time in a restaurant. They served a full & fresh breakfast buffet every morning, in my opinion, missing nothing. The only thing I did not like about the hotel was the size of the bed but this may be normal for nyc. We were 3 women and we thought we would have at least queen size beds but they were only small doubles in the entire hotel. We asked for a cott and they brought one up within minutes, which solved the problem immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Horrible Noise”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: This is one of those "it could have been amazing, but" reviews. This hotel is beautifully done, nice rooms, great staff, very professional and very helpful, great location, but the air conditioner in my room was so loud you had to turn the TV up to the highest setting to hear it. The real problem was that it cycled on and off all night and made sleeping very difficult. The front desk's response when informed of the problem; sorry. Sorry, the noise and the response were unacceptable. This could be a really great hotel except for not being able to sleep. On the up side, the location was wonderful and we had fun anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller bathroom than an RV!”
Reviews.Author: CheeseMouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with two double beds. I have NEVER seen a bathroom this small in a hotel. The sink looked like something from a prison cell, there was no tub, only a shower. I had to step into the shower to make enough room to close the bathroom door. There was a teeny tiny counter, not big enough for my cosmetic bag. I don't think someone tall or heavy would be able to use this bathroom. My two coworkers had normal sized bathrooms, so not every room suffers from this. Other than the bathroom, I thought the hotel was delightful. The location was convenient, close to a subway stop. I liked the funky decor. The lobby and bar were unusually spacious for a boutique hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hip environment, good location, great bfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jodi411
Reviews.Content: Roger Williams was a perfect hotel for a girls weekend. Beds are comfy, room was well kept, overall ambiance is hip. It's location in midtown is good. Our rate included bfast and it was super!! Will definitely be back next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A warm feeling”
Reviews.Author: mcquilter
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a well-traveled friend, this hotel has a knowledgable, helpful staff. For a small hotel, it has a lovely bar and breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaSini
Reviews.Content: I doubt I could have found a better value, better location or better doormen than at the Roger Williams. The service was sublime, the room was bright and clean, and it was a great spot from which to explore the city. We'll definitely stay here on our next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “This 'boutique' wasn't too small”
Reviews.Author: CiscoLegs
Reviews.Content: My friends and I enjoyed our stay here. The decent price we got on Priceline made us kind of worried, but it was great. The hotel is clean and new, and the room was as well. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but it was enough if it was just one person in there. The beds were also a little small (it seemed like it was in between a full and a twin), but they served their purpose. Although a bit small for 2 people who do not want to spoon, they were comfortable. I would stay here again. The proximity to bars, restaurants, and subway/path was convenient. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: SearchingUsa
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel. Bright, clean. Not too chainy or corporate or stuffy but very high quality and professional. Great central location and decent in-house restaurant. Every room in NYC is too small and too expensive, but the Roger Williams does very well with what it's got.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, chic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: orpheus
Reviews.Content: We stayed a long weekend in this small but clean and well designed hotel just a few blocks from Madison Square Park. The service was very good, no complaints. Room was small but sharp decor and good use of space with built-ins. Very comfortable bed and linens. The room (a double) was a bit small for a family, but would be ample for a couple. Bathroom also compact, but had everything you need. Overall, very good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JodyMichelle
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to subways, Empire state building, restaurants and bars (walking distance). Bar and restaurant in hotel small but pleasant. Air conditioning in the rooms was very noisy and not very cool. bathrooms clean though very small. closet space was small. Staff very pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: RozlynR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a week and it was great, the location is excellent and the staff are all helpful and courteous. We were informed of the extra daily room charge when we booked so it wasn't a problem and the price of the hotel was very reasonable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!!)”
Reviews.Author: NYBob6
Reviews.Content: At the corner of 31st St and Madison Ave, this hotel provides clean, honest rooms at a modest price for NYC. Beds excellent. Rooms spotlessly clean. Check in and leaving seamlessly efficient. The staff are all friendly, from the front desk, to the cleaning personnel. Close to subways, lots of restaurants. Free Wi-Fi!! Storage for clothing is minimal, but adequate. Bathrooms are quite narrow. But, all and all, a great place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Brit99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roger Williams a few times now, and remain a big fan of the property. The prices I have got have always been very reasonable for a New York hotel, and the service has also always been very friendly and professional. The rooms can be a little on the small side, but again not unreasonably so when you consider the price. They are modernly appointed, although can have relatively little windows in some. The last time i stayed I was given a penthouse room which was fantastic. The room itself was not a great deal bigger than the other rooms, but it came with a private roof terrace looking out over new york which was amazing. The bathrooms are relatively small, but i had no issues with them, they work well and are big enough for my needs. Overall a great, friendly place to stay, and always my first choice in new york city.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Will...never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher J
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a 3 mainly because the room itself was not too bad. However, I agree 100% with the gentleman Oilbern I believe who recently reviewed the bathrooms in this hotel. They are extremely small. At max you're looking at 3 inch of space between bathtub and toilet. I can just about reach both walls by stretching my hands out! Incredible! I also have to agree with him again about the holds they place on your accounts. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights and are still seeing money taken out of our accounts after a week! When you're booking this hotel be sure to ask about all the fees and surcharges. The surcharges are not included on the prices quoted to you but will be on your account whether you took advantage of the services or not. The only good thing a did enjoy while staying here was the baggage boys and doormen. They were helpful with getting our bags through their cramped hallways. If you want to stay on this side of town there are 3 other nice hotels in the area that will do a much better job than Mr. Roger. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pizzicatochgo
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel after booking through Priceline's name-your-price for the first time. Honestly, was a bit nervous at first at what kind of place I could end up at. Roger Williams is in a great convenient location without being in the middle of the hubbub of places like TImes Square. Nearby to the 4/5/6 subway line, walking distance to places like 34th St / 5th Ave shopping, Empire State Building, Macy's/Herald Square Stayed in Room 410 (pretty sure). Room was very clean, well stocked. Bathroom was tiny (it's NYC, after-all) and the shower occasionally spilled out onto the bathroom floor because the shower curtain was difficult to manage. But otherwise the bed was comfortable, there's a mini fridge, iron, lots of snacks/drinks, and a desk to do work at. No view: my window overlooked the alley behind the hotel. But for what I paid through Priceline, couldn't have expected a million dollar view. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Always greeting you and opening the door when you leave/arrive, offering to get you a taxi when you check out. Wifi and fitness room are included in an extra "service fee" of about $19/day. Didn't have a chance to check out the fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth5591
Reviews.Content: Love the location and the helpful staff. There is a clean and modern gym with a window. The rooms are small but well arranged and sylish. Very comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mvtourist
Reviews.Content: Usually when staying in NYC, my hotels have been 5 Star places like W Union Square or Ganesvoort Park Hotel - however, was going solo and couldn't justify spending $400 + . Found the Roger Williams through a Jet Setter sale - got a fabulous rate ($195). Was not expecting too much but was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location in Murray Hill about 3 blocks from the Empire State Building and basically a 10 min taxi ride to anywhere I wanted to go. I arrived late at night and the staff could not have been nicer and in fact every interaction with a hotel employee was excellent. They were always going out of their way to help. I booked an Executive King Room - my room was spacious. The bathroom was a decent size. Everything in the room was very clean. Appreciated the Aveda toiletries in the bathroom - again not expecting little details like this at the rate I got - yes there are some things in the basket that you pay for but it is VERY clearly marked so not sure why other reviewers were confused. Sheets and pillows were lovely and bed was very comfortable. Water pressure was nice in the shower. Only one nit pick and that is that the AC is quite loud but then again, I am quite noise sensitive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RochesterBob
Reviews.Content: Rooms are cozy, but you are in the city so you are just going to sleep there! Very convenient location; exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy, modern hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ReubenL
Reviews.Content: A good example of a tidy modern New York hotel with friendly and efficient staff, in mid town Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: -Chanelle-F
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the Roger Williams for 7 nights in July 2011. Overall the stay was great. Every single staff member was helpful and polite. They offered their tips on what to do in the city, made all of our reservations for us and were just generally friendly and helpful. They even said hello to us by name as we walked in and out of the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room - I was on holiday with a friend and we had 2 double beds in our room and lots of room for our suitcases and our shopping loot! Also, couldn't hear noise from the street, so our room was safe, clean, cozy and a nice place to end up after a long day. The rooms were perfectly cleaned every day. Beds and pillows were really comfortable. It was like staying in an upmarket hotel, but on a smaller scale and without the price tag. We didn't try the facilities in the hotel as we were close enough to walk and find deli's and cafe's for breakfast. Location was perfect - a few minutes walk away from the Empire State Building (highly, highly recommend buying an express ticket online before you go - you jump the queue and save about 2 hours!). We walked from Times Square to the hotel late one night and it felt long, even though its probably only about 15 mins. Cab fare to most places we went was $10-$15. We also did a 3 day hop on hop off bus tour - well worth the extra $$ for the 3 day pass as you save on admission to lots of attractions. The bus stop is at the Empire State Building, so a very convenient way to start the day. Could go on and on about the location - really it's just perfect. (We stayed in an awful place right near Times Square for 1 night as we passed through NYC before we had the 7 night stay.... gave me a terrible impression of NY hotels... the Roger Williams was brilliant) Will definitely be going back to NYC and will be staying at the Roger Williams again.

Reviews.Title: “Roger is slipping”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams a couple years ago and was pleasantly surprised by the quality for the price. Although the staff remained as helpful as ever, the rooms are not aging well, and it was very noisy. We had to call downstairs in the middle of the night (or to be precise, 4:30 a.m.) when another guest started pounding on a door down the hall for about ten minutes. There was also a party going on across the hall that was very loud. I realize these noise complaints make me sound like old man river, but it's notable because upon check-in guests are required to sign a statement that you will not make noise! Also, when we tried to shower on Sunday afternoon before going to a wedding, there was no hot water (not just for me, but my boyfriend as well). So I showed up for the wedding with dirty hair. It pains me to write this review, because we had a great experience previously as this hotel. I'm sorry to say that we probably will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wahinetoaAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were really nice - lovely modern decor - it felt clean and fresh. Beds extremely comfortable. The gym area and free use of computers were appreciated. The small dining area and also very nice and the breakfast was excellent. Would happily recommend. Not exactly cheap but then again this is in the heart of Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel. It's a safe, cozy haven in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Holligolightly
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Roger for several years now whenever in NYC for business and just love it. It is always very clean and the staff goes out of their way to be kind and professional. It has a super location. Most of the staff there are long term employees and they know many of the regular guests by name, including me. For a NYC boutique hotel it is great value for the money. It's not easy in a hectic city to find a safe, cozy haven. The Roger gives that and a lot of detailed amenities too, including a workout room, in-room wifi, and most importantly 24hr room service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: ggruber66
Reviews.Content: Great value based on the Hot Value price I got on Hotwire. Very nice lobby, rooms of reasonable size though would prefer if they had Queen instead of double beds. Big ups for Aveda Rosemary Mint hair products and discounted parking at the lot a few blocks away. My only quibble was the charge for items like toothpaste that were in the bathroom. It was not clear that you have to pay for them. And watch for the Foursquare specials. First check in = free drink.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of EVERY NY Trip”
Reviews.Author: happinnest
Reviews.Content: I was one of the luckiest people to get a great deal on this hotel with Hotwire. Reading the reviews over here helped but still, I wasn't sure what to expect. This hotel blew me off the chart. WOW, WOW WOW WOW... When we first arrived on July 1st, I was told we were being upgrated to a king size room and that made me feel LIKE A KING. the Staff are SO friendly. One night at 11 pm, we needed a restaurant recommendation and the front desk did EVERYTHING to make sure we get what we wanted. The rooms are great! at the end of the day, you're in Manhattan so you really cannot compare the room size to ANY other place in the world but my room was GREAT. It is clean, sooo modern and gives you such a cozy feeling. I really don't understand why people complained about the price tags.. I barely noticed them. I was also aware of the Resort Fee so that didn't cause me any problems whatsoever. I didn't try the breakfast, ended up having my breakfast EVERY DAY at Tasty across the street (love that place). Overall, I honestly don't see any reasons why ANYONE should miss a chance to stay at the Roger Williams hotel. Thanks guys, YOU ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: rs2512
Reviews.Content: Pros: Rooms are bright, definitely contemporary as they call it; Very spacious rooms in comparison to several other over priced Hotels in the same area, it begs to differ in that aspect; Ideal location - my husband and I were caught up in NY during the worse blizzard of the year, flights were being cancelled and couple of times airport was shut down. We had to frequent JFK three times from this Hotel and did not feel the pain of taking the subway despite heaps of snow. Super convenient. Feather in the crown is the friendly staff. They understood the pain we went through and the third night we stayed we were given a top floor room. No way of getting to the balcony, but still it was blessing in disguise! One night we also ordered room service and the food was pretty decent. Cons: over-priced toiletries

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: HamburgSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. As most hotels in New York that have a central location in Manhattan, it is expensive, but you can definitely also pay more for the same level of hotel. Talking about price: There are a lot of hidden cost elements that make the hotel more expensive than it looks at first sight: There is a so-called resort-fee that you have to pay for services such as health club and Internet access, even if you donÂ´t use them. If you want shower gel etc., which is usually provided in small containers for free at hotels, they will charge you for it, only the soap is free. Of course food and beverages from the minibar are always quite expensive in any hotel, but the prices in this particular hotel were simply ridiculous. So make sure you donÂ´t forget any toiletries at home and make sure you buy water etc. in supermarkets. There is a Deli right across the street. Rooms are also very small, but nicely designed and clean. On the positive side, staff was very helpful and friendly and the health club was very good quality, with individual TV screens on some of the treadmills. We did not try breakfast at the hotel because there are enough Delis and cafÃ©s in downtown Manhattan: CafÃ© Keko a couple of houses down the street has good quality food, and a very nice atmosphere, but is expensive (we paid almost 50 USD for breakfast for 2 people, including tip). CafÃ© 28 on the corner of 28th street/5th Avenue is more of a supermarket and deli with a couple of tables to sit, and not exactly a quiet place, but it has an excellent selection of food for breakfast, so if you donÂ´t mind the noise, it is a good place to go as an alternative to the hotel breakfast. Overall we found the hotel okay, because a lot of alternative hotels in similar locations would have been either even more expensive or much worse quality.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a chance to stay here, do it.”
Reviews.Author: ShowHorseFan
Reviews.Content: Comfy and convenient. Luxe and hip but friendly, too. Sometimes, staff at midtown Manhattan hotels can be snooty - but not this one. Even in the hip cocktail lounge that evening, the servers were friendly and treated everyone with the same genuine good cheer. The room decor is colorful and pretty with bright upholstery and pillows. I liked the sliding rice paper screens as window treatments. The room is laid out in clever ways. The closet was shallow (not wide for both winter coat and hanging suits, let alone had two people shared the room) so I was glad I was only staying overnight. A word of advice with the bathroom products. Part of the tray is free, the other side is paid. The tray dividing line is obvious. No one cosmetics company provided products, although they were premium supplies. I enjoyed the breakfast, which isn't free, but where else will you find prosciutto on a breakfast buffet? The location is convenient. I walked with my rolling suitcase from Grand Central. A block or two uptown from the hotel is the Morgan Library, which is fascinating to visit and has a nice gift shop. Economical dining is also available in the area.. I would love to stay there again someday.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Roger Williams Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanna1972
Reviews.Content: What a great service.....we stayed at the Roger Williams Hotel from the 18th of May, 2011 for 12 nights for our 10th year anniversary and we enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is situated very close to the Empire State Bldg and to Macy's and generally is ideally for walking in Manhattan. Very safe area, never felt insecure (police is everywhere) and the service of the hotel is extremely good. A big thank you to the Marketing Manager and the lady in the concierge who upgraded us to the "perfect room"...

Reviews.Title: “Great little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lees515
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams Hotel is a nice little boutique hotel on Madison and 31st Streets. I got a hotwire deal, so it was about $200 a night. It's immaculate, the service people are nice, and it's in a good location. I had a single room with two beds, and have a few caveats. First, there's no coffee maker. then, the bathroom is miniscule. There was hardly enough space for my make-up bag, so I don't know how two people could share this room. Then, there is no view to speak of: the view is of the roof. But, the room is very quiet, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent sized rooms (for manhattan)”
Reviews.Author: miss_doyle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a week, we'd booked a room with a king sized bed but they didn't have any available when we checked in, they said that the booking company (hotels.com) hadn't passed through the request. As this has happened to me before when not booking direct I think this us probably true. The staff were all helpful and efficient and the room was clean enough and there was plenty of space to move around, there was quite a big area at the foot of the two queen beds. My only criticism would be the lack of coffee making facilities in the room, although there is a very convenient Italian deli/corner shop on the corner of Maddison and 31st that seemed to do the best coffee on the row and had a self service selection of pastries and is great for things like bottles of water, bags of chips or beers for the room. The bits and bobs you can buy from the room (selection in tub on mini-bar and in holder in bathroom as well as the mini-bar itself) are eye wateringly expensive ($6 for a not very big bottle of water placed on bedside table) but there is really no need to use them, there are so many places nearby where you can get whatever you need. I would recommend the hotel because the location is so great, it is really easy to get around from there whether on foot or subway (several stops within a few blocks walk) and because the rooms are a great size, the hotel is nice but we just used it as a place to crash so no idea what restaurant or bar are like. The one thing that isn't clear, depending on how you booked, is that there is a $19 per night service charge, I had spotted on reviews but didn't realise until after I booked, the hotel is still good value for manhattan though.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you get the right price”
Reviews.Author: anthropology
Reviews.Content: We go to NY regularly and often stay with family but over the years we have stayed in a lot of the mid range properties, Algonquin, Iroquious, Shoreham, Mansfield, Bentley etc. We picked the Roger Williams because I got an excellent deal on a flight and hotel package which made the stay MUCH cheaper, do check out the prices for a package - it may be well worth it. To me the hotel is well located, close to the eastside line of the subway and far enough from Tim Sq not to be too tourist. It was easy to walk to the MOMA and take the subway to the museums on the east side. The room was clean and bright. The bathroom as others have noted is very small but it didn't bother us. I would have like tea making facilities in the room. The front desk staff are professional and they have proper bell men, they were very helpful about storing our bags. There isn't a restaurant or bar but there is a Mezzanine lounge where breakfast and drinks are served. Overall a good choice if you can get the right price. Functional, colorful with some sense of style it was a convenient base for four days. I wish I could give it three and a half stars.

Reviews.Title: “JEWEL IN THE CROWN!”
Reviews.Author: shauno244
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on an expedia search and having read the reviews gave it a whirl. For seasoned travellers visiting the big apple for the first time this place was such a find. The staff without exception were polite, courteous and very helpful. It is a quaint yet quirky boutique styled hotel with all the essential amenities. The gym was great but it did not feature on our packed itinery! We stayed for 6 nights from 24/04 and could not fault the value or cleanliness. Another major factor is the location, being on the corner of 31st and Madison - such a great location to hit all the iconic spots in Manhatten - also a couple of minutes from the subway. The rooms are a little tired but bright, breezy and more than ample for a base to discover all that New York has to offer. The King size bed a bonus as it was so comfy. The only downside is the strange nineteen dollars you have to pay per room as a "service charge" upon departure per night - it would be better embedded into the price. Apart from that it could not be faulted - we would go back and will recommend to friends, work colleagues and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Good location. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pasadena67
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel through from a travel website. I never heard of this hotel, but the price seemed pretty reasonable. Upon arrival the staff was first rate. The room was to my liking, and when I requested if I could move to a room with double beds, the front desk clerk was more than accommodating. They even moved our luggage for us while we were out sightseeing. The location is blocks away from all of the popular sights and the mom and pop restaurants in the area are a nice touch. I would stay here again when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Service Ever in NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinecj81
Reviews.Content: Both parents and teenagers cannot say enough good about our recent weekday stay at the Hotel Roger Williams. The staff - from curb side to desk to wait staff - is the friendliest we have ever had in NYC. The decor as seen online seemed like it might be a bit 'off' but is actually quite charming, modern, and fun. This is the first time our family stayed in mid-town. It was between our activities - down to Wall Street and up to Upper West Side - and the kids were old enough to handle the walks and subways. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very goo stay -real 4stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: titi02051971
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the hotel website. Very goiid price/quality ratio. We received an upgrade in an executive room (birthday + included in the offer we paid for). Room is very nice, spatious with a very comfortable kingsize bed. Well isolated from the street evenb tough noise coming from air conditioning system. Breakfast was included in our room price and was amazing in all terms. Fresh fruits, ham (Italy) and salmon. All in all a high quality breakfast proposed by this charming boutique hotel. Service was discret and professional. Number of seats is limited.I strongly recommend this hotel to all who want to spend a relax stay in NY without paying 300 euros for a night and well placed in Midtown, close to the empire building and Fifth avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Simple rooms but great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BrianFromPhila
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RWH for one night back in September 2010. I made the reservation through a "secret deal" on Travelocity and it was pretty reasonable (for NY standards). The hotel was perfect for what we needed. Very nice staff, small but modern and clean rooms, and a good location. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ename8
Reviews.Content: It is a boutique hotel so yes,,,,small... but if you don't want to stay "all the way" downtown the location of this hotel is perfect. I have to agree that the bathrooms are not great,,, the rooms- although not huge- are very nice. I would have to say in NYC it is one of my top 5 hotels right now!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Roger Williams Rock”
Reviews.Author: Ramachandraniyer
Reviews.Content: NEW YORK, it was my first time at newyork and again i found this hotel online while searching for, it was the cheapest that i could find and also near to TimesSquare so that i could enjoy the nightlife after the work. The entrance was really nice, the hotel looked classy from outside with 2 guys in long winter clothes welcoming you and getting your luggage out from th cab and helping to take it in. The Front Desk people were 2 charming girls with a broad smile on there face :). as i had been to SFO before so i had exhausted some credit on my cards and was low on them, i had to swipe it for guarantee which was not going through, and these guys were so helpful that they agreed for me to pay them the whole stay amount in cash upfront which not many hotels does as it is a risk for them. and then i paid them the cash and the keys were handed over way on the 17th floor and non-smoking one as i dont smoke. The moment i entered the room one thing i noticed was that the room was smaller than expected, though it had all amenities and a TV which did not have much channels, but the room was cozy with a nice view of the city from the window, which made me forget the room size :). Then next morning i had to order breakfast as it was not included in my room tariff. The breakfast was amazing for 15$ with a fruit bowl, bread and coffee. Overall the staff were well mannered and respectful. The rooms were small but it was worth for the money i paid and was cozy too. Also i saw another thing when i checked out, A couple came in and it was there honeymoon trip, and the front desk offered them a upgrade when they came to know about the trip which is really awesome on there part. I would surely recommend this hotel for stay in NewYork. As my title says ROGER WILLIAMS ROCK

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bathroom ever!!”
Reviews.Author: jsEyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights for a conference in the city. The first room they gave us was directly in front of the elevators. Noisy. I called down to the desk before we even took our coats off. They were very nice and moved us right away. The bathroom in the 2nd room was the smallest I have ever seen. Two women trying to get ready in the morning--almost impossible. You could not stand directly in front of the sink because the toilet was in the way! I guess I should have complained again. I chose this hotel because of the good reviews. I did not see a room like that! The hotel itself was nice, great bar area, staff friendly. I most likely won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique with a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: This trendy boutique with a edgy design is in a perfect location for the NYC visitor. The staff was polite and helpful and the basic room nicely appointed and comfortable enough for the solo traveller. However the room stunk of cigarette smoke (this is supposed to be a no smoking hotel) that permeated the bedding. I called to have the bedding changed, but returned four hours later, it hadn't been. The other HUGE issue I had was this hotel charges an extra $19 to anybody booking the room on Hotwire. This is the only hotel that I know of that does this (I am a frequent Hotwire user) and this unique fee is only disclosed at CHECKOUT not at check-in. The woman at the front desk was apologetic but it is a cheesy move by the hotel and soured me on a place that would nickle and dime me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Friendly and Colorful”
Reviews.Author: L-02UK
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams is a trendy and lively place to stay. The reception staff is friendly and efficient and the lobby has a welcoming feel due to the fact that it is neither too big, nor too small â€“ and furnished with lots of sofas and armchairs. The room is rather average but with all usual amenities, e.g. an i-Pod docking station. TVâ€™s are mounted to the wall â€“ which unfortunately lets you participate in the tv-program of your next door neighbor (although my neighbor might have been hearing impairedâ€¦). Bathrooms are rather small, but functional and well equipped. Overall, the use of color and indirect lighting gives the room a nice flair. The small breakfast buffet is a highlight â€“ with great bakery products and a nice setting overlooking the lobby; although it gets rather crowded during main breakfast hours

Reviews.Title: “beware of the Ice cold room colder than the hallway.”
Reviews.Author: skyybluebunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel assigned me to an ice cold room where the heating was not working. After unpacking I called down to the front. Suggestion was to turn off the heater. I asked for an extra blanket. The house keeping came and suggested that I get my room changed since the room was one of the coldest rooms in the building. When I stepped out to see the next room, I realized how cold my room was compared to the hallway. The next room that they suggested had an enourmously loud heater noise. So I asked for a better room. Other issues included replenishment of amenities were inconsistant. I had to ask call down for replenishment twice. The good parts are, the beds are comfortable, people were very kind and helpful. Inspite the bad taste on day one, the bell and housekeeping attendee provided great service in helping me out with the situation. Bottomline, they should not have put anyone up in the rooms when NYC is having the coldest winter. Might be a great room for the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ParisMilanDayton
Reviews.Content: Stylish, spotless, and with very attentive staff, who at the same time are friendly and avoid becoming obsequious. Good location, couple of blocks from the action but I prefer to Times Sq. Great breakfasts. Some of the rooms are a little 'compact' but all are comfortable stylish bolt holes. Those balconies are great!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: 19MAIOY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super.Everybody friendly,modern,spacius rooms with nice and clean bathrooms. Very close to the Empire State building,Macy's and Victoria's secret if you love shopping. Free internet acess and across the street a lot of cabs to move around and a place to have the best bagels for breakfast.I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: shannatic
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near shops and restaurants, clean, airy and well equipped rooms with funky decor and friendly staff. Loved the free apple cider on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “M”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_33
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after a bad experience with another hotel on new year night. The service at 11 on new year night was impeccable. Classy and attentive and yet accessible and not at all overbearing. That is excellent service. The location is great and the rooms modern. I love their choice of shampoo and soap (Aveda!) and all the other little thinigs that gives this place a feel of botique hotel. but of all that , it is the service that will make me come back.

Reviews.Title: “Two Vibes In One Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxeFan
Reviews.Content: Is it the view or the vibe? Is it the Euro esthete or the calm Manhattan air? Whatever "it"is, the Hotel Roger Williams bears and bestows fun, elegance and relaxation upon all who enter. I tell my " knowledgable" Manhattan friends about this confident gem perfectly situated a long walk away from the village, a blink and broad step away from Penn Station, and they tilt their heads - incredulous that the name is foreign to them. Roger Williams? I am not surprised - with over 100 business visits to this city under my belt, I only discovered this hotel when booked here by a client a few years ago. "Foreign" and "Euro" are worn proudly and without pedantry by the genuinely pleasant and very well-trained staff.
