Probably because the look and layout feel and sound so European. accents and foreign languages imbue the air -from the German attendant at the buffet breakfast to almost every guest on the elevator. So... Great location, beautiful look and feel, wonderfully attentive and friendly young staff, and competitive rates. When traveling to the Greatest City In The World, what more would one want? Book the Hotel Roger Williams now, and be sure to have a glass of wine and some appetizers as the sun sets. Watch guests ramble and shuffle in and out, and enjoy tasty steak au poivre with a nice glass of quality vino. Go. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Murray Hill”
Reviews.Author: zurak87
Reviews.Content: Located on the SW corner of 31st & Madison. We missed it the first time around due to all the Christmas lights on the facade. Second time around, the courteous doorman flagged us down. Checkin was easy. Valet parking was $50 per day. Rather large lobby with many seating options for a NYC hotel. The two elevators can get busy at times. Our 12th floor room was modern and ecletic. It was right in front of the elevators. The hallway had a bright green color scheme. The room had two full size beds, a 27" tube tv, a small desk with chair, a safe, a robe, a stocked minibar, reading lights over each bed, a series of three Japanese window screens to control the outside light. The only window in the room opened a few inches and had an electronically controlled shade. The bathroom had a sliding glass door with a stainless steel sink, a glass enclosed shower with a strong stream. Even from the 12th floor you could still hear street noise, sirens, etc. Our room faced 31st steet and had a view of the office building across the street. The staff greets you all the time as you enter and leave the hotel. The hotel is close to an infinite number of restaurants. This is my wife's new favorite for Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Budget Friendly Hotel in Murray Hill”
Reviews.Author: cindychittenden
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Roger Williams Hotel for one night on December 18th. We were excited to know that we could walk from Grand Central Station with our luggage. The hotel was clean with funky decor, great staff - Thanks Jacob for advising us to go to Rattle & Hum (walking distance Irish bar). We were about 10 blocks from Time Square and had plenty of restaurants in the area. Our hotel provided Aveda products and again, did I say the hotel rooms were clean? It was also so quiet we couldn't hear anyone else. We used quickbook.com for the sweet deal. Very many thanks to nywhiz (NYC expert on TA) for all your help and suggestions! Oh! We also went to the Oasis spa for a massage- walking distance- Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good Luck”
Reviews.Author: dbalex
Reviews.Content: Happy to find a room due to the blizzard on the 26th and having been interested in staying at this hotel, I booked a room at Roger Williams. Unfortunately, booking on Hotwire doesn't allow you to cancel which was the first thing I thought upon entering the room. - Room that looked as though it were a just moved in dorm room that had no thought put to it - Pillows that were shams meaning they weren't changed from the previous guest - Bathroom so small that the sink was positioned to use while standing in the bathroom doorway - Toilet on which to sit you needed to pull your thighs under the sink which was positioned over a small portion of the toilet - Shower that was visibly damaged along the entire base where pieces of tile were missing - A heater so loud you had to turn down to listen to reports about the storm This hotel was completely unacceptable. Again, glad I had a room for the night but stay away if you're seeking a place of comfort. FYI, moved a couple of blocks down Madison to the Carlton - similarly priced - which is great, comfortable and if I get stuck a few more days would be well worth it. Unless there is a complete renovation, I cannot recommend the Roger Williams.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roger maybe a dozen or more times traveling on business to New York. The front house staff are great, very friendly, good local knowledge and always willing to help out. The rooms though are not great. They are generally extremely small, with paper thin walls, and - literally - paper based window treats. So cold air gets in easily as does the noise. They try putting in little "W" like touches like little notes saying "Roger invites you for a cocktail" but it just doesn't work and the bar itself is small and not much fun. There is a gym I've used a couple of times, not bad but as with everything else in the hotel very small. If you can get a great deal then fine but don't expect too much

Reviews.Title: “First night is iffy, will update each night...”
Reviews.Author: charlestonchef
Reviews.Content: Chose the HRW for location, period. Chose a penthouse suite, as we always upgrade to a larger room. What a disappointment. The room is minuscule. Of course, most NYC rooms are small, but we paid a premium for a penthouse suite. What did that get us? A 300 sq. Foot room with a balcony the size of a railing. Upon check-in, we noted that the room price was $30 less than what was advertised on their website. The agent said he could do nothing. He also failed to give ANY information of what the penthouse was supposed to include - no briefing of the morning pantry, evening cocktails or or our preference of bath essentials (all selling points on the web site.) not even an upgrade was offered, after our inquiry of the price difference, even though a much better room was available at a lower price. Again, we still love the location, and will post again tomorrow to let you know how things are going. On a positive note, the staff of " the pantry.," on the mezzanine level, were wonderful tuis evening. Gave me the info I sought, and an ice bucket to hoot!

Reviews.Title: “The Roger is always my first choice when travelling to NYC”
Reviews.Author: mt1_12
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams offers amazing service, fun & clean (but small) rooms in a central location. It is always my first choice when planning a trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kdutkiew
Reviews.Content: There was absolutely nothing impressive about this hotel. We were moved here from an alternate hotel for what still seem like unknown reasons. The lobby was a little misleading, as the remainder of the hotel was very poor quality. Our room was small and uncomfortable from everything from the shower to the air temperature. Staff seemed disorganized. Will not return or ever recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps one of the best non-chain hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: Ed210
Reviews.Content: While traveling way too much, I have never been inclined to write a review on TripAdvisor (even though I use it often for research). So the fact that I am writing this...and that I have not even checked out yet...speaks volumes. I was weary before arriving based on several of the reviews...but I must tell you...this is a fine hotel and it is operated with refreshing attention to detail and hospitality. Literally every employee has greeted me, pleasantly, genuinely, and warmly. I have felt like an honored guest...and this being my 4th night on the road this week...I needed be to treated like an honored guest. Often times a cleverly designed hotel leaves its reputation to the design and places operational excellence as a secondary attribute. That's not the Roger way! From the front desk accomodating every request I have made (asked politley and pleasantly...I might add), to the cleanliness of the room, to the warm smile from my housekeeper on 12 this morning, to the location is 1 block from the Subway...a brisk 5-10 minute walk from Penn Station...close to Union Square...it is an ideal property run and operated by people that care about their guests. Regarding the food, I would suggest the dinner menu is one of the smartest hotel menus I have seen in a long while. The food was cooked to precision (even at 1015pm) and Melissa and her team demonstrated a standard of service typically lacking in hotel restaurants/bars. If you're not into unique properties and like the predictable beige of Marriott...Roger may not be for you. I for one hope to become a frequent guest.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLSMiami
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good stay at the Roger Williams. The lobby is spacious and well-appointed, and the lounge on the mezzanine level is also attractive. The front desk staff is pleasant and efficient, and the doormen were friendly and helpful, with the exception of one who had a bit of an attitude, slammed cab doors, and leered at women. The previous reviewer is correct regarding the climate control - the heat is turned up way to high, and even if you turn it off, the room stays hot. We figured out how to open the window a bit to get some fresh air, but then you have to deal with noise from the street. The hallways are narrow and noise from room attendants cleaning and people slamming doors is an issue. The water pressure in the shower is quite weak. The price isn't outrageous for the convenient midtown location - worth staying in if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, A/C was very noisy, food was very bad”
Reviews.Author: thmpsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roger for one night, the service was very good. The A/C in the room was very noisy. The food at the hotel was not good. Ordered salmon and had to send it back 2 times before it was even cooked.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday stay”
Reviews.Author: rastagrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, nice, chic, great location and very friendly staff. Loved the breakfast buffet and the self parking at $20 was really cheap for NYC. Looking forward to staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Easy stuff should be easy.”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams has a nice location within walking distance of Penn Station. Good. It has decent-sized rooms for Manhattan, and while it wasn't exactly cheap, comparable hotels in the same area cost more. Not bad. So what does it do wrong? Stuff that's easier to get right. When one guest is being assigned a dozen rooms with keys by one guy at the front desk, chances are it's going to look bad when you tell me there's no rooms available an hour before check-in. And when you ask me if I want a queen or two double beds and I say a queen, please don't assign me a room with two doubles when I come back a few hours later. And if I call from my misassigned room and just ask for a lowly bucket of ice because there's no ice machines to be found, please, assume that I actually meant it and bring one up. Including checkout, I had a total of four interactions with hotel staff, and three of them were totally unsatisfactory. That is a bad percentage.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: losbrushes
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Quiet hotel. Sort of away from major attractions. Rooms a decent size. Only complaint is the sheets are way too stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Never have we experienced a friendlier staff!”
Reviews.Author: JoanSyracuse
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms...bathrooms are small but the rooms are a decent size! The staff, from the reception desk to the maids to the doorman...everyone was so friendly and extremely helpful!! A very well trained staff for sure. People make the difference! Seems to have been recently remodeled! We enjoyed our stay immensely!

Reviews.Title: “This quality - in NYC?”
Reviews.Author: AuntLucille
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in NYC with no place to stay. We lucked into Roger Williams Hotel by accident, and it saved our sanity. The room was nice, although details were broken or cheap, and it wasn't entirely clean in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and soothing, although we could hear the next door room occupant fill and use their bathtub. The people who worked at RWH were amazingly nice from start to finish - everyone, including the cleaning people, doorman, and behind the desk. The people serving the continental breakfast were also charming and happy. Happy workers indicate a good working/staying environment for travelers. If you're new to NY, be sure to ask for a map and directions at the desk or from the doorman. There are some excellent restaurants in the area - just walk and find them. Think barbecue or FIKA coffee, as well as more elegant and expensive fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. Simple basic but clean.”
Reviews.Author: wesline
Reviews.Content: Okay, So we are a bunch of girlfriends coming from Canada, staying in New York for the weekend. We saw four stars and expected classy, modern and expensive. Well instead we good, clean, simple and proper. This a nice little place.. The best location EVER!!! Rooms are not very very big, but nice and colorful and quite original. The staff is amazing, polite, nice and ready to help. One night, the heat stopped working and they brought up a space heater and offered us extra covers or anything to help. Witch was very much appreciated! If you want to visit New York, enjoy the nightlife, eat great food, go for long walksâ€¦ Honestly, this place will be the answer to all your needs!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgilly47
Reviews.Content: We were out in NY checking out colleges with our son. We found this hotel and it was reasonably priced with a great location. The service and hospitality was excellent, the location was a quick walk from Penn Station (10 min) and several local restaurants. The staff was great and the rooms are colorful and clean--not huge by any stretch but very adequate. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet--it was very good but overpriced for what was provided. The Tasty Cafe right across the street was a much better value--and excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Advice for guests”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: I have previously reviewed this facility and I thought it was OK for the price (but not great). However, here is information for those guests who utilize the internet. I was in one room where the internet speed was an abysmal 0.5 Mb/s (barely over the telephone rate). I switched to another room where the speed was 20x as fast at a very good 10 Mb/s. Strange, but one should be alert to this before accepting a room. (Also, cell phone service can be very iffy on the interior rooms that have no outside windows.) Other than that, pretty much the same. Don't look for MSNBC on the TV's, it's not there., nor is HD offered even though the TV's would support it. Elevator service can be a little slow. Otherwise, it continues to be satisfactory for the price.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel with a lot to cover”
Reviews.Author: raylaw323
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roger for 4 days. The rates are very high on its website but got a much lower rate on a third party website. The service from the front counter is hit or miss. The rooms are moderate size by New York standards. The website makes you think that the hotel is bigger than what it is. There is absolutely no public open air terrace, for example, and the website makes one believe that there is. The restaurant/bar on the second floor is tiny. We checked in very early (7:30 a.m.) and there were no rooms available. We agreed to wait a few hours at a relative's home in Manhattan. I called at 11:30 a.m. and was told rudely that rooms were still not ready and that I shouldn't call them as they would call me instead. I asked for the manager and she was helpful and got me a room right away. When I brought this to the attention of the front counter manager a few days later he told me that the next time perhaps I should pay for an extra night just so I am assured a room when I come in early. This has got to be the worst advice I have ever received. In other words pay them about $300 to save them from providing customer service. The rooms lack closet space but are clean and comfortable. The beds are good. Some rooms have the windows covered by shades because otherwise they would show a brick wall. The location is excellent. I would recommend only if the price is less than $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel--would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: jamulb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. The hotel was cute, clean and comfortable. It has a modern feel that I love. The staff was also very nice. It's also in a nice location. The bar upstairs was small but had a nice atmosphere. Would highly recommend it to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: droenna
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very modern and stylish. We had a room on the tenth floor which had a small balcony and from there we could see the Empire State Building which was a 5 minute walk away. We had expected the rooms to be small (seemingly par for NY) but ours was a good size. Very comfy bed. The location couldn't have been better. The public rooms are very relaxing, the staff very helpful and friendly. Would happily recommend. One thing to consider when booking, make sure you pay the taxes up front, as to some this is an addition not expected. Also, they have an extensive range of toiletries (in addition to the usual soap, shampoo etc) which have to be paid for. I've read reviews where people have been surprised by this......

Reviews.Title: “Clean boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bermy80
Reviews.Content: I reserved my hotel online but due to a flight cancellation, had to miss my first nite. Although I didn't give the required 24 hours notice of cancellation, the staff were very understanding and agreed that my first nite would not be charged. The room was very clean and a great size. My only gripe was that I didn't have a view from my room. The window is behind a rice-paper sliding door/blind which sits just behind the headboard, so even if you do have a view, you can't enjoy it. I also found this hotel a little pricy, but what hotel in NYC isn't...They have a service charge of $19 that they add to your bill each day, so be mindful of that when booking online. Overall, I had a good experience at this hotel and loved that they had free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for Penthouse suites”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganWineLover
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the penthouse garden terraces....one of the smallest rooms I've have ever stayed in.....the first room they gave us didn't even have a king bed..Thankfully the bellman. called down and helped us get a room with one..Garden terrace was a roof top balcony about 8 feet by 3 feet with planters on both ends.....bathroom was also extremely small .....for the dollar you might as well get a basic suite, it could not be any smaller than our room.....as for the rest of the hotel.....great service by everyone....very clean.....nice breakfast included......great location....walking distance to Broadway/subway/shopping

Reviews.Title: “RW-Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Rosie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Roger Williams far exceeded my expectations. The hotel staff is wonderful --- from the front desk to the cleaning help everyone has a smile and makes a best effort to accomodate your requests and needs. My PC did not have wireless capabilities so they searched for a room that was "hard" wired and met my specifications. The first room they found did not have a large enough desk for my purposes . . . the staff cheerfully moved me. The shower and bath soaps were very nice - Aveda, bed linens good quality, pillows blankets . . . lovely. What was especially surprising was the quality of the food in the small mezzanie bar area - do try the Filet "bites" - - - excellent. The bar/restaurant area is small, modern, bright with great music in the background. After a tough day in the heat and humidity of Manhattan - - - what a nice way to start the evening. The only complaint would be that the carpets on some floors seemed a bit tired. . . but aside from that I can not think of anything that wasn't perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience/great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stacious017
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roger Williams at the beginning of August. This was our first time visiting the city and did not know what to expect. I chose to stay at this hotel because of the location and did a lot of research on trip advisor. This hotel is very clean, and accommodating. Our stay here was short, but very worth the money spent. We arrived early afternoon and were eager to check out the city. We were able to check in early. We also had a late flight home, so the hotel as willing to have us check out but store our luggage while we did some last minute shopping. The rooms are very clean, but be careful of all the extra goodies they charge for in your room. The king bed was super comfy and the maid was in everyday to clean. The location of this hotel is great because we were able to take an 8 minute cab right uptown and downtown and its only a 15-20 minute walk to time square. We are defintiely planning to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lapsrus
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. I have never stayed in this part of Manhattan before, but it turned out to be quite convenient. I stayed in a Deluxe room (one step above the bottom rung) and it was about the normal NYC size. I got it on Hotwire, and it was about $100 less than I am used to paying in NYC. I was only on the 3rd floor, but they put me in the back where the view was of the HVAC equipment, but was VERY quiet. The bed was great and I slept very well. The room was clean and in very good shape. Very pleasant surprise. Front desk people were nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: FernandoLyrio
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located, but certainly not the best location in NYC. Good but expensive breakfast. Very clean and spotless rooms, although a bit small (they seem to have been renovated recently). Services by all staff are extremely good. Definitely a hotel I would recommend to other people, especially for its good cost-benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, the room, the staff all impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamperA2
Reviews.Content: We went for our FIRST ever weekend away without our two kids. We had a wonderful time, the staff were amazing and sent us to some incredible places to eat and that in turn sent us into new trendy places we would not have seen before. I can't say how much I enjoyed my time in this hotel and think it was worth every penny. It's a tad pricey but so is everything in this city. totally worth every moment.

Reviews.Title: “great place to be a repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: toomuchkash
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel roger williams.. The staff is always so helpful and the restaurant has a great menu!! We are arriving on monday the 16th to get our oldest daughter set up in her dorm room to start at Parsons .. This is a very exciting time for our family and we are lucky to have found a place like this for all our return visits to visit our daughter!!T this is our 4th stay here!! Just a very small and friendly spot TO COME AND STAY OR JUST FOR DRINKS..

Reviews.Title: “Good service and great interiors”
Reviews.Author: globetrot42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed staying at this hotel after a long drive from Maine. The interiors in the room were tastefully done which made us feel at home...especially the colors in the room, matching quilt and all. We loved the ceiling mounted showerhead with steady flow. The location is great to catch a bus or train to any part of Manhattan that I could get to my business meetings easily and so was my wife to exploring art in the city

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but beware of the amenities charge”
Reviews.Author: sisam
Reviews.Content: I've booked 4 nights at the Roger for our trip to NYC thru hotwire. I was unpleasantly surprised to find out that we'd to pay an extra fee of $19 per night AFTER the non refundable/ non changable booking. Our room and the hotel in general were very good. We also liked the location. Before we arrived at the hotel, I emailed and faxed them a few times and never heard back which I thought was strange.This and the extra fee are the only negatives about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but A/C had trouble keeping up”
Reviews.Author: manchesterUnited08
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my wife for 3 nights while we were apartment shopping. The first night we were stuck with a 2 bed room because it was sold out. We asked to get moved to a room with a king bed, and while we were out the next day they moved our stuff and our new keys were waiting for us when we returned. The rooms we stayed in were nice and clean, and actually pretty large for Manhattan. The beds were also pretty comfortable. The only issue was that the A/C could barely keep up. The temps were in the mid 90s and the humidity high, but I still expected better. We left the thermostat at 50 and the fan on the whole time, but our room was stuck a bit warmer than we would've liked. It was definitely tolerable, but worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel - good as a base”
Reviews.Author: lauraq44
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel last week and to be honest we weren't blown away by it. Considering the price we paid, I know that we could've gotten somewhere much more central and bigger than this hotel. The rooms are TINY - even when we complained and got moved - the room was actually smaller (but we got a balcony). Nice, but we asked for a bigger bedroom! Don't have food at this hotel - there are lots of nice restaurants nearby. Ask at reception - they gave us some great tips!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: lv4488
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with my stay at the Roger Williams but I wasn't blown away. It was a small, tidy boutique hotel. Everything was fine but a couple a couple of things bothered me. As you enter the room you are greeted by a basket full of food that you can buy, in the bathroom there are bath supplies to buy. It just seemed cheap to me. I liked the small desk but there was no leg room since the desk was also a bureau. I found it a challenge to work at my computer because of the design. Everything else was fine but I won't be racing back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lasankofa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location for sightseeing and restaurants in Manhattan. The service was friendly, and the rooms were nice. The decor was a little strange, but how much does decor really matter anyway? We thought the hotel was a bit overpriced, but we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at this place”
Reviews.Author: Krisgrmi
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a weekend with stay here. It's a cute boutique hotel, close to the subway and Grand Central. Our rooms were stylish but a bit small, but this is Manhattan, so we expected it and were overall satisfied. The difference here was the phenomenal staff. The doorman was always friendly and helpful, and the front desk staff was always greeting us warmly with a "welcome back". The most impressive part however, was the personalized response to our needs. The front desk helped us print our boarding passes the night before we left to save us time. The morning we left, my husband broke the zipper on our luggage, and Victoria at the front desk told us to come down and helped him wrap and tape the luggage, even giving us extra plastic and tape in case we needed to re-do it after the security check at the airport. She was amazingly helpful, nice and did it all with a smile. She was definitely a friend in need! I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They Try Awfully Hard”
Reviews.Author: dnrobert24
Reviews.Content: My main gripe with the Roger Williams is that they wanted to charge me an $18 service fee for which no explanation was given, and in fact, a false explanation was even offered. I feel a bit torn because on the one hand, I feel like the hotel intentionally tried to take advantage of me, but on the other hand, the staff was extremely attentive and friendly. While there were certain flaws in the room--overflowing shower and ineffective air conditioning--the room itself was extremely comfortable and modern. So here's my story: Upon checking in, the clerk couldn't find reservation. I said, "Maybe that's because we booked through Travelocity." Next words out of her mouth: "Oh, there's an $18 service fee." I asked what the fee was for. She said, "Hotel taxes and fees," implying that they were just standard NYC hotel charges. I knew I'd already paid all NYC taxes, so I said I would be extremely upset if she charged me taxes again. She then said, "Well it is for service fees; the fine print on Travelocity tells you there are hotel service fees." I again objected. She said, "I'd hate for you not to stay here because of this fee." I took this to mean that if I didn't agree to it, I'd not be allowed to stay at the hotel. This put a sour taste in my mouth for the entire evening. The clerk said she'd see if the manager could take the fee off and told me she upgraded my room. I was required to sign something saying that the hotel reserves the right to charge an 18 dollar "service fee." However, there was no explanation as to what the "service" was. I suspect the fee is only levied on Travelocity customers so that the hotel can recoup its listing fees. The upgraded room was a corner room on the 14th floor with a sliver of a view from each window of the top of the Empire State Building. The amenities were comfortable and modern. The bed and pillows slept great. There were two flaws in the room, though--the rainfall shower water ran out and into rest of bathroom, soaking the bath mat and the A/C was ineffective in 3 digit heat in the evening. By the morning it had cooled comfortably, but it took a while. At checkout the clerk tried to charge me the service fee. When I objected for a third time, the clerk took off the fee himself, no manager required. Apologies were given all around because, "You didn't know beforehand."

Reviews.Title: “Employees made the difference...”
Reviews.Author: kjmcc0729
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with extended family, including my 2 young daughters. The staff at the hotel are great. In particular, 2 of the doormen, Joe and Floner (sp?) were wonderful! to be fair, all of the doormen we encountered were fantastic, but these 2 went went out of their way to make us feel welcome and honored to be their guests. The hotel itself is nothing to write home about otherwise. Like most hotels in NYC, the rooms are a place to sleep for the night, nothing more. The air conditioning is rather loud, although it does a good job of masking the street noise, so I guess it is a wash. There is a slight odor in the hallways and the lobby, though the smell does not make it into the rooms. The prices charged for extra products, ie. the mini-bar etc., are exorbitant, which I know to be par for the course with NYC hotels, just seemes a little indulgent of them to charge as much as they do. It is not a luxury hotel, as it is sometimes billed, but it is clean and friendly. We would probably stay there again when we travel to NYC, but that is more to do with the people employed there than for the property itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all around”
Reviews.Author: W-Hightower
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Williams on business and was very pleased. Check in was quick and courteous. The room was was nice. Not too big, but I wasn't expecting big in NYC, and I didn't need it anyway. Bed was comfortable, and all ammenities that I needed were there. The noise from the street was noticeable in the early hours. It didn't bother me too much because I wasn't sleeping in anyway. If I had been, that may have been more diappointing. The breakfast buffet was very good in my opinion. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dishonest”
Reviews.Author: swa
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, nice boutique NYC hotel ,stayed on penthouse floor -small room but very nice rooftop private deck. My issue is left my $200 sunglasses on the desk in the room. I remembered within an hour of leaving-- I called and was assured it would be taken care of. Received a call back next day saying sorry but we couldn't find your umbrella! I reiterated that I had specifically describe the sunglasses and exactly where they were-- oh I was told she must have just made an error, let me check lost and found because by now your room has been cleaned. Received a call back-- nothing was found in the room! Very very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay on my Wedding Day”
Reviews.Author: nmr240
Reviews.Content: I had to write to rave about The Roger Williams, which provided excellent service the day before and day of my wedding. Granted, I was the bride and a few guests were also staying at the hotel, but they were just great with accomodating large and small requests. I had a huge room with a wrap-around terrace (I was upgraded). The groom and other guests said their rooms were bigger than the average-sized Manhattan hotel room. The location was fine for our purposes. I'm a native New Yorker who recently relocated to the UK - I would similarly recommend it to those who had an event in NYC or were visiting friends/family there.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: nycchic_10
Reviews.Content: What a fun place to stay. This hotel is like staying with that quirky aunt who has a cool apartment downtown. The staff is welcoming, but not overbearing. The room has everything in it that you could possibly want. They thought of everything! The breakfast buffet includes carefully selected offerings from hot spots allover the city: bread from Balthazar, jam from sarabeths, cheese from Murray's -- the perfect pantry. Just steps away from Madison Square Park, Gramercy and the Flatiron District. If there's one area for improvement, the room could maybe be a bit cleaner and quieter with fewer in-hotel sounds. Nonetheless, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great room...”
Reviews.Author: binky60
Reviews.Content: asked for a quiet room (yeah right) and was pleasantly surprised with our 'pied a terre' on the 10th floor, with a very private balcony, roses and lots of sun. Bathroom is small, but efficient. Room was a queen, with just enough space to move around comfortably. The location made you want to be out on the streets as much as possible - you could walk everywhere. We never took a cab. The public spaces were well-designed, and the lounge/bar/restaurant was intimate and very pleasant. Our room was less than $200/night. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but don't eat in their restaurant”
Reviews.Author: stein116
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is very modern. The room was great as well, very comfortable and I love the free aveda products we got. The only negative experience was the two times we ate in their restaurant/bar area. The service was horrible! They took so long for everything. It took forever to get a menu, then we had to ask 3 times for a water, the food was so so, and when it came time to get the check we had to ask our waiter 4 times to bring it! It took us about an hour JUST to get the check. I've worked in the restaurant business before and they say that that is one thing your customers should never had to wait for is their check. You would think they would want to get people out to turn their tables quicker. I thought we were on a secret camera show seeing how long it would take for us to explode. I wasn't the only guest who complained about this. All my other colleagues staying in the hotel also said the same thing. So if you don't want to waste 2 hours of your time for bad service and a not so great meal eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel-Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: JSB60
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed more than a dozen times at the Roger, and have never been disappointed. I am always greeted at the door with a smile, and that upbeat attitude of the staff continues with check-in, wait service, all the way thru check-out. I have been there with friends and family and it always feels like my New York City home. Although the rooms are small(boutique hotel), they are extremely well appointed and have amazingly comfortable linens on the beds. I love their breakfast buffet, best smoked salmon around and great service. I have had several occaisions to ask the staff for theatre tickets or dinner reservations and they have always come through. Many of my friends now stay there when they have business in NYC because they love how they are treated and the location is ideal. I am pleased to recommend the Roger Williams as my Hotel of choice in NYC

Reviews.Title: “It's OK...”
Reviews.Author: ikoiko2u
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week with clients. Snafu at check-in owing to confusion about billing: direct bill to my company or my CC. Took care of that. Staff was friendly. Nice design for a small, boutique hotel. My room was very small with no outside windows. Bathroom, while adequate, was very small. Room was clean, well appointed. Pillows are great. Wireless was pretty weak. The room was very quiet which is something I value anytime I'm in the city. My associate was on the top floor and was awakened by a helicopter hovering overhead. Breakfast buffet is very good. Lots of choices; very friendly and attentive wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, "Stay here!"”
Reviews.Author: LisaO_62
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful boutique hotel in mid-city Manhattan. The location was great -- I was able to walk to the Empire State Building, Times Square, SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park and The Metropolitan Museum of Art. The neighborhood is much quieter than the madness you'll find in Times Square. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and my room was clean & quiet. The restaurant menu was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Squeeboy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Roger williams many times. We recently returned after a long hiatus and nothing had changed. The rooms were very nice, the front desk staff was very professional, maybe to much, the doormen were very courteous. Bathroom is small but functional. We had a terrace room during a beautiful weekend. One drawback is the $18 fee. It should just be rolled into the room rate. We don't use anything there.

Reviews.Title: “Just 18 dollars short of perfect”
Reviews.Author: yayawhat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and well located, but I'd like to spend my review venting about the ridiculous service charge of 18 dollars a night that they make you pay. I had read about it before I booked but when I actually got there it felt different. On the heels of telling me about the fee, the check in person proceeded to go on about the complimentary wireless, fax, computers, etc. In your room there s a nice offer of a complimentary drink at the bar, but at that point you feel like you're paying for all these perks yourself. When I checked out I mentioned it to the person at the counter and said simply that they should just adjust their rates to include the fee so that everything else felt complimentary. She literally ignored me, and after such excellent service the whole weekend left me with a bad impression on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: GilFennerty
Reviews.Content: Asked for a different room on the day of my arrival (two doubles instead of king) and they made it happen. Ended up with a room near the elevator but was actually surprisingly quiet nevertheless. Room was small but in decent shape and comfortable. TV was old-ish but fine. Service was very good. Beds were comfortable. Basically a very solid, pleasant stay. Especially if you're traveling for work, this place is perfect. Clean, pleasant, quiet, comfortable. My only complaint - I'm pretty sure they didn't provide shampoo, and then tried to charge me? I didn't have time to call or complain or investigate. But, if true, that's somewhat lame.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: FFT47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at The Roger on numerous occasions over the past several years and have never been disappointed. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, and truly make an effort to get to know you by name - from the moment you first arrive at the front door. This is a quality shared with the finest hotels in the world. The intimate nature of this stylish boutique hotel is a refreshing change from the larger hotels nearby where you are simply another anonymous guest. The rooms are beautifully decorated, colorful, clean, modern (flat screen TVs!) and well-appointed. We prefer the corner rooms as they are the largest. A gym is located off the second floor mezzanine which has everything you need for a great workout. There is a cozy bar and dining area on the mezzanine level if you just want to share a drink with friends or have a full meal. The European style breakfast buffet is also wonderful. The location is also great as you are just a few minutes on foot or in a taxi from some of the world famous attractions such as the Empire State Building, 42nd Street and Broadway, Madison Square Garden, Central Park and 5th Avenue Shopping. All in all, the Roger has never let us down and it is a great value for the money. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for mid-priced Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: My son recommended it to me. I am not as enthusiastic about it has he, but it's not bad by the standards of Manhattan mid-priced hotels. I've been to a number of them recently, and all have major faults. Let's start with the bad. The room upon first exposure was too hot, and the air conditioning is noisy so that it really wasn't possible to cool it down until I left for dinner. The window is behind the bed, so it can't be readily reached to be open. The window shade isn't totally light-proof, so the room is dimly illuminated all day. The bathroom sink is extremely small, and crowded with useless items for sale, so it's hard to even put a glass on it. The TV is just horrible. Although the TV's hi-def, the hotel only supplies traditional analog channels, so the pictures are lousy. Some channels are missing, leaving hissing spaces when one moves from channel to channel. The hotel claims 24 hour room service, but strangely it is not available between 11:00PM and midnight. There is an apparently undocumented $8 service charge for room service, so the breakfast one thought was $12 ended up costing nearly $25 when that charge and taxes were added. The room was clean, but the housekeeping staff neglected to provide wash cloths and Kleenex on the second night. Now the good. The wireless internet is free and is reasonably speedy at 2.5 Mbs for both up and downloading. However, on the first night, the speed was so slow as to make the service close to unusable. The staff was friendly, with nice touches like providing in-room umbrellas for use during rainy days. The provided robe was comfortable and of ample size. The bed was comfortable and the room decently large. The closet was small, but there were provided a satisfactory number of removable hangers. Perhaps elsewhere, a hotel with such standards would be unacceptable. But hey, this is midtown Manhattan. The price is not terrible, and you got to take what you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Independent small gem of a boutique hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: nonhumilis
Reviews.Content: The Roger provided colorful, convenient rest and reinvigoration during our recent quest for the wedding dress during a rain-soaked weekend in midtown. From a zesty, swift, easy early check-in through comfy, colorful accomodations and terrific staff at every turn, this 31st and Mad. find has got it right. Too tired for dinner out on our last night, room service with a small-ish menu was perfectly prepared, swiftly delivered and assiduous in an extra call-back to be sure that everything was as desired. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Mid-town Manhattan boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dc23
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable boutique hotel located in mid-town Manhattan. Subway within 5 mins walk, convenience stores, pizzeria around the corner. Staffs are generally very nice & helpful. Room is relatively roomy, very comfortable linens & bed, lovely Aveda shampoo & lotion. The only problem is the small bathroom, and over-priced bottle of water & snacks! I personally dislike the $18 service charge, which technically only provide you free internet access!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by the photos!”
Reviews.Author: PJlady78
Reviews.Content: Having spent hours trawling through hotels for a weekend break, we settled on Roger Williams. For all its faults, the location is spot on, a decent walk to central park, a simple stroll to Times Sq. Unfortunately, our expectations from the home of 'customer service' were not fulfilled and the 'extras' dotted around the room were way overpriced, including the daily unpriced bottle 1.5ltr water placed on the side for $10! The pictures of the rooms on many of the websites didn't seem like a good representation in reality...but a photo is a photo I guess?...and the sliding glass door separating the toilet/shower (no bath) from the room, may not be so welcome if you're away with a good 'friend!' There are plenty of good hotels to choose from and I would not recommend this one.... for the same prices I'm sure you could do better...

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: rsurratt
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is by far the most friendly, helpful staff I have experienced EVER! Every interaction with the hotel staff exceeded all expectations. The rooms were lovely. The bathrooms were small, but its NY and how big of a bathroom do you really need. The common areas of the hotel were beautiful. The only things that needed improving were ventalation in the room and tempature control. Luckily there was a window you could open and get some cool air in. I would highly recommend this hotel. I do not think it would be a good choice with children. The beds were extremely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: loulouuk_10
Reviews.Content: I had alovely stay at the Roger Williams in April 2009.Tha hotel is very clean and the staff were very helpfull and quick to sort out any questions I had. I used the free internet service at the lobby each morning which was very good My room was a double and had plenty of room around the bedwith every thing in working order. The bathroom was spotless and spacious. The whole experience was great and I would love to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazed at how nice and responsive they were”
Reviews.Author: KKKNY
Reviews.Content: Although I didn't actually sleep there, I do recommend The Roger Williams aka "The Roger" to anyone looking for a conveniently located hotel in NYC that won't break your wallet. I considered The Roger for my wedding guests and the ONLY reason I didn't book there was because we went with a hotel closer to our ceremony. But, I visited the hotel, took a tour and saw the rooms and I must say the rooms are a very nice size for NY stantards. You can actually walk around the bed and not hit your elbows in the bathroom. And very important for NYC, the windows are completely sound proof. The hotel has a casual, laid back, understated elegance to it and the staff couldn't be nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Enjoyable stay, clean and good staff, but....”
Reviews.Author: 40fus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the presidents day holiday. Staff was excellant, friendly and helpful. Kids felt at home and room was clean. Nice use of space. the only downside was the heat. the heat in the hallways was too high and so was the rooms, had to sleep with a fan and the window open. if this could be addressed ... it would rate close to a perfect 10. we would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “all well above average, except for excessively hot room with heat turned OFF.”
Reviews.Author: milesdd
Reviews.Content: this hotel has just about everything going for it except an ability to regulate heat. despite all the other lovely things - the amenities, the cleanliness, the nice towels, the comfortable beds, if guests can't get a good night sleep they have failed at their primary job. the entire stay we were there our room was unbearably hot and our room heat was OFF. this was a problem caused, i guess, by radiant heat in the hotel. first night the thermostat was 76 degrees with the heat turned OFF in our room. we opened a window to cool it down, but that made it terribly noisy. closed the window, and the room got too hot. LOUSY night sleep, as you can imagine. no stable heat. too hot, or opening window and too noisy. next morning, when i complained to the front desk, the girl said, "some rooms are hotter than others. some colder." she offered to move us, but why bother if the room heat can't regulate the room temp? would we go thru the hassle of moving only to be in a similar situation? second night, same scenario. we cracked the window before we left for the evening, which brought the heat down to 70 by the time we got back around midnight. but by the time we woke up the next morning it was about 76 degrees. on checkout i complained, and the very nice clerk took the $18/night local charge off the bill. but, frankly, i don't think that is satisfactory when guests have been unable to get a comfortable night's sleep. and the only response is, "the interior rooms hold more heat." i met a maintenance man in the hall one morning and asked him about it - he had no answers either. ??? i said i hoped they'd get this taken care of b/c it is otherwise just a perfectly lovely place to stay. maybe the trick is asking for windows on the street side - but those are probably noisier. the nice thing about an interior room is it's very quiet and that's unusual for new york. but it was unbearably hot with no way to regulate it. ugggg.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Room service Nightmare!!!=(”
Reviews.Author: SallyT123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near all shopping centers, only within walking distance. However, on our second night my husband and I decided to order some desserts from the menu. Only waited about 15 minutes when our desserts arrived, and we began eating our chocolate cake and ice cream. To our surprise we found a disgusting fruit fly in our ice cream, mind you I despise, abominate, and scorn all types of insects.This just through my whole craving out the window...My advice, pray before you eat..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised By The Roger Williams!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Roger Williams over Thanksgiving weekend. Given the hotel's affordability (in New York, especially) I was not expecting much. But the hotel is adorable, appears to be recently (if not newly) re-done. Our room wasn't huge (but it was bigger than my bedroom when I lived in New York, so I'm not complaining). At first we thought we didn't have a window, but it was behind a clever Japanese-type sliding screen. The hotel was within easy walking distance to Grand Central, Fifth Ave., and the 4,5,6 subway line. Definitely a great find and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: viaggiatrice23
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams hotel was truly a delight. My husband, 5 month old baby and I had a wonderful 2 night stay here in Novembe 2009. The hotel's atmosphere is charming, with excellent service (they brought the brand NEW baby crib right up to the room, and it had the cutest little sheets and blanket!) and the best breakfast I've had at a hotel in New York (buffet with NYC's best bagels from H&H, Petrossian salmon, fresh pastries, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, eggs, great coffee, etc. etc.). The hotel room was a perfect size, very clean and the bed was super comfortable. And yes, our room even had a view of the Empire State Building (!), as we requested. We travel quite frequently and have stayed in NYC many times. The Roger Williams is a true find, as the rooms are comfortable and the service worthy of a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay with a fabulous staff...”
Reviews.Author: careerNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel ever! My husband and I had my daughter book us a room and she has a friend who suggested this place. We will only stay at this hotel now. If you stay at a big name hotel, you are just a guest. If you stay at a boutique hotel like this one, you are an appreciated, valued costumer and guest. THIS IS THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mioloto
Reviews.Content: I stay here many times for business. All of the bellman are very friendly and remember you, very impressive. Rooms are nicely appointed and fairly good size. The restaurant is a nice place for lunch or dinner. Breakfast (not included in the room rate) is European buffet style (bagels, eggs, fruit, yogurt, meat, smoked salmon, cheese, juices).

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: cwarshavsky
Reviews.Content: the service at this hotel was awesome - definitely 4.5-5 star service. the room was very comfortable - perfect for my husband and me, who spend a lot of time around the city want a comfortable place to come back to when we are tired. the deal we got was better than we could have gotten anyplace else in the city for the weekend we were there. im sorry we missed the breakfast, because i overheard people complimenting the food.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: MissTravel11
Reviews.Content: To be Manhattan, and the price u pay, this is a good choice for your NY weekend. Don't expect ultimate luxury, but clean rooms and friendly service. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “The loo was ridiculously small”
Reviews.Author: yaweno
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was dissapointed with the size of my room. This was the smallest I've ever had except for one in Rome. You couldn't sit on the toilet straight because there was no room between the side of the toilet and the bathtub. They cluttered up the small room with snacks and beverages to buy. The carpet could have used a cleaning. The queen sized bed was ok. The pillows, towels and sheets were clean and of good quality. I had a wonderful view of a wall twenty feet outside my window, but that doesn't bother me. The location is not great. I felt safe but it seemed off the beaten track. I think if the room and especially the bathroom were a reasonable size compared to other NYC hotels I would have enjoyed my stay more. I had planned to do some work in my room but I felt too closed in and only spent a few hours sleeping at night in the room over the 3 day stay. The staff seemed great. Pleasant all the time. Not a place I would return on my next visit. They tack on an $18 daily fee to use the Internet and other services. Again, I don't mind paying for services but if you feel like you're stuck in a sardine can what's the point of having them.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Williams - Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: playmaka34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2 times and they are the best in the city! From the GM to the hotel staff, everyone is top notch and makes you feel at home. My dry cleaning was late one time and they sent me an apology letter and some drinks. I am staying here again this week, and would no go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: miradab
Reviews.Content: The staff who work in this hotel are absolutely lovely and friendly, the rooms are a nice size and very clean. I ordered room service it was good, loved the minibar as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel with good location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Charstorm
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for half the price of other trendy boutique hotels in New York. The staff and management prove that "New Yorkers" can be very helpful and nice. The subway was 1 block away and we rode the green line all weekend to the Metropolitan Art Museum, the Guggenheim and down to China town. Even a taxi ride down 5th Ave.to see the Christmas lights to the hotel only cost $10. Within walking distance to Macy's or a bit of a walk to Times Square. The hotel has a very trendy/European ambiance both in the rooms and the lobby. The rooms were large by New York standards and there was sufficient room to move around. The beds and linens were very comfy and the bathroom clean. We did have trouble regulating the temperature in the room and there was an initial mix up with our reservation (we needed 2 beds) when we arrived at 3am but it was handled by the front desk. I was traveling with friend and 7 year old for pleasure. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: CarlaJamie
Reviews.Content: All the staff who work in this hotel are absolutely lovely and friendly, the rooms are a nice size, bathrooms are a bit small, but I hear this is not uncommon for New York. Anyway, didn't spend all our time in the room as there is so much to do in the city!! When we asked about breakfast they directed us to a lovely little restaurant a few blocks away. Loads to do within walking distance, only a stone's throw away from the Empire State Building, 5th Ave, Macys etc. I would recommend this hotel because the check in is quick and friendly, the staff are really helpful and pleasant, the rooms are clean and suitable and the location is perfect. I would return if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Halaluya
Reviews.Content: Spent the week at the Roger. Very nice! First class all the way! Expensive, but, what isn't in the City! Staff was great! Scott, El and a special shout out to Brandy in the small chic restaurant. This is a Boutique Classy Hotel in the heart of the City. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: courtneyfromLA
Reviews.Content: My Parents my husband and myself spent 6 nights at the Roger Williams hotel during the holiday season. We were very satisfied & impressed by the location & service. The hotel is located in a very central area and is walking distance from the Empire State Building and the subway station. The front desk people were very helpful and provided accurate information regards dining & shopping options. The hotel has a lovely lounge and was a perfect option for a yummy dinner & a glass of wine before heading out to our evening entertainment. The rooms were very well designed, clean, quiet, and we had a flat screen T.V. All of us enjoyed our stay very much & we would defiantly come back on our next visit to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger rooms”
Reviews.Author: HRWMumbai
Reviews.Content: Good service. Bigger rooms. Advantageous in terms of its proximity to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive choice in lower Midtown”
Reviews.Author: mgsf57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at RW approximately 10 times over the last two years. It's a pocket sized hotel at the corner of Madison and 31st that is mid-priced by New York standards. It was renovated in the recent past with a European feel. LIght colored woods, open staircases. Rows of lit candles define borders in the evening; low, comfortable furniture in the lobby with large windows letting in light from Madison. Rooms are small but well designed, with light wood, strong colors, and windows that actually let in light. There is a service charge added to the bill, but you actually get good service in return. Front desk staff is cheerful and well trained. Doormen and such are attentive. Requests to housekeeping or room service are promptly fulfilled. There is a pleasant mezzanine dining area overlooking the lobby that serves breakfast, lunch, drinks and limited dinner menu with only about 8 tables that is a refuge from noisy New York. Good access to Park Avenue South/Gramercy area while still a short cab or subway to midtown or Times Square. Downsides: Exercise area is small and lacks light. Wireless internet has sometimes been spotty. I recently recommended this hotel to a friend who also travels frequently, and he was delighted by the customer experience. Its his new favorite New York place.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1896
Reviews.Content: We're big fans of the Hotel Roger Williams. We've stayed there frequently over the years & we've never been disappointed. Good service, clean rooms &, during the holidays, there aren't many hotels as beautifully decorated as the Roger Williams. The location is very key. 30th & Madison. A great launching point! Happy Holidays! George & Jody Sanchez

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms yes, but very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: NeedsAVacationPlease
Reviews.Content: I went to New York City for the third time this October with my mom and great aunt. I am a teenager, and have quite a bit of travel experience. Saying this, the Roger Williams hotel was our second hotel in one trip. We switched two days after staying in the Novotel. When we arrived to Roger Williams, I was kind of concerned about the location (we were just in a location off of times square), and didn't know what was nearby. Once we walked into the hotel I was very impressed. It was exactly like the website had shown(sometimes the websites are a bit improved), very comfortable feel, with warm lighting. I was pleased the entire stay. Yes, the hotel rooms are very small, but compared to my last hotel I didn't mind. The hallways were colourful, and the room was white with colours. The bathroom was quite small, yes, and the lighting in it wasn't the best. But I still liked it. It was very modern, and very comfy. The shower leaked over the floor, because they had a detachable shower head and the over-head one didn't work. The veiw wasn't the best, and the room service was kind of weird. But still, this was a nice hotel compared to what I left. I look for the feel of safety in a hotel room, and this was guarenteed. Oh, and to add: the beds were amazingly comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is "ordinary" but location is very good”
Reviews.Author: Missy156
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful weekend in New York city with spouse and adult son. We were a little disappointed with the size of the room and bathroom verses the hotel rates; however we were quite happy about it's location. The service was very good; though we didn't require much other than tourist information; and the staff at the front desk were very helpful in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for the cost - Cheaper rate for a reason...”
Reviews.Author: eh_and_keh
Reviews.Content: A VERY small room with an even smaller bathroom... What was supposed to be a romantic getaway weekend at a Mid Town Manhattan "Boutique" Hotel was somewhat underwhelming... Did I mention the room was so small you had to go into the hall to change your mind? Bathroom was like an outhouse indoors... No room for anything but toilet paper which we were pleasantly suprised to find there was no additional charge for that... Everything in this Hotel costs extra, so don't be fooled by the cheaper rates. Housekeeping didn't just make their rounds early, but actually walked in on us at 8 Am... Staff were friendly, location was good, not too far from anything. I'd suggest staying where you WANT to be, as opposed to opting for the cheaper on line rate... You get what you pay for in most cases, but not here... We've stayed in nicer mom and pop motels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, if you don't mind sleeping in a sauna”
Reviews.Author: LevTolstoy
Reviews.Content: Went to Roger William hotel on the weekend of November 7. It was a balmy 70 degrees in NYC, but a whopping 80 degrees in our 10th floor room. We turned on the air conditioner and cranked it as low as it would go, and then settled in to sleep. My poor 5 year old was sweaty and hot and my husband and I peeled off all the sheets and tried to sleep - to no avail. We couldn't figure out how to open the window either. Turns out, there is no air conditioning in the "winter" and therefore you don't have any control over the temperature in your room unless you wish to make it hotter. We complained and the receptionist only waived an $18 service fee- a service fee we were never told about to begin with. She refused to do anything else to accommodate us. So, if you're thinking about staying, I'd request a low-floor room which MAY be cooler, though I have no first-hand way of knowing. Or, wait until spring.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: CTBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: No natural light on the 15th floor (top floor besides PH) with a small, clean room. Decor left a lot to be desired - tried to make it seem chic by putting a big screen in front of a window that looks out to a brick wall with a fluorescent light behind it. Safe was broken - after locking could open by simply turning the handle. Bathroom was clean but a bit on the small side (typical for NY hotel room). Flatscreen TV seemed aged with poor resolution, but maybe I'm just accustomed to higher quality HD. I travel to NY often and would not recommend this hotel and don't plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “User friendly, small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in Murray Hill. The area is fairly quiet. The room was small but very functionally furnished. At first we were unsure if there was a window as the shoji screens behind the beds hid the window. The color scheme was a little jarring for us. The room was filled with various amenities but most were available for a charge. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Clearly service is a priority here. We did have some difficulty getting a taxi from here but the doorman tried very hard and usually found one within a few minutes. Wireless internet was available in all the rooms and this was a plus. The bathroom was decent size but there was not a lot of privacy as there was a frosted glass door and it was not at all sound proof. If you can get a good rate here I would recommend it although I think there are a lot of other nice hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: swtnpetite
Reviews.Content: My weekend in NY was an unexpectant business trip. But the Roger Williams Hotel made my experience much more pleasurable. It only took me minutes to check-in, and the service is excellent. I simply love this hotel. It's only a few blocks from all of the shopping corridors in Manhattan. The decor has an eclectic feel and very trendy. The hotel lobby and bar is a hidden gem. I spotted two superstars lounging in the area having drinks. I'm staying at this hotel when I return to Manhattan in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: august16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night at a group rate for a wedding and we were very pleased with our stay. Our room was large for a hotel in NYC. It had a very trendy design to it. The hotel also has a very clean gym with nice equipment. The staff was excellent, and allowed us to check in early. The location is good as it is very close to the subway. King size beds were very comfortable, although I hate those puffy pillows that most hotels have now. Be prepared for a plain cup of coffee that will cost you 3.50. All in all, a lovely hotel that I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Shop 'til you drop then relax in style at the Hotel Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: beverlys1020
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel Roger Williams! The doorman met me at my cab and carried in my bag, and I didn't see it again until I got to my room. The lobby was gorgeous and I could have just stayed there! The people at the front desk were so friendly yet very professional. My room was decorated beautifully and very tastefully--artsy yet warm. I wish I could have stayed much longer. The room was pricey, but it's in midtown Manhattan, so what do you expect? All in all, I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Roger's unique style and service was equal to staying at a small 4 Seasons.”
Reviews.Author: TxBeachBum2
Reviews.Content: A tip would be to book early, include their wonderful Eourpean breakfast to start your day, relax and let their lovely staff pamper you. Enjoy the location, in the middle of not too old and not to new Manhattan. Surrounded by beautiful architecture and 2 blocks from the Empire State Building. A great choice for our 25th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Midtown Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Caravelle2009
Reviews.Content: Arrived 9AM and was lucky to check in early. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast buffet is excellent, many choices, not your typical hotel food. From Caneles to prosciutto to amazing espresso, and for about $20 per person, below average for NY at a boutique hotel. The room size was just right, free WiFi, very comfortable bed and pillows. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beware UK Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Traceter
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I cannot give a good review of this hotel as it was not the 4 star hotel I originally had my booking with. Hotel KItano doubled booked us and sent us here advising it was a good hotel and we would be getting a better room. We must have first been allocated the room they give in cases like ours as we had to ask for another room. The 1st room overlooked an outside terrace for guests to sit and smoke at, had standing room for 1 in the shower room, was in a state of disrepair - wood veneer broken off the furniture, no wardrobe and the safe was located at 6ft high. The 2nd room was much better but we could hear the occupants of another using the toilet and the air condtioning unit leaked all over the carpet so we had wet feet. We reported this but they did not dry the carpet and not much was said when we checked out when I mentioned it again. I can concurr the breakfast is really expensive and the breakfast room is also the bar and it's pretty small. If I had wanted a UK Travelodge style hotel this would have been fine but I didn't and it was also a bit futher down from where we were orginally mean't to be staying and lacked bars in the immediate area for a nightcap. Reception area is nice and room was spacious with a comfy bed but that was it for us.

Reviews.Title: “The beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: DarDon
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Roger Williams last weekend. Very nice, trendy hotel. Close enough to our subway station to get us to and from the US Open and Mets Game. Breakfast was a tad pricey but they served a delicious selection. Sausage and eggs, oatmeal, bagels, lox, pastries, good coffee and much more. The main attraction was the bed. 108 x 102 inches of heaven! For people who rarely get a good night's sleep while staying at a hotel, this experience was remarkable. We shocked ourselves at how late we slept in! Staff were very helpful and friendly. Everyone knew their job and did it well.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Williams Hotel the centerpiece to a fantastic visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: CarrieCopeland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NYC to attend the US Open over Labor Day weekend. I shopped through many online channels to find the best deal at a 4-star property in a good location of Manhattan and I'm very satisfied with our choice. Our guestroom was ready on time and the front desk agent was very friendly and welcoming in a casual, yet efficient manner. At check in, I noticed they had two laptops on the side of the desk available for guest use. At the end of my stay I was able to check into our flight and print boarding passes with ease. Our superior guestroom was designed to match the style of the lobby and service with chic and eclectic touches. Of course it wasn't the largest guestroom I have ever experienced, but definitely within my expectations of NYC. If you are planning your first trip to New York, be prepared for small accommodations. The location was desirably situated between an area with local feel and blocks away from Empire State building. We walked to Herald Square, Grand Central and easily caught subways to Central Park and out to US Open in Queens. When we returned from Queens we were hungry for Pizza and the hotel recommended Vezzo, two blocks away, and was outstanding. We also hit Brother Jimmy's BBQ, again two blocks away, for lunch and was also very good. Our favorite dining experience was yet again two blocks away at Ayza, a wine and chocolate bar. We loved the area. We always like to try different boutique hotels in NYC, but will be hard not to return back to Roger Williams on our next visit. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best boutiques hotel in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: spitfirex
Reviews.Content: I just spend a few days with my teen son in NYC.It was the second time that I have been to the Roger Williams hotel and it is by far the best boutique hotel for the price that we had.The room was large for NYC standard, spotless,very friendly staff and good breakfast.I usually go to nyc for buisness and I stay at the mercer hotel in Soho. The william rogers is not as luxurious than the Mercer....but with special rates at $ 169/night it cost a third of the price than the mercer and you are not distrured by all the people waiting for the stars that stay at the Mercer.The only problems that I can see it that Soho has a much better restaurants choice than Midtown and more trendy shops.My son loved the kidrobot one!.In short I can only reccomand the Roger as the best hidden pearl in manhattan. Flavio From Geneva

Reviews.Title: “Beware, the scam charges continue!”
Reviews.Author: SoFLGringo
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated this hotel is decent enough and the location is excellent. But the scam daily "service charge" has now gone up to $18 a day! I was shocked that they charged me this even though I booked through Hotwire (very good $158 rate). There really should be a law against this kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sweetshe
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant to stay here since the rooms looked so small, especially for a 2 bedded room. The room was small but we had absolutely no problems. We had plenty of room for all of our luggage and shopping bags! The only issue we had was the door/wall to the bathroom which are frosted glass...which you couldn't see from the bed area, only if you were next to the bathroom/door. So, after getting used to that, we were fine. There were 4 large pillows, 2 small pillows on each bed. A bench at the end of each bed which we used mainly for our luggage. The window had japenese like screens in front - at the head of the bed which if left closed, gave the room a soft glow, no need for a nightlight. If you wanted it pitch dark, you could always pull down the actual window shade. The location is fantastic, close to shopping (Macys!), not far from Times Square, the subway is close by - the 6 is on 33rd which we used many times...or go to 34st for more subway choices. Cabs were very plentiful in that area. You must use your room key to go up the elevator. Deli's, coffee, restaruants all close by. We ate at the Bella Napoli for pizza one night and down the street a few blocks had Sushi at Sushi Twist. Both were good...ate at Tasty NY for a quick bite in the morning. The hotel staff were the best!. They were always at the door, always greated us warmly - whether they were just passing you in the hall or wherever. Even the maid crew - if you ever saw them in the hall, they were always very nice. What a great impression they made. Loved it! I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown experience...”
Reviews.Author: maven1Carrboro
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Roger Williams this past weekend with my wife and two teenage boys. Great stay overall. The Roger Williams starts to impress you as soon as you walk in the lobby...great looking and decorated with style. Desk personnel were friendly, helpful and eager to please. Bellman were great...quick to open the door or offer assistance. Rooms were New York smallish but very nice. Funky styling and comfortable beds were welcomed after a ton of walking around the city. We had dinner at the hotel lounge one evening and that turned out to be very good...a welcomed and convenient extra. Location is good...a few blocks from the Empire State building, a few blocks from the subway but far enough from Times Square and other craziness. Nighttime was fairly quiet compared to city standards. Overall...nice place, friendly people and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great service!”
Reviews.Author: TeeZeeOntario
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC after many attempts to get there. The hotel was clean, quiet and well located. The room was extremely comfortable and homey. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We arrived very early, well before check in time but they accomadated us without complaint. There is free internet access for hotel guests in the lobby and the doorman was a nice touch. Great toiletries in the bathroom and lots of room for hanging your clothes and stuff. It was very centrally located, two blocks from the Empire State building. Great and cheap family run breakfast/lunch place across the street as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Roger was perfect for us...”
Reviews.Author: srayburn
Reviews.Content: I booked the Roger Williams Hotel at the last minute on Hotwire. This is a funky little boutique hotel in a great location. All of the staff were courteous and helpful. IThe room was fine for me and my 5 year old... mostly filled by the king sized bed, but with a good sized flat screen and a decent selection of channels for our evenings in.... no crazy night life with a 5 year old in tow! The bathroom was quite small, but functional and very clean. We really enjoyed the Madison Square Park close by where my son played for hours on two of our days, I am grateful for the front desk for telling me about it. We ate in two restaurants suggested by the staff and both were perfect and within short walking distance from the hotel. Right off I was pleased, as when I asked about parking, I was told that the valet was $60 per night for our SUV, but if we were good w/ walking two blocks we could park for $22 per night w/ hotel validation! that's a pretty significant savings and it was not inconvenient at all... when we picked up the car, it was only $20 per night. Not at all bad for NYC! I would definitely stay at the Roger again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fine, a safe bet for a NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: ushma
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m staying at this hotel while I write this (The hotel offers free internet!). Iâ€™m checking out tomorrow. This is a safe bet for a NYC hotel. Itâ€™s central, 2 blocks to the Metro and a 15 minute walk to the largest department store in the world (Macyâ€™s) and a great place for NY style pizza by the slice across the street. I did not choose the hotel, I stayed on a group rate of $199 for a conference that was near by. When I made my reservation I asked for a high floor away from the elevators.
