When I checked in, they had a room with my preferences but after reading the great tip on a previous Tripadvisor review, I decided to ask for a room with a shower stall instead of the shower/tub combo which I canâ€™t stand. They gave it to me and I went up to see it. The bathroom was really nice, but it had 2 full beds when I wanted only one. The front desk said all the rooms with the shower stall have 2 beds. So I was moved to room 405 which was smaller but has a nice large bed and a flat screen TV (the shower stall room did not). I was worried about being on such a low floor but I couldnâ€™t hear any street noise. It was the noise from inside the hotel that I should have been worried about. The other rooms were a bit noisy, with doors slamming early in the morning. One other thing is that the window coverings are a bit odd. There is a sliding screen in front of the small window which blocks a lot of light, but I guess provides more privacy. Also note, they donâ€™t provide body wash (just soap) and there are no luggage racks in the room (apparently, nor in the entire hotel) so suitcase must be kept on the floor. Safe is also too small for even my tiny laptop. On a positive note, they allowed me a late checkout: 1:30 which was very nice. I agree with other reviewers who said the staff goes out of their way to make you happy. Also, other reviewers complained about all the in-room sales, but I was saved by the offering of $5 toothpaste since I had forgotten mine. Pricey, but worth not having to face my colleagues with morning breath.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: yakityak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - I loved everything about it, the location , the service and the room. I wanted a hotel with all these attributes and the Roger Williams met all expectations and beyond.! A short walk to major tourist attractions, Will certainly stay here on my next visit to NY

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: yeja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night birthday stay in this wonderful hotel. I had booked online for a queen bed regular room. However when I was checking in, all I had to do was mention that it was my birthday and the gentleman at the front desk, Eric asked me if we wanted an upgrade. Of course we said yes and he sent us to a penthouse room with a terrace!! The rooms are very bright, colorful, modern and clean. Our terrace had a view of the empire state building. The beds are best described as soft and fluffy as marshmallows. There was nothing the room lacked. Yes, the sink in our bathroom was tiny and there was very little counter space, but everything else in the room made up for that. The doormen couldn't be nicer helping us get cabs, the night clerk Raina was a doll. At 2AM after returning from a full day, I realized I had left my sweater in a diner near lincoln center. She called them for me, she left me a google map under my door the next morning and I retrieved my sweater. She also had the 24 hour deli across the street deliver me two small bottles of water (we only paid $3.50) because the water in the room for sale was a bit expensive. I would definitely stay there again. The park within walking distance is beautiful and the area in general is just great. My sister who lives in Manhatten couldn't believe what a great charming hotel this was. The lobby at night is all lit up with candles and there are all these little cozy places to sit .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel, but more money-making than friendly”
Reviews.Author: JP1London_England
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and I liked the extra touches: the umbrella, the guide book, but what a pity everything is for sale at high prices plus lots of other junk from crisps to shaving kits, so you feel like you're staying in a shop! Extras are expensive e.g. a coffee or breakfast, and the many service charges are a scam as many have said. The staff are very attentive (lots of scurrying to open doors etc) but I didn't feel any real warmth from them. It all felt a bit snooty and catering for people who are wealthier than me. Having said all that, it's a lovely, comfortable hotel, brilliantly placed (near Madison Square Park too, which is fab), quiet and elegant, so I would definitely stay again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly My Favorite Hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lucy2001
Reviews.Content: Wow. LOVED the Roger Williams...was in Manhattan for 5 nights in early May and by a happy accident stayed the Roger Williams. I had booked the Ace Hotel and when it didn't open, they relocated me to the Roger Williams for the same bargain price I had booked with the Ace. I have to say that while this was fantastic, now that I've stayed at the Roger, I'm definitely willing to pay more to return! -Staff is incredibly courteous and helpful. The doormen all seemed to make a real effort to remember the guests, as did the front desk staff. Front desk staff VERY helpful to other guests that I observed--with anything from train schedules to restaurant suggestions to setting up car services. I have to say I was a little worried because of the price I was paying to stay at the Roger, but the staff never ONCE made me feel like I didn't belong there... -Rooms are VERY spacious for NY and spotless. The bed was the most comfortable ever, the AC is silent, the windows open (and it's a fairly quiet location), the decor is so stylish, right down to the details -As others have mentioned, the bathroom really was quite small...but hey, you don't really spend that much time in the bathroom, right? I did peek into another room on my floor and noticed that it had a shower instead of a tub...and the bathroom by default seemed larger. If you think this is going to be a problem, ask for a room with a shower. -Free WiFi is great, and though the hotel doesn't have a business center it does have laptops in the lobby that guests can use -Safety: as a single female traveler, this is very important to me. You have to use your room key for the elevator--great touch. And again, the staff seem to know the guests, which is so very helpful -Seems like the crowd that stays here is fairly sophisticated...meaning lots of people on business, so it was usually nice and quiet at night and it was such a welcome treat to not have to deal with the revelers in the City when all I wanted to do was sleep Again, I can't say enough good things about the Roger Williams. I will most certainly be returning! They get it right!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location although a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: bev42
Reviews.Content: I travelled for the first time on my own- felt safe walking at night to all the main areas. I wanted to stay somewhere that was walking distance to Broadway and the main shopping areas. A friend recommended this hotel, although the price was a little high I couldn't fault the location, cleanliness or staff. I didn't eat breakfast but did have a meal on a couple of evenings- both were delicious. If I was going to New York again I would be happy to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Hidden service charge- beware!”
Reviews.Author: dcbalt
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are small but clean and modern. However, when you checkout you will notice on your bill a service charge to clean the rooms. When you are comparing rates for hotel rooms and choosing one based on this rate, it is disingenuous to add on hidden charges. We could have stayed at the W for a few dollars more, had we know about these hidden charges. Also, I felt like I was in a convenience store with all the knicknacks for sale in the small bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIKKICOOK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and had a great experience. The rooms were a good size and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were comparable to what you would find on a cruise ship cabin (i.e. small), so be prepared, but not bad. The staff was very helpful and thumbs up to the doormen who were always there to catch a cab for us when we were wanting to explore the city and then there to open the door for us with smiles on their faces on our way back to the hotel. I did not have the breakfast at the hotel (pretty expensive!) but ventured a few buildings down to the right of the hotel to this quaint little cafe that had fantastic bagels and pastries and a full breakfast menu as well. I liked that the hotel was in a quieter area. It took us about 40 minutes to walk from Times Square to the hotel. It is about a $15 taxi ride to Central Park/Metropolitan Museum of Art from the hotel. The next time I venture back to Manhattan, I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service at the Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: upstateAnnie
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is courteous, attentive, friendly. The rooms are small, as are most hotel rooms in NYC, but comfortable. The location is fabulous, we walked almost everywhere. At check-in the concierge offered an upgrade to a terrace room for $25.00; this was well worth it. We had a view of the spire of the Empire State bldg., with plants, a chair and small bench outside. Be sure to bring your own snacks, drinks, etc. - the mini-bar prices are astronomical. The neighborhood has a number of small shops where you can buy these items for a reasonable price. Many good restaurants and several low-priced breakfast places in the area - we skipped the expensive hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay experience!”
Reviews.Author: viviluven71
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for three days and two nights in the Hotel Roger Williams. The staff were wondeful. They helped us find the direction and easiest way to get even thought we asked for more than five times. THey were so patient that we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “simple trendy comfort”
Reviews.Author: juntoflemington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roger Williams Hotel March 21 for one night. We were in NYC to attend a birthday party for a family member. The hotel was running a special on their web site. The price included the room, plus complimentary parking and a gourmet breakfast buffet. We drove up to the door and the bellman was right there offering to park the car and take our bags inside. The front desk was exceptional. They even asked if we prefer higher or lower floors. A few minuets after we were in our room the front desk phoned to make sure we were happy. The room was small which I knew it would be from other reviews I had read. However, it was spotless. The room was decorated in a sleek modern decor and the bed was simple elegance and the mattress was extremly comfy.. The only down side I could find at this hotel was the bathroom. If either my husband or myself were very large people or had a handicapped in anyway there is no way you could manage this bathroom.. It would also be very challaging to manage with children. I doubt we would book this room for more then one or two nights because of the very small bathroom as there is no place to put anything on its counter. We stayed in room 603. We left for the party around 7 pm and the bellman flagged down a cab. The staff at this hotel is exceptionally polite and helpful. When we returned we went to the bar at the Hotel for a drink before returning to our room. Same great vibes from the staff. The breakfast buffet had fresh cut up fruit, fresh squeezed jucies, rolls, eggs and small sauages. A very good selection . Same great service. We checked out on Sunday morning and it went great they called for our car and we were headed home in a matter of mins. What makes this hotel special is the staff and their exceptional service. The decor is trendy,modern comfortable elegance. My husband who has stayed and worked in the city found it to be much more relaxing then one of the larger chain hotels.The location is good. Close to almost everything in the city such as the fashion district etc. Just a short cab away from Broadway.We felt very safe in this hotel. I am hoping I can return to this lovely hotel and its smiling staff on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location,Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyba
Reviews.Content: We just finished a three night stay at the Roger Williams and we would stay here again next time. The Hotel is in a good Location, quiet at night but close enough to walk to tourist spots. We got the room for $149 through Zootravel.com/hotels that my sister-in-law told me about.The staff is so friendly and accomadating.I would ask a question and they would find the answer immediately always witha smile.The room was nice and big enough, remember your in New YorkCity. We can see The Empire State Building from our room. We went with our 15 year old daughter and she loved it.(the hotel and the city) Hope this helps someone and have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat, contemporary...rooms very tight!”
Reviews.Author: traveldivatoo
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel. We stayed at the Chandler Hotel, and that is a much better choice. Our rate was $189 per night. The Roger Williams Hotel has a lovley lobby, quite trendy-contemporary and well appointed, but the rooms were really small and not as lovley. Take my word for it. Although the Chandler Hotel has small rooms (12x16), they are lovley. Silk draperies, down comforters and pillows, a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: jb54
Reviews.Content: I usually don't care too much about the staff, but this crew was exceptional: friendly (yes they DO remember your name; even the doorman), efficient, everyone seemed genuinely UP. The room was exceptionally quiet and comfortable; the bed perfect. Not a lot of drawer and closet space, but the bathroom was large. Room service was fast. The food is surprisingly good; the breakfast buffet for $17 was well worth the cost: fresh, a lot of variety, eggs and sausage, oatmeal, healthy options, Sarabeth jams and granola. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, fab, fab.”
Reviews.Author: Louise096
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 years ago for business and coming back with my husband this year, it was as great as I remembered. Rooms are stylish, very clean and beds super comfortable. Yes, the bathrooms are small but this is a city! The customer service, even by American standrards is outstanding. How is a doorman in a 15 storey hotel able to greet us by name every time we returned!! The restaurant recommendations we were given by the desk staff were perfect (Chef Yu and Intermezzo). The bar is lovely to come back to after a meal for a cocktail or coffee, relaxed and cosy. Immediate location is nice and quiet but you can walk pretty much anywhere from here, and you can use the Empire State building to guide you home. Times square is about 10 minutes away. We managed to get a great price through trip advisor. Stay here if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedMom
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip to NYC which coincided with my bday & suggested I come along so we could celebrate & I could have a couple days of kid-free quiet-tome for my bday treat. His company travel agent booked the Roger Williams through a company deal so I wasn't expecting anything special. Boy was I pleasantly surprised! The staff were friendly & helpful and went that bit beyond. The room was lovely and well-furnished and the bed very cozy. The bathroom was small but well-laid out & the shower had good water-pressure. The public areas of the hotel were nicely decorated and the lounge/restaurant area was very comfy. The hotel is in a nice area, not too busy but close enough to everything and I felt very safe walking by myself, even at night. I look forward to returning again & would love to try one of the terrace rooms in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Large and quiet rooms, for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: simnonin
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I stayed there a few years ago and decided to write a review because it is my favourite hotel in Manhattan. My fave B&B is Eden House in Columbus circle. The service is wonderful, eg. the receptionist saw that I had postcards and offered to send them for me. Everyone is very helpful, the doorman remembered me. My room was clean and bright, very comfortable, nice bed with enough floor space to do yoga. The bathroom had a shower, no bath and was nicely appointed, new tiles, free fo mould and grime. The only thing I didn't much like was the shag carpet. I didn't like walking around barefoot in it.

Reviews.Title: “great place and great staff”
Reviews.Author: textilereptile
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels in NY, but this one is rather special. wonderful staff and service

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ajs0522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Williams this past weekend, and had booked the package that included parking, breakfast, and an upgrade to a deluxe room for a total of $250. It was well worth it. The hotel reminds me of boutique hotels in European cities. The service was excellent; shortly after checking in, reception called to ensure we were satisfied with our room. The rooms were simple, and very very clean. The lounge put out a great breakfast spread, and served drinks at night. The fitness center was adequate and served its purpose. All staff were friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay at the Roger Williams again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the RW”
Reviews.Author: lcastanon
Reviews.Content: Recently spent the weekend at the Roger Williams for a convention at the Javits Convention Center. It was kind of last minute. Orbitz had a special with it running at $150 a night. For being in the city that seemed great, and so I booked it right away. It's about a mile and a half away from the Convention Center but that was fine, I know the Javits doesnt really have much around it so I didnt want to stay near that area I'd rather stay further inland. Enter the Roger Williams. I checked-in and realized I actually was so rushed that I booked it for the wrong dates on Orbitz. Ooops. The person at the desk was super helpful, we thought we'd be so screwed but they had us check-in and told us they would sort it with Orbitz, no worries. I've never had hotel front desk personel be this cordial and accomidating. So definately a huge star for saving the day on that one. We checked in early to boot, so it was just above and beyond what I was expecting. Even more rare for it being in NY where people are generally impatient and pushy (sorry to any local NYers.) Anyway we checked-in, the room was pretty well laid out and comfortable. It wasnt a huge room but the furniture was modern and well chosen so the short footprint of the room size was not that noticeable due to the furniture that didnt crowd the room or become too bare and jail-cell like. The TV could use some modern touch. It seemed like an akward mix to have an older TV amongst a room with a modern flair. We didnt use the TV at all because we were out and about but that was my main gripe about it. Most hotels, even lower scale travel lodges have flat panel tv's these days. Minor gripe. The bathroom was a bit too tight for my liking. The sink was like just barely squeezed in. I suppose this leads to a bigger space for the room itself but even still. It felt a little too close to the toilet. Other than that the room was comfortable and fine. They had some Japanese sliding screens covering the windows, I thought it was a unique touch and way of covering a typical unexciting view of a building next door. The room is very well lit so you dont actually feel claustrophobic. If you did, you chould easily just slide them out and let in the sunlight, or rather the shade from the other building. The internet was free and worked flawlessly. They also have laptops near the lobby that are free to use. They have quite a few of them so you could get by not having a laptop if you just need to check your mail/google something real quick. My only reason for giving this establishment a 4 out of 5 is that the breakfast buffet is too bare for 18.00. For that much money, id expect custom omlettes or pancakes. None of those are available. You have scrambled eggs or sausage and thats about it as far as warm food goes. They had fruits, muffins, and bagels, nothing that really warranted almost 20 dollars. My suggestion would be to skip the breakfast and walk out of the hotel to one of the nearby diners. You'll save some money and probably enjoy better food. Definately a better selection of warm food. The wait staff was occassionally there for you. Sometimes you'd have to refill your coffee yourself.. sometimes they would come around and ask you. Inconsistent. I would stay again due to the great value you get at $150 a night. The room is great, the bed is great and you are within walking distance of all the things the heart of the city has to offer. The front desk staff really goes out of their way to accomidate you and its rare. Especially in an establishment under 200.

Reviews.Title: “Still good 7 years later”
Reviews.Author: jerseygolf
Reviews.Content: Our wedding anniversary is in the end of January so we often end up in NYC for a night or two because it is relatively so cheap. 7 years ago we stayed here right after this hotel got a makeover and it was quite nice. Now it is on the high end of the price scale but we were still able to get a room through Expeida at about $200 for the night. The room was even better and bigger than last time; the decor is still refreshingly functional and sophisticated. As we did 7 years ago we liked the vibe of this hotel and its quiet location on Madison Ave and 31st St. A good, upscale restaurant is right down the Ave -- Olana, and it's an easy walk to both Madison and Gramercy Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepsi_enya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roger Williams for a few night before Christmas 08. Having never stayed here before, i was a little worried, but i shouldnt have been. The hotel was lovely, the staff were so friendly and the rooms were very clean and tidy. On my next trip to NYC I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable nook in the city”
Reviews.Author: lifetimestudent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams as a part of a friend's birthday weekend getaway in NYC. Our room was clean, spacious and nicely decorated with a comfortable, well put together feel. The staff were very nice, offering us a free room upgrade, and luggage storage both before check in and after check out so we could explore the city. The rate was also very affordable for such a nice stay and central location (especially with the free upgrade!). We had a wonderful trip, and are looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: prospect45
Reviews.Content: this was the best hotel experience I have had in years. The room was amazing with a balcony on the 14th floor! The hotel is vary stylish, spotless and with very helpful staff. I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and bright!”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roger Williams the four days preceding Christmas this year. The hotel was bright and cheerful and the staff were quite helpful and seemed genuinely happy. Our room was large for NY standards and had a comfortable bright look. There were a few places that were rough around the edges (the Odegard carpets in the lobby could use a good cleaning and the light fixtures in our room could use a good dusting), but nothing that would really put me off. The only thing that I could really complain about was the fact that the room was very very hot. The only salvation was that the window was able to be opened and we were on a floor high enough that I felt safe sleeping with it open. We enjoyed the daily breakfast as it was included with our rate and it was a nice buffet including pastries, oatmeal, cereal and some nice meats and cheeses. Quite nice, though I don't know that I would have thought it was worth the 17.95 price tag were it not included with my room. Overall, a nice place to stay in a convenient location next to the 6 subway line in Murray Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: debbstar78
Reviews.Content: This place has the best customer service by far. The location is great and the hotel is very clean and unique looking. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Roger Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: justalittlecrazykc
Reviews.Content: In a city full of overpriced, disappointing hotels, the Hotel Roger Williams was a real knockout. Let's start with check-in... My wife and I were traveling with some friends - we arrived at the hotel early and expected the usual Manhattan luggage check. Instead, we ALL got our rooms...at NOON! The overall feel is trendy yet cozy... And the staff is FRIENDLY. (Everyone I ran into - EVERYONE - wished us a good day/night.) The room was very nice and spacious for Manhattan. The quilt on the bed was a nice touch. I read a review from someone that warned the bathrooms are small...for Manhattan, ours was pretty good sized. There's a quaint hotel bar/restaurant that is very comfy and relaxing. Plus, the location is pretty great - right at 31st & Madison. The ONLY problem we encountered during our stay was that we had two heating choices: on or off. I called down to check on this and was told that someone would be up to open our window if I wished. (I did wish - it was HOT.) The remodel seemed fairly new so I was a bit surprised by this - but it was by no means a deal-killer. I'm usually pretty critical, but this was really a fabulous hotel. I would heartily recommend it and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: CiaoMontreal
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small, especially the bathroom... No air conditionning but the room was so warm that we had to open the only window.. hard to sleep with a window open in Manhattan! Althought it is rated a 4 star hotel, I would consider it a 3 star... Food was great, service was perfect, staff was very nice, probably the nicest staff in town. Unfortunately, I wouldn' t go back.. Our room was on the 3rd floor, you could hear the bass from the music in the mezzanine... I got a good deal on Hotwire, but would have never paid more then $250 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room size and the friendliest staff I've ever found!”
Reviews.Author: cityrunner
Reviews.Content: Good to find a hotel in NY that is far enough from the tourist filled areas around time square but easy to get to all the important places. Amazing staff on reception can help with anything, from bar ideas to where to get the best spa rub! Ok gym - enough machines if you want to work out, wifi through out and even 2 free to use laptops in reception in case you've not brought laptop. Didn't try the breakfast or restaurant (lots more places to go/see in NTC than hotel fare). Not cheap but felt worth it - aveda products and quite enough to get a good nights sleep in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: LarryM15
Reviews.Content: My wife an I came back from a weekend trip to NYC and stayed at the Roger Williams for the first time based on Tripadvisor reports. We were very pleased overall. We booked a special rate of $300 per night through the hotel's website that included parking, breakfast and a deluxe room. This seemed like a better deal than $250 per night for a standard room plus at least $45 per night for parking and $16 each for breakfast. We were greeted at the sidewalk, the doorman had the car valet parked. Check-in was easy and fast. We were told we had been upgraded and our room on the 15th floor had a view of the Empire State building but no terrace. The room was decently sized with a King bed, easy chair, desk, flat-screen HDTV, minibar, armoire (no closet). As others have said, there were lots of things for sale in the room, but we didn't find it obtrusive. As in the pictures, the style is colorful, bright, and modern. The bathroom was small but nice with a good selection of toiletries. The water pressure was so-so, but the showerhead adjusted which made it fine. Bathrobes were provided. The windows opened. Bedding, pillows, towels were comfortable and more than adequate. The breakfast buffet served in the lounge on the mezzanine was very nice with fresh fruit and orange juice, scrambled eggs, nice pastries, cereals, oatmeal and was open til 11 on weekends, Sunday Times was available. The fitness center is small with 2 treadmills, an eliptical machine, some free weights and 3 weight machines. Staff was very helpful. We were standing at the front desk waiting to check out and a bellman realized we wanted to check our bags, took them away and said we could just drop our keys and come back when we were ready to get our car. They were also helpful with restaurant suggestions, show tickets, directions. There was free WiFi throughout the hotel that worked well and two available laptops in the lobby with access to a printer. Good location for anything in NYC. Overall, we would definitely go back and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: spacecadety
Reviews.Content: On a recent long trip this was cleary the best city hotel. As I had read the staff are amazing and everything good about the hotel (aircon could do with some work). All staff without exception were amazingly friendly and helpful at every opportunity. And the mezannine lounge was a great place to chill, drink, snack etc. Defnately everythingit is cracked up to be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay...”
Reviews.Author: loperandy
Reviews.Content: After researching for quite some time, my girlfriend and I decided on Hotel Roger Williams (HRW) for our brief stay back east. We are from LA, Ca, so we expect to pay to play, for the lack of better terms...Long story short, we were 110% satisfied with our choice to stay at HRW from the moment we walked into the hotel, to the last moments prior to our departure. From the staff, to the location, our stay at HRW enabled us to see the city without having the anxiety of worrying about where we were staying...also, the front desk seemed to help us because they truly wanted to, opposed to providing us information as if they were doing us a favor. I know that most people feel that a hotel staff should automatically provide their guests with top-notch service; however, if you live in the real world, you know talk is cheap and promising great service may stop at a particular hotels missionary statement on their own website. In addition to the above factors, the room was modern and the hotel restaurant and bar, although pricey, was worth the money, as again the staff in the restaurant pointed us out to cool bars in the area, which we did in fact utilize. Of course, you do get what you give; however, take it from an honest person that has no reason to go to bat for hotel/business. This is a great stay and we highly recommend the HRW for any type of person who wishes to enjoy the NYC for what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “A SMALL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was SMALL in many ways.... first of all, in our Superior Double Bed room there was only 30" between the two beds that were pushed up against the wall on both sides of the room. 30" is not enough space! Also, the tiny bathroom was more like an airplane bathroom...luckily we are small people in my family. The tiny round sink is set into a square counter and the available space for toiletries (less the sink basin) is about 1 and 1/2 inches. NOTHING fits on that much space. The shower curtain rod is curved out so that you feel like you have a bit more space while showering but the toilet is so close to the tub that when you use "it" you have to move the curtain into the tub so you don't feel the curtain draping against you. The room is way over-priced for what you get. The 2nd night we were there, the fire alarm (smoke detector) malfunctioned in the corridor on every floor and the fire trucks showed up (4 of them) in front of the building at about 3:00AMish. Being that our sleep was disrupted in our tiny room I thought that breakfast should have been offered on the house or maybe some little acknowledgement of the inconvenience - like maybe giving us one of the $8.00 bottles of water or something. There was no mention of the incident however and we paid full price for less space and less sleep. The good parts... great service, excellent food, great location, stylish lobby and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Botique Hotel. Wonderful Service.”
Reviews.Author: jlo12
Reviews.Content: Arrived 28th August for a 4 night break for our 10 year wedding anniversary. Wonderful staff, very helpful concierge who gave great advice and tips on where to visit. Breakfast in hotel was good although concierge recomended a place called Penelope's 159 Lexington Avenue which did excellent breakfasts (Waffles, Pancakes, Fruit, Eggs anyway you want it and bags of charm) We had a superior room which was a decent size room, very very comfortable King size bed (much bigger than an English king) and decorated in vibrant colours. Room had good aircon, flat screen TV, excellent room service. Bathroms were compact but I guess that is what you expect in New York City. Only criticism would be a lack of storage place for our clothes and cases. The Door men were very helpful with hailing taxis etc. We had a wonderful visit to New York and would be very happy to reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mdcarr
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday night and were greated by the door man who removed our luggage and made some small talk while he walked us to the check in desk. The interior of the hotel was as expected, very modern and stylish. We went to our room and found that we did not get the double beds that we had requested. I called to reception and alerted them. They came straight up to the room with new key cards and a new room number. Very nicely handled. We noticed that their is not a lot of counter space in the bathroom, but that did not bother me at all since I am not a big make up girl anyhow. It was functional and had a nice layout. The room was an average size hotel room. Not a suite, but a room. I loved the quilts and wanted to take one home! =) I promised myself that I would address the price tag issue that I saw repeated on here. There are price cards for extras that are in the room. (the mini bar, snacks, robes if you want one, shaving kits, intimacy kits, etc) The cards are hardly noticable and did NOT take away from the room. I would much rather know what I will be charged if I take advantage of the items being there then be suprised. These cards were only in two areas and were not price tags per se, like I stated the were little cards with the info. Everytime we walked out of the door the door man would grab us a cab in no time. I was very impressed with the location and the great staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the MIdtown Area”
Reviews.Author: FOXY0099
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique-style hotel on 31st and Madison. It's Midtown without feeling like you're in tourist hell. Very modern look, excellent staff, rooms are well stocked with amenities, beds are comfortable. Ask for a room with a terrace during nice weather. It's not go out naked, but private for a big city. They have a little place for breakfast upstairs in the lobby. Nothing bad to say about this place. I have stayed here a few times for business and would definitely recommend it to someone coming to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo2001London
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roger Williams for 03 nights from 25-28th July. Was allocated room 1010 on arrival at around noon. First impression was very good, the hotel is well decorated and very well located, staff were pleasant and doormen always polite. Room was spacious however, in my opinion was not very functional. In the room there was a very small wardrobe, barely enough for 01 person, the bathroom was nice but again no space to put anything, also the shower didnt have much pressure. Me and my friend had 4 suitcases with us and it had to be left just on the sides of the bedroom, due to lack of storage space. Right after check in we went out for a walk and came back at 7pm, when we noticed that our bags had not yet been delivered to our room, I called reception and they made sure it was delivered immediately. There was a problem with the aircon and it wasnt working in my room, so they placed a mobile unit that was really noisy and in fact was just and air cooler, not very efficient in fact, as NYC was very stuffy and hot. The wireless connection worked for the first day only and then stopped working on my floor, they tried to fix it but to no use. There is a mandatory charge of USD12 a day for internet use and also for local calls, which I thought wasnt very fair, specially if you have no computer and still have to pay. I might have been unlucky this time, as I read good reviews about this hotel before booking, however its all about personal experience and mine wasnt very good. It seems that this is a great hotel being run by amateur people. Dont have plans to go back as I wasnt happy with what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place - 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: lenaDubai
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in midtown, located on Madison and 31st its pretty well positioned to be a NYC base The staff, especially the doormen who are exceptional, are great, really friendly and full of suggestions. Its a smallish hotel with hip styling a decent enough cocktail bar and gym. There is an excellent bar just around the corner open till late, a 24 hour italian deli across the street and empire state within striking distance like anywhere in NYC the rooms are small

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: phoenikia
Reviews.Content: Booked this for $192 pre tax through Quikbook. Great, quiet location, beautiful Art Deco lobby, nice clean rooms. There was a little wear around some edges, like the bathroom doors, but on the whole the room was great. Window was a little small, but hidden by a Japanese screen that was lit from behind. The bed was a California King, with highthread count sheets. Soft Turkish towels. Aveda bath products in the bathroom, and a fancy shower, with the rain type shower head, as well as a Euro style handheld shower extension. No bath, though. Staff was courteous. My only complaint would be that I never ended up getting to use the Internet at the complimentary computer because someone was always using it. It would be great if there was a time limit, and/or more than one computer available for use. I liked the fact that the hotel was at Madison & 31st, just a few blocks from Penn Station. Madison turned out to be much more quiet than I expected at night. I would be happy to return to this hotel on future visits to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business--will return for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: empressa
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New York to attend a conference, and chose Hotel Roger Williams because my company had block booked rooms there. I have to say that my company made a good choice in choosing this hotel. The first night I was due to arrive at around 6 PM but due to an incredibly delayed flight, did not arrive until around 3 AM the next morning. The front desk clerk was incredibly friendly and helpful, despite the hour, and really went out of his way to ensure that I had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. All of the staff members were equally friendly and courteous, and whether at breakfast or simply walking through the lobby, each person invariably had a nice word and a smile, but in a way that seemed natural and not forced. Given my jetlag, I appreciated the well-maintained 24 hour fitness center, and at 4 AM was the only one using it. As other reviewers have noted, the breakfast is a bit pricey, but given that I was traveling for business and had limited time, I did not take the time to look around for something cheaper. The breakfast was good, the atmosphere good, and it was available before 7 AM, a real plus for me. The location was ideal. It is an affordable cab ride away from most of the main Manhattan attractions, or a reasonable walk. Hotel staff can also provide good restaurant and bar recommendations in the area--there are several in close proximity. While I did not eat in the hotel restaurant, I did order room service one night, and enjoyed the meal. In terms of the room itself, I didn't spend much time there, but I was very satisfied. I really liked the bright modern colors, and was not put off by the number of items for sale. In fact I needed some of them, and appreciated having them so close. The bed was very comfortable, and the air-conditioning worked well when needed. All in all, I was extremely happy with my stay at the Roger Williams Hotel and I hope to be able to return to New York in the not-too-distant future. When I return, I will definitely choose the Roger Williams Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice midtown Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Roger" for two nights. After arriving earlier than expected, the front desk checked me in early (10AM), which was a great way to start my stay. The room was modern, clean, with a comfortable queen bed. Small closet & bathroom, the room had a nice flat screen TV & a small fridge stocked with mini-bar items. I did not try the breakfast at the hotel, but there were two charming cafes (Suble Tea & Keko) on Madison between 30 & 31 St. that were great for breakfast & very reasonable. I found a rate on Travelzoo that was just over $200 a night. Compared to what I have seen on other travel sites, I feel I got a fair price for a Manhattan hotel room. FYI... New York State & City taxes & hotel service fees add almost 25% to your total bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tolu-P
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to NY. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel. Its a nice contemporary style hotel. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The location right on Madison avenue is good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: calgirl13
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Roger Williams and was duly impressed. My only real complaint is that the bathroom is strangely designed. It has a huge shower that's all marble and super nice, but the rest of the bathroom is tiny. I barely had any room to put my makeup, blow dryer, etc. I stayed in the queen deluxe, and it is on the smaller side, but I suspect most hotels in NY have smaller rooms. The bed was almost too soft, my back actually hurt a little. The sheets appeared to be very clean (but you never really know 'til they turn on that night vision thingy, oh well). Nice flat screen tv. They also provided a really sturdy umbrella that came in handy during a thunderstorm. What I liked most was the staff. They were very attentive and friendly, and not in a forced way. They really went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and taken care of. I think they must hammer it into all their employees. Every time I was in the elevator with a staff member, they would go out of their way to make small talk and tell me to have a nice day. A couple of other things. They have free internet access via a laptop in the lobby so no need to pay the 10 bucks for internet via tv in your room. It's in a nice location, a block and half away from the 33d subway stop. I was a little bummed that breakfast wasn't included (btw, do not pay the 20 bucks for the breakfast buffet. Just walk outside and go next door to the tea cafe). I wouldn't recd this place for anyone traveling with children. Teens maybe, but not kids. It is not a kid friendly hotel. Better for singles or couples. All in all, a good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Most impressed”
Reviews.Author: cris6660
Reviews.Content: I had a nightmare flight getting to NY on Memorial weekend. I rang the hotel maybe 4 times to let them know that my flight was cancelled, delayed and I eventually transfered to another airlines getting me to the hotel 13 hrs late. I was greeted by the consierge with "just sign here and have a good night / morning sleep you look tired". Bags to room perfect after a 40 hour trip for a 4 hour flight. Room was Pent House Level. Although it was small for my standards it was very comfortable not much work area but the bed was to die for. Really nice linens and very comfortable. Balcony was very relaxing and calming. A regular room might have had more room. Room service was excellent quick and tasty. Mezanine level for breakfast had a good sellection of food for everyone. A little expensive but you are in NY. I had some business meetings at this level in the afternoon and was looked after very well from the staff. Concierge was very helpful with arranging directions and time schedules for trains and shows. Everyone of the staff genuinely were interested in what they could do to help to make our stay. Definately making this my comanies hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fastbloke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joy to come back to after freezing cold weather in New York. The rooms were lovely and comfortable to warm us back up. The breakfast is really good. The dining room is a nice place to sit, eat dinner and watch the snow blow past.

Reviews.Title: “A Week With Roger...”
Reviews.Author: LostInZurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Williams for a week in early April. One of us was working, the other taking a few days to rediscover Manhattan. Having spent a lot of time in NYC and being pretty well traveled, I was sceptical of what this property had to offer before we showed up. The website is a classic example of something trying too hard and just not making it. Compared to "classic" boutique hotels such as the Soho Grand, the Mondrian in L.A., well, there is no comparison. And the location in midtown is by no means the best that the city has to offer. Then there is the staff. At one point, we commented that it felt as if someone had bought a hotel and turned it over to a group of students to operate. We live in Europe and are used to, perhaps, a higher level of service - but regardless of where one lives, a certain level of professionalism is expected and this was often missing at this property. In general, too much "chit chat", especially when guests were in ear shot; typical for a New York bar maybe, but not at a hotel. That being said, most of the staff were very friendly and welcoming: the doormen were gracious (but should take it as a given to help with the bags); the staff at breakfast were, on the whole, wonderful in dealing with early morning grumps; the cleaning staff were thorough and charming; the staff at reception were generally competent and added a tough of, shall we say, New York color to the experience. The hotel has a nice fitness room which is open 24 hours and which is usually empty. Breakfast is very good. The room decor is truly not to everyone's taste. Tacky, to be honest. If you like the Paul Smith logo (multi colored stripes) well, you will feel right at home here - I believe he had a hand in the design scheme. let's just say he should stay well away from hotels. The rooms themselves are typical for this level of hotel in New York, not terribly large, not enough water pressure, but the beds are comfortable (extremely, even) and the views are not bad from the upper floors. In general, we were very happy with our stay at the hotel and would return, given the same budget. For the money you will have a tough time replicating this experience in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CBCGirl
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Roger Williams Hotel during the summer of 2007. Pros: Extremely helpful front desk staff, doorman, waitress. The decor was nice, hotel was very clean. Bright room. Lovely quilt. Aveda toiletries were a nice touch. Robes were provided. We left our luggage at the hotel after checkout and they tagged our bags, which is comforting, as all the European hotels I've stayed at simply left the bags aside unattended. Cons: The bathroom allows for little privacy. Our toiletries were not replenished on the second morning of our stay. For the price of the hotel, we expected to have it replenished! As someone else had mentioned, the numerous price tags in the room contributed to the hotel feeling more like a convenience store than a home away from home. The room was small, but it is to be expected for Manhattan. The buffet breakfast was decent but WAY overpriced. While I have no real complaints, I would probably not go back to this hotel due to the location and lack of value.

Reviews.Title: “a decent place to hang your hat in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: tbtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 3 day weekend in February. I haven't ever stayed in Manhattan before, but I imagine you're paying a big premium for the location. The rooms are very small, but outfitted nicely enough with colorful furnishings. It's reminded me a little of the 80's, with a studied attempt to be "zany", but it's better then boring and bland I guess. The annoying part is the bathroom is tiny but crammed with things you have to buy to use. I could have done without that, and it's a very tight fit if you you want to have any friends hang out with you in your room. The staff is very friendly (too friendly for me, but I don't like being greeted by the front desk every time I enter the hotel) and competent. Our friends met us at the hotel and they booked them right next door to us, which was nice. They were very quick to bring plates and utensils when we decided to have an in-room picnic from our LES forages (whitefish salad from Russ & Daughters is fantastic).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beds..............”
Reviews.Author: teetee5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Hotel Roger williams. The hotel is very modern, clean and appears to have been completly renevated. From the minute you pull up to this hotel the door man, the girls at the front desk, even the maids are so friendly and willing to help that its a pleasure. We had booked a king size bed but when we got to our room it was only a queen. I called and witihin minutes they wisked us away to a king size bed and could not appologize more. You will never sleep on a bed that is more comfortable then the beds here. The sheets, pillow and comfortable make your body just melt. The only down side(if there is one) is that the bathroom is so very small, but I would expect that with all manhattan hotels. Great hotel would definetly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cold as ice and too hip for me”
Reviews.Author: jweisberger
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams Hotel came highly recommended by a colleague. He loves it when in NYC -- I wont be staying again. My room was colder than ice. After complaining twice they moved me on my last night to a nice room - but it took a very loud heater to even make the room warm. Also, that room is over $1k a night and not worth re-booking. The decor is sort of like a gang of clowns ran wild at Ikea. The food involves too much ciabatta and aioli -- not enough basic fare. The wireless internet slow and spotty. All in all -- not for me.

Reviews.Title: “A price on everything”
Reviews.Author: LisaSa
Reviews.Content: I felt like this hotel is trying to be more upscale then it actually is. I was turned off by price cards everywhere in the room, I felt like every time I turned around in the small room there was another price card (desk, bathroom, nightstand, ledge, etc.). I felt like I was staying in a convenience store rather than a hotel. The hotel was quirky and I did like the decoration, the service and cleanliness. However, the design of the hotel was impractical, the bathroom was very small and the sink area had no room to put anything on it...maybe because part of the sink was cluttered with "for sale" items. Overall, the hotel was decorated well and was clean but was not very practicalâ€¦and I would have preferred less price cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fishcakes23
Reviews.Content: A great hotel two blocks from the Empire State Building. A very nice contemporary decor throughout the hotel, with friendly and informative staff, the hotel is well worth a stay. The room was slightly small but with huge bed and the only real downside would be the breakfast was a little pricey, but we just went to one of the local dinners! 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Fine and dandy”
Reviews.Author: RFBoston
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Roger Williams a few times over the past seven years or so, Since our last visit, they have refreshed the colors and mezz. kitchen-dining area. The locaton is great. The subway is nearby and Madison Ave. is not too loud. I found the staff from the front desk to the housekeepers very nice and helpful. Because the building is old, the room sizes and configurations can be hit or miss. Our bathroom on this visit was a shoe-box. Other times, the bathrooms are more spaceous but not huge. The bedroom was compact but ok. Clean, king size bed small desk, flat screen TV and closet. Some rooms can be really dark depending on the location. There are only 2 elevators and depending on the time of day, there can be a wait. Overall, I'll stay here again. The prices can vary alot depending on the day of the week and demand which typical.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, but not much for the money”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaTallahassee
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double double for five nights. Prices were about $400 for the first two nights and much lower for the weekend. There is virtually no lobby in the hotel, doormen were very helpful, however. The front desk staff were young and friendly. The room we were put in initially although we were told was deluxe, was not according to the description in the website. There were two double beds, but the room was absolutely miniscule. I am a female, and could hardly turn around in an incredibly awkward bathroom. The room was "fun" and decorated nicely. But the closet would hold maybe two coats, and the desk was about 24 inches across. We were then moved to a larger room, which met the deluxe criteria. The sliding glass door and shower only made the bathroom nicer. There was a desk. By the third night we were in the "right room" and were given a generous discount on the first nights by the manager. For me the bottom line is that this is still another NY boutique hotel governed by people installed/square foot. The decor was pleasant to amusing, the staff friendly and helpful, but, you know at these prices, one needs a real closet, a full length mirror, actual room service for breakfast, or a beautiful free buffet one, and at the very least, a bathroom as nice as at home, if not as large. Housekeeping was excellent, and the neighborhood convenient. I am too old to pretend to be comfortable in lilliputian surroundings no matter the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for NYC”
Reviews.Author: jim_grantjr
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently. Rooms are normally clean and doing very well. Always get a corner room with windows on either side. One note is that after staying there multiple times since September the rooms are starting to show the toll of NYC travelers. Still the bar is top notch and the service is world class. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mab367
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of $199 through Travelzoo, which doesn't get you much luxury in Manhattan. So, we were pleasantly surprised when we got to the hotel. It was within walking distance to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and close to the subway. The staff was incredibly nice. The room was stylish, clean and big by NYC standards. The hotel bar/ restaurant is small but a nice to place to go to grab a drink before a show or concert and their prices are not outrageous. Beware the minibar snacks though-they are about 3 times what you would pay at the deli down the street. The only fault we could find is that we couldn't figure out the heating/cooling system.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rabelaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Williams Hotel for 2 nights just before Christmas and found it to be a lovely and unusual hotel which was a lovely addition to our time in New York. We arrived on the train from Washington DC at Penn Station and then (having got slightly turned round as you tend to do in NY) walked the three or so blocks to the hotel (which was easy to spot with their Christmas lights flashing). We were allocated a room on the 15th floor with a lovely view of the Empire State building. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated with a guide book and an umbrella that you could use during your stay. There was a safe in the room, but it didn't look big enough for a lap top computer. The bed was rather soft, but fairly comfortable, and the pillows were clean. The bathroom was clean, but with some staining by the window and on the grouting and rust on the metal work by the sink. Also the floor was very slippy in socks (some bruised toes because of that). The negatives - well the sound proofing wasn't up to much - we could hear the televisions on in other rooms and conversations in the hallway, so take some ear plugs. Also, the staff are friendly, but seem surprised when you don't want a taxi and would rather walk. We didn't eat at the hotel, but would suggest that you go to the Blue Smoke Bar (a rib place at 116 E 27th Street, about 5 mins walk) for some fantastic food. The sweet potato chips were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: CLMCB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams for 4 nights in Dec 2007 (just before Christmas) and it was fantastic, I can not reccommend it enough - from the location to the decor to the staff it was great! I would agree with a review before that the rooms were very hot, but we just turned the heating off, kept the window open and it was fine. We were offered to change rooms but it really wasn't a big enough deal to do so (though we appreciated the offer!!). The staff were really great, and very helpful, I also found the use of a laptop (at the end of the reception desk) great for looking up little bits and pieces we wanted to do. They also have a great stash of maps that I found really helpful, just ask! We were staying on a room only basis, and were suprised and pleased to find invitations to have a complimentary breakfast during our stay, which we did, and it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: Chilli_the_pink
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending Christmas in New York. The hotel itself is great, loved the breakfasts, and the bar snacks and cocktails were gorgeous too. You do have to hide the bowl of sweets which are for sale, when you have a nine year old with you, and when space is a bit of a premium, filling the available space with merchandise for sale is a bit of an inconvenience. The rooms were so hot though, it took us three days before we managed to get the room down to a reasonable temperature so that we could sleep in those wonderfully soft beds. I suppose we could have asked the staff to do something about it, but we didnt and in hind sight i dont know why we didnt. I've never come across so many apparantly genuinely nice staff, who took such a pride in their work. Nothing appeared to be a bother for them, and they all seemed genuinely pleased to be able to help. Having spent a number of nights in hotels in the UK, where the front desk is staffed by people who barely speak english, never mind know anything about the hotel or its area, it really was a marked difference. We didnt really need any help, but heard plenty of what i would class as beyond the call of duty service being offered. Ensuring that reservations would be found for Xmas dinner, taking personal responsibility for ensuring that a return message would be taken and passed on. I'd forgotton that service could be like that in a relatively inexpensive hotel. Full marks to the staff, particularly the lady on beakfast duty who absolutely insisted that my daughter go around the buffet table one more time with a paper bag to have things for later. they made my christmas

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Affordable in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Gioia1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew East to the suburbs of Philadelphia from California to visit family for the Thanksgiving holiday...as a mini-vacation within a vacation (and a belated 1st anniversary present to ourselves) - we booked a room at the hotel roger williams for the Fri and Sat following the holiday. After taking the train into the city from Jersey, the hotel was thankfully very close to Herald Square/Penn Station (about 15 minutes brisk walk). Upon arrival there was a doorman to greet us, and hot cider to warm us from the cold. Check-in was quick, and after we got to our room, we got a courtesy call to make sure everything was ok...it was great! We had booked the room months before thru Quikbook.com and got a rate of $240 per night - we also requested that we get a room on one of the higher floors if possible and we were on the 10th floor (1014), with a small terrace that had a peek of the Empire State Bldg.... The hotel is on a quieter street, but really very close to your touristy attractions (the Empire State Bldg, as previously mentioned, Macy's, Madison Square Garden) and a good walk or a subway ride away from others. Our room was small but adequate, with chic decor, a flat-screen and a very...airplane-like bathroom. It was small...but the shower was great. Also beware of all the cute little kits you find in there, some are free, some aren't. Bathrobes are provided, and the linens were very comfortable and cozy. We were greeted happily by every employee of the hotel, and they even took pics of us outside the hotel by the sign! We had a look at the breakfast but didn't feel it was worth the price, so we ate at the restaurant across the street (Tasty's) -- much quicker and cheaper than the Bagel Brothers that was around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Golferjeff
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roger Williams far exceeded my expectations. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My friend and I were in New York for a weekend and when booking were only able to get a king size room. When we arrived they "pulled some strings" for us and got us a room with 2 double beds. The room, while small, was just perfect. The bathroom (again smallish) was put together beautifully. It really was a great use of space all around. What was surprising was that there was vitrually no sound coming into the room. We could not hear the streets below and did not hear any of the other guests on the floor. The location is great, too. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!! I really loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would recommend”
Reviews.Author: meonmyholidays
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Roger Williams Hotel and would definitely recommend it to all. The hotel isn't on the most exciting looking of streets but looked great all lit up inside and out with Christmas lights and tree! The hotel was clean and tidy, very modern and funky but also very comfortable. The staff were very polite and offered excellent service throughout our stay. We stayed in room 611 on the 6th floor. The room wasn't the biggest in the world, but not small either. We had a kingsize bed which was very very comfortable indeed. The bathroom was a good size also and had a shower and a bath. The wardrobe was big enough for a short stay and there was an iron, ironing board and umbrella in the wardrobe, plus an electronic safe. The room also had an alarm clock and a hairdryer in the bathroom which were also very useful. The mezzanine lounge changed from a breakfast bar / diner in the morning to a bar / resturant in the evening, very cleverly done! The breakfast was lovely. It offered a wide range of breakfasts and drinks all for a set price and you can have as much as you want. I would say that it is fairly expensive if you just want something small and a coffee but take some time and try a few things for breakfast to fill yourself up for the day and it is much better value! It was very nice though... We didn't eat at the hotel in the evening but all of the food looked very nice and the bar area was great for an evening drink before going up to bed. The hotel is only a 2-5 minute walk from the Empire State Building and Macy's and if you don't like walking the taxi's are so cheap to take you to places further afield. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel and can't fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “loved it.”
Reviews.Author: nycluvr
Reviews.Content: Excellent . The staff was amazing and very attentive to the needs of the guests. The rooms were small but very nice and clean. You can go to any NYC atraction with a $6.00 cab ride. I would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place - recommended”
Reviews.Author: pmc493
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in Midtown East Manhattan. Not the most exciting area of nightlife but reasonably handy for most places and NYC isn't the hardest place to get around! The hotel is a little on the small side but everyone makes you feel really welcome. There's a mezzanine bar that serves pretty decent drinks and food; perfect if you fancy a loosener before you go out or a night cap before you go to bed. I understand that there's a smallish gym there too but we didn't check that out, prefering to feel guilty rather than feel exhausted! The room we had wasn't the biggest in the world but prefectly adequate. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom and bedroom were really well kept and the room had a number of really nice little touches, e.g. a copy of Time Out New York and a copy of an insider's guide to the city located in the room. The hotel really ticked all the boxes and was really good value at the price we paid. Not the biggest or flashiest or most luxurious but a good hotel in a good location which had everything you needed and made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from here at all cost”
Reviews.Author: SidLee123
Reviews.Content: Please please please take my advise on this and stay away from this hotel at all cost. I travel on business at least half the year all over the world and have stayed in about 20-30 hotels in Manhattan, and i say this not lightly having stayed in some really bad hotels in India, but please this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in and i tried it 3 times and every time it just got worse, up until the last time when something so bad happened that i can't go into it on here or mention who the cause of it was as it won't let me. Just please fellow travelers listen to my warning, there is 1000's of hotels in Manhatten and you really would be better looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good loction and value”
Reviews.Author: goju
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel in a great location. Small rooms, big breakfast, great coffee. overall very good, would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but WAY SMALL”
Reviews.Author: HotPantsMalone
Reviews.Content: The staff is GREAT, and the lobby and common rooms are lovely, but the rooms are WAY too small, and have NO counter space at all. This place would be great, in my opinion for a male business traveller, but not someone who was going to NYC for pleasure and needed space to spread out. If you have a make-up bag or hair products, they will have no where to live, and the closets are tiny -- my college dorm room was bigger. My small room here was just impossible for my friend and myself, so we moved one block down to the Carlton, which is lovely and much more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, funky design, great rooms, great service, fair price!”
Reviews.Author: sissnitz
Reviews.Content: See review title. Sorry, to lazy to write a real review. It is a very nice NYC hotel, reasonably priced (we paid under $250 per night).

Reviews.Title: “this is a winner”
Reviews.Author: hwalk
Reviews.Content: small but well-appointed rooms. Room is clean and great bed. Air conditioning was a bit loud but well functioning.

Reviews.Title: “Thumb's up to the Roger!”
Reviews.Author: meiling_9
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Roger Williams were small but serviceable and the quirky little touches more than made up for it. I would call it a nice blend of modernity and old-school charm. There were cosy little quilts on the beds that helped liven up the room. And a sleek looking minibar with every 'trendy' snack or drink available on offer. Shame that they don't have a kettle for hot drinks as with other hotels. The room I stayed in had a tiny little window for some sunlight but because it faced a brick wall, I kept the screen shut most times. Staff were extremely friendly. There was a cab strike going on while I was there and they went out of their way to help me out. Even going as far as to negotiate good prices with the cabbies who weren't on strike. Very accomodating. It was nice to come back to such a homey place after a hectic day at Fashion Week. The concierge is very well-informed as to the IT joints to hit during the nights so you should ask him for recommendations As it was Fashion Week, the hotel was fully booked up by celebs and fashion types all round. I spied a few familiar faces so it looks like it's fairly popular with all. Had supper at their one and only restaurant cum bar and the food's good. Empahsis is on comfort and/or healthy food with some interesting choices. If you're looking for a tummy-busting brekkie buffet, you'd be sorely disappointed. Choices include muesli, bagels, croissants and the only warm-type food on display was a tray of creamy scrambled eggs. My only complain with the Roger Williams is that the bathrooms are tiny, cramped little things. But from what I understand, that's the standard in most NY hotels... unless you're forking our for The Plaza or something. It's centrally located in Midtown and you're pretty much a stone's throw away from most major must-go places in NY. Most things are about a 15-20 min walk, max.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Stay With Roger”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: Incredible stay from top to bottom, even with a glitch. I had to hit NYC for work and found a great rate on their website the week before the U.S. Open. The bellmen were the most welcoming and not just the first time you enter, but each and every time you arrive in the lobby. The maid staff were friendly and cheerful and the front desk staff were so accommodating. I reserved the wrong type of room on the hotel website by mistake, but because of extremely tight (and an almost sold out hotel) wasn't able to change it when I arrived. However, the front desk staff gave me enough options to choose from that worked. Staying in NYC isn't about the hotel...I'd hope that those who've written about the rooms will just get over it. You're there to see the city....go see the city. "What good is sitting alone in your room?" The hotel, however, is just as vibrant and such a welcoming relief from the day's travels. This was the best stay I've had in NYC in 12 years, and I've stayed in at least 30 hotels in the city. Go...and enjoy the hotel that brings hospitality back to the game...my friend ROGER!

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown find!”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa77
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 Sat night while we were in NYC to see a broadway show. The hotel is very conveniently located at 31st & Madison, which is close to 2 subway stations. (Only 3 blocks from the 33th& Park station for green lines to go up to the Met/Central Park East, and 4 rather long blocks to 34th/Herald Sq subway for orange lines to Natural History Museum/Central Park West - can go downtown from either stations). It's a very nice safe area to walk around in midtown, even when walking home after an 8pm show (only 3 blocks from the empire state building, and 1 block off 5th Avenue shops). There were always plenty of other tourists walking around so we always felt safe. The lobby is very grand with very prompt doormen who are handy for calling cabs. Our room on the 6th floor was very nice - The room was snug but comfortably fit a king size bed, a bench at the foot of the bed, a wardrobe, a desk, and a wall-hung flat-screen tv. The bathroom was much tighter of a space, but functional & had Aveda products, which was great. Everything was clean, and the whole hotel is smoke-free, which was a plus for us. The bed was very plush and the linens were silky soft. Of note, our room had no window, just a window shaped space at the head of the bed that was lit with lights from above, to simulate light coming through a window, i think. We didn't really miss having a view, but i guess some might. Our check-in & check-out was very efficient. They even call you about 10min after you check-in, just to make sure the room is satisfactory. The one thing that really stood out about this place was the extensive "mini-bar" offerings - from the standard min-fridge w/overpriced sodas & liquors to half bottles of Louis Jadot white & red wines on the counter to a full basket with snacks on the desk and a guidebook to NYC on the nightstand. Be mindful that you don't accidently take these items to be *free* and get charged $9 for a tin of breathmints! The same goes for the basket of goodies in the bathroom. Overall, we loved staying here! We booked on Hotels.com and paid about $200/nt, which we found was a good deal for a nicer hotel in this area of NYC. We didn't eat here, as there were lots of cheaper & more interesting places to go for meals right nearby. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “MOST HORRIBLE HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: city1
Reviews.Content: Please beware! This hotel falsely advertises its rooms to guests. My husband and I booked a Deluxe terrace room, as advertised in the information and pictures, as "supposedly" providing a large terrace overlooking the empire state and city. Not only did we not find the views, we could barely find the "terrace"; what we discovered was a tiny room, with a terrace not suffice enough for two people to stand on. In addtion, what was utterly disappointing was the manager's response to our complaint, oblivously indicating that there was nothing she could do. When we told her we had planned to reserve the room for a very special occasion, our wedding anniversary, she couldn't be less enthusiastic and at least trying to assist us. The Roger Williams counts on unsuspecting tourists who are at the mercy of their falsely advertised room views and amenities. Don't be fooled. In a city that prides itself on elite metropolitan accomodations, your money is best spent elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dcwritergrl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Meridian, the W, and the Hotel Gaansvoort and Rivington and this is honestly the best hotel experience in NYC to date. It's chic but not overly pretentious. The front desk was courteous and helpful. The bellhops were cute. ;) The rooms were clean, a good size, and quiet. Excellent shopping and the Empire State building are within extremely short walking distance. I will be staying here again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, unfussy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Upstate_Exile
Reviews.Content: After trying out a handful of other relatively cheap, relatively cool New York hotels--the Hudson, the Gershwin, the WJ--I thought I'd try the Roger Williams, a small hotel with an impressively airy lobby on Madison Avenue not far from the Flatiron. For around $300 I booked a special package--Manhattan and a Terrace--which basically included free breakfast, two complimentary cocktails, and a 'garden terrace room' on the top floor of the hotel. The room was incredibly sweet: spacious, brightly colored, and surprisingly quiet; the 'garden terrace' was basically a small rectangle of rooftop overlooking the Empire State Building: perfect for a nightcap. I'd read on TripAdvisor about the IKEA-like furnishings, and, sure, the overall vibe skews toward Scandinavia (read: clean lines, lots of orange and blue and green). My only real complaint about the room was the way in which practically everything was for sale: the desktop is almost entirely taken over by bowls of candy and bottles of water and wine, all of them (of course) yours if you're willing to pay for them. Who wants to spend the night in a 7-11? (Or, I guess, something slightly more exotic: er, Tesco Express?) The staff was ingratiating; the breakfast was abundant and full of little surprises (fresh blueberries, real prosciutto); and, most importantly, I slept really well. It's so rare for me to have this positive an experience at a hotel that I figure this is all worth mentioning. I don't know what the other rooms are like, but I'd definitely take my chances, particularly if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, Funky Decor”
Reviews.Author: MikeTA
Reviews.Content: I was set up in this hotel by my company for a 5-night business trip. The location is great, it's about two blocks from the Empire State Building, and close enough to Central Park to walk there on a nice day. Times Square is even closer. The service at the hotel is quite impressive. Extremely friendly and helpful staff at the front desk. The doormen are top-notch as well, always with friendly greetings and more than willing to stand out in the rain and hail a cab for you. The lobby, bar, and rooms have a sort of funky decor to them. It all looks relatively new, and quite clean. I think the hotel tries to be upscale and trendy, and it pulls it off. I can only think of a few down sides. The hotel price is steep, even for New York I think, though perhaps much of this is due to the time of year as well (late spring, early summer - a great time to be in NYC). The bathroom is tiny. Take a look at one of the user submitted pictures of the sink, which is perhaps 9 inches wide at best. It's located right up against a wall, so if you're right handed and trying to brush your teeth or comb your hair, you're in for a tough time. And one minor nitpick, the television was a nice new flat LCD, but it was quite small. All things considered, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReneeD61
Reviews.Content: We picked the Roger Williams after looking at a lot of hotels and reading many reviews. It really was an excellent choice. It was very centrally located, within a short distance of everything. The accommodations were nice. The hotel itself is old, but they have done a fantastic job of renovating it. The accommodations are not five star but the service and amenities are and the beds are extremely comfortable. The service at the hotel was really top notch. The common areas were eclectic. There is a nice lobby area and breakfast room/lounge. There is also a decent workout room. All in all, it was a great experience. I highly recommend that you book one of the better rooms.
