The Classic rooms are extremely small.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: sweetteaBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roger for 3 nights for a mini-vacation from Boston. The staff was absolutely amazing in every aspect...quick to help, quick to greet, and quick to smile. They did everything and everything sincerely. As for the hotel itself, nice boutique feel to the lobby and "bar". The room was quite small, but comfortable. The bathroom was definitely too small. But for the money, it is a great hotel in a great location. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk_in_Lawrence
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the weekend of May 26th. We had a great stay and everyone was extremely nice. The rooms are small (this has been covered by all), but not uncomfortably small. There was plenty of room for us. The place is very comfortable (rooms, lobby, bar, everything!), which I really enjoyed. It sort of made you feel at home. We plan on trying to stay there any time we come to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyGirl2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 6 nights at the Roger Williams hotel (booking through a deal on lastminute.com) when on a trip to New York with a friend. We'd checked out the good reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location - just a few blocks from the Empire State Building. We had flown into Newark airport and access to the hotel was really easy - either by yellow cab (note that they charge per meter from Newark), or taking the train to Penn Station which is really close. The staff were all very welcoming and friendly throughout our stay, with very courteous doormen seeing you in/out and flagging you a cab if needed. There is wireless connectivity in the hotel, but without a PC we were able to use a complimentary hotel computer to do our online check in on the way home and print our boarding passes. The room size (we had a standard double) was completely fine for two people - plenty of space for bags etc.. - and the bed was SOOo comfortable! The mini bar and in-room snacks were well stocked, and the flat screen TV was great. We were on the 14th floor and you didn't hear any street sounds. Breakfast was a nice spread, but there were also lots of cafe's and diners nearby if you wanted an alternative. I would definately recommend this hotel, and would stay here again if I ever visit NY for a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PopsBen
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday from a booked at the last minute 4 night stay at the Roger Williams and couldn't fault it in any way. We arrived late on Thursday night, ordered room service and settled into the perfectly clean and comfortable room. Amazes me that people complain about the size of the rooms, nowhere in New York are you going to get vast rooms, but these are not the smallest we've experienced by far. Our room was a standard double and this was plenty big enough for 2 people with bags and bags of shopping. Bed was extremely comfortable, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for a few nights stay and the bathroom was more than adequate. Large walk in shower and plenty of shelf space, ok it had a small basin (as one reviewer commented) but come on you only need it to wash your face and clean your teeth... not to bath in it. Used the hotels dry cleaning service which was extremely efficient and good value. Mini bar was well stocked and most of all the room was really quiet, you could only just make out the sound of the streets below if you turned off the aircon and tv and lent up against the window! The staff at the hotel were so helpful, recommending some lovely places to go and eat from a fairly expensive fish restaurant (BLT Fish off Union Square) to a reasonably priced ribs and burger restaurant (Blue Smoke on Park and 27th). Breakfast at the hotel was fairly expensive ($12) for a cold buffet but the hotel is so central that there are plenty of places within a 5 min walk to go and grab a full cheap spread and reception were happy to help by suggesting places. If you don't mind walking for more than 5 mins there is so much within walking distance as well, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue - Even the walk to Central Park is only 20 mins. All in all we had a really enjoyable stay and have already recommended it to friends hoping to go to New York later in the year. If you're looking for a smallish boutique hotel with a more personal service than a large chain then the Roger Williams is perfect. Looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRD90
Reviews.Content: Nice, small boutique hotel. Rooms are on the small side, but well appointed. Staff very helpful. Breakfast at the hotel a must. Stay here if looking for a place with personality, rather than the usual chain hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not a huge fan”
Reviews.Author: icechik74
Reviews.Content: We stayed during an unusually warm weekend for New York. Our room was a sauna all weekend - to the point where my friend and I literally had to hang out in our underwear (nice and awkward) whenever we were in the room, getting ready, etc. I complained to hotel staff and the only solution they could come up with was to open our window. Believe it or not, that still wasn't much help due to the paper window covers. I didn't like the wooden floor/showers, and bathroom was tiny. I'm pretty sure the bed was the hardest I've slept on aside from a hotel in Germany where I once stayed. It was pretty conveniently located but I found it to be a bit "snooty," (staff mainly). I wouldn't come back here - my normal fav. hotel is the Millenium Broadway & it's much better for a variety of reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gnettio
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York and we were very happy with the Hotel Roger Williams. We got a superior room with a king size bed on the 12th floor and there was more than enough room. The room was well designed and decorated and we had a very atmospheric view from our room over the snowy roof tops of New York. The staff were very friendly and nice and always willing to assit. Your close to everything but also far enough away to get a bit of peace from the hustle and bustle. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a modern contempory stay with a twist of New York style! Happy Holidays!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unusually personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Pepperx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend rendezvous with NYC friends, and the Roger Williams was SO great - bell boys and registration clerks remembered our names, service was super. Ran into someone else at the hotel who made the same comment. I even wrote the hotel later to compliment them on their service - and I almost NEVER do that!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !.”
Reviews.Author: StevieDChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel between the 9th and 11th Feb. As we all know finding a good hotel in NY can be the equivalent of playing a game of russian roulette. The Roger Williams ticked all the right boxes. Great Location away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but within comfortable walking distance of it. The Empire State Building is a 5 minute walk away. The room was a good size and decorated in a contemporary syle with nice touches (wall mounted flat screen TV, throw pillows and accent mirror). Bathroom was a bit small but was more than adequate. The staff were very friendly and the doormen were extremely helpful and polite. The mezzanine bar provides a cool location to enjoy a few cocktails. In summary we were extremely happy with our decision to stay at the Roger Wlliams and would have no hesitation in booking the hotel the next time we stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: waltersmeg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in NYC and a stay at the Hotel Roger Williams. The stay at this small, funky hotel was great. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful- above what I have found at similarly priced hotels. Rooms are not big, but cozy with bright colors and cool accent pieces. The decor was modern, warm and inviting. There is a mezzanine level with a bar and restaurant that has a nice relaxed atmosphere and good food and drink at reasonable prices. The breakfast is by far one of the best things about the stay- fresh fruit, croissants, and other goodies along with the daily papers. We commented several times that it reminded us more of a bed and breakfast than a hotel- just without the Laura Ashley decor. We will definitely stay there on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the New York Gift Show. We loved the hotel. It is modern and beautifully appointed with wonderful public spaces. There is a small bar area where breakfast is served as well as drinks and light lunch/dinner selections are offered. There are several wonderful restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are small but also lively, fun and modern. Whoever designed this hotel did a great job.The bathroom was very small but certainly had everything necessary. The staff is exceptional and very helpful. We felt very taken care of. I would have loved a coffee maker, but other than that it was a lovely hotel in a great location and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: BonnieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Williams both for Thanksgiving and then for Christmas, for several days each visit. The staff is unbeatable and they are genuinely friendly, incredibly helpful, totally professional. Every interaction with a front desk person or bellman was exceptional. I will go back just for the staff. The rooms for both visits were each very well decorated and with heavenly beds. I had no noise problems either visit. All items functioned. I find the decor really fun and invigorating, and the setup of the room and the bathroom was ingenious. I was totally comfy in my room and felt so welcome by the staff. The location is perfect for my needs as it is close to Gramercy Park, Union Square and within walking distance to Soho, Times Square, etc. The immediate area is loaded with great restaurants, delis, yogurt and tea places. I found the price very reasonable for the accomodations and the service and the location. Can't recommend this highly enough! Bonnie from California

Reviews.Title: “Very unique, in a good way”
Reviews.Author: erinly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Roger Williams on New Years Eve. I knew nothing about the hotel, but fell in love with the pictures on the website. In person, the hotel looks exactly as pictured. Very modern, very fun, although my boyfriend rightfully commented that it looked like we were staying in an Ikea Showroom. The room was smaller than others we've stayed in, but suited us perfectly. It was neat and comfortable. The bathroom was small, but what else do you need in the bathroom? We ate dinner in the lounge on the Mezzanine level. The drinks were tasty, as was the food ( I had the Salad Nicoise, he the Beef Carpaccio) . All in all, we had a very nice time and I would recomend the hotel to anyone who doesn't want to stay in a "cookie-cutter" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: ajmmd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams after reading the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor. The week was ultrabusy with school vacation and holiday activities well in gear. The hotel is in the Murray Hill area...not known to me from previous trips to NYC. It is colorful to say the least...and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Rich, the manager of food service was a graduate of Johnson and Wales in Providence ...so we tapped his knowledge of restaurants in the city. The room is tiny and the bathroom microscopic but clean...the front desk person also helps with concierge duty...again hit or miss. Travelzoo rates made the stay a plus...but I would probably skip a rebooking at full fare.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay at the Mercer!”
Reviews.Author: molokoid
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel cannot manage it's bookings well, you are wise to double and triple check your reservations! We booked two roof terrace rooms and received two confirmation numbers. Three days later we received one confirmation email. A twenty minte phonecall reveals that we only have one room booked, so we had to book another. There is much confusion as they appear to have two seperate systems, a centrally managed helpline and a local system, and the two may not always sync! Two days before arrival, we get a call to confirm our bookings, a very pertinent, some may say rude lady, patronisingly going through the details to ensure I have got them right! Arrival at the hotel. Foyer and reception areas are great. Spacious, well designed and welcoming. Free internet is unfortunately just one laptop placed on the side of the reception desk. All a bit ad-hoc. Rooms were poor. When we stayed there was heavy construction work going on right next door, nothing was mentioned when booking, it made the roof terrace not exactly private and the noise was unbearable! A request with reception was handled efficiently, although they did try to tell us that the builders 'will be very quiet'. Of course they will!! Anyway, room standard is below average. They room is hastily and poorly decorated, paint finishes are awful, air con ineffective and loud, bathroom is cheap and unmaintained. It's just not what you expect from a medium to high end boutique hotel. I can only imagine that all the other reviews on tripadvisor are from people who are used to staying in TravelLodge's and hence this really is a step up! The wardrobe was a freestanding affair, awqardly placed, chipped mirror front containing four coat hangers! Basically, for the money this is appalling. Having stayed at the likes of The Mercer, 60 Thompson etc these are far far better designed, serviced and maintained for an equal cost to Roger Williams. Couldn't recommend unless you managed to secure a huge discount.

Reviews.Title: “The Roger Williams was a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: NYNative
Reviews.Content: We paid $400 for a one night stay at the Roger Williams the night of Dec. 16th, (booked through ORBITZ) and it was the worst hotel experience we have ever had. The room was minuscule - even for New York standards- and we travel there frequently. For example the night stands (attached to the walls) were less than 12 inches wide, and the bathroom sink was probably not much wider than that. We literally felt "wedged" into the tiny bathroom. There was no closet - just a tiny wardrobe about 2 1/2 feet wide. The worst part is that there was no window! Actually there was a cheap mockup of a "Japanese screen"in front of a dilapidated old window that they obviously wanted to hide. Walls were paper thin. At 4:00 in the morning we were woken by a guest blasting a CD - 4 floors below us (we were on the 8th floor). The "concert" lasted until 5:00 a.m. with only excuses from the hotel staff. Even walking in the hallway of the hotel felt claustrophobic - it was so narrow that there wasn't room for two people to walk side by side. And I seriously doubt that anyone over 6'2" would fit - the ceilings were incredibly low. The very ample and lovely lobby was deceptive - this hotel is an overpriced DUMP. Travelers beware- of both the Roger Williams and of using Orbitz for hotel bookings. We will avoid both in the future.

Reviews.Title: “we love roger”
Reviews.Author: sandhills1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Beautufully decorated public areas and rooms. Room very comfortable with lots of extras available if we wanted them e.g.stocked fridge and bathroom goodies Exceptionaly helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “High Design, Low Budget”
Reviews.Author: timo12561
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the snazzy rooms. Great look and outstanding design, accomplished on a budget. Staff friendly and accommodating. Breakfast good. Unfortunately, our room was quite warm on a visit in November and did not have an air conditioner that functioned properly. Sleeping was a problem; not something you'd expect for $400+ a night. In addition, the street noise is a real issue if you open your window to cool the place down. Expect garbage trucks and other hubbub of Manhattan to wake you up around 6am. On the whole an acceptable choice in a challenging hotel market for visitors to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Hassle free”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Carno
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 night stay at the Roger Williams New York. Stay was superb from start to finish. Check in never been simpler just gave them my name and they knew how long we staying for no fobbing round for travel documents. Taken straight to room by bellboy, didn't really get the feeling that the staff were pressing for tips for everything as they sometimes do in the states. Room very modern, and clean. Bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Bathroom a bit small but was clean and did the job. Found desk staff very helpful willing to point you in the right direction for places to see eat out e.c.t. Didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to get out and about so can't comment on it. Location just what we wanted away from the time square tourist traps but not miles away from everything. Very short walk to 33rd station on the 6 line. To top it off on checking out we went for a last walk round the Big Apple and after leaving the luggage while we went out the doorman asked if we would like a car to Newark airport, we presumed he was going to hail us a cab. When we returned to leave for the airport couldn't beleive it when our cases were put in the back of a Bentley Continental for our return to the airport, and only 65 dollars including tolls. Really nice driver as well who chatted to us all the way back. A very nice way to end a superb holiday. Thanks to all at the hotel for making our stay such a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Liz10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and stylish. However, there were a number of fundamental problems that left me disappointed with the Roger Williams. First, they didn't have the deluxe terrace room we booked available for us when we arrived. We had to move midway through our stay. Secord, neither "deluxe" room we stayed in had the king sized bed promised on their website or in our booking. Third, at the end of October, the heat was not working. Our room wouldn't warm past 58 degrees. The promised space heater never arrived. Fourth, while rain shower heads look nice in the design mags, those at the RW don't produce any water pressure. Perhaps they should re-name them "drizzle" shower heads. Its was awfully hard to rinse those fancy Aveda products out of my hair, as I stood shivering in the icy cold air. I am not one of those folks who complains about room size or traffic noise - its New York for heaven's sake. But at $450 a night I would expect some of the simple comforts - like heat and water, and the bed I was promised - to be delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and HIGH class!”
Reviews.Author: JennyOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I landed in JFK just before 6 am from a red-eye cross country flight, managed to find my way by cab to the hotel. I was a total mess, but was greeted by friendly welcoming and helpful people in the beautifully decorated lobby. They assisted me to finding my room with my luggage. Don't be alarmed at how small the elevators are - you may have to wait your turn if you check in at a high traffic time. It is a historic building after all, but updated so well it only adds to its charm. The room itself was also small, however was made up so perfectly it left nothing more to be desired. Decorated with contemporary furniture and cheerful colors, it was much more modern than I had expected. The king sized bed took up most of the room, but was worth it as it was made up with soft white sheets, a down comforter, and a colorful quilt. There was a desk and a flat screen wall mounted TV. The wardrobe had a full length mirror and there was a cushioned bench at the foot of the bed. The bathroom was also amazing; green marble counter tops, stainless steel sink and stocked with great products. I couldn't have been happier - especially considering how in need of a nap i was. We only stayed for a long weekend but loved coming home to this hotel each night. We were within comfortable walking and cab distance to everything we wanted to do in the city or the village. The price I found on line was unheard of at the time, the rates were usually twice as high. If you find a good deal, snap it up. Or if you think you're worth it at full price, you won't be disappointed. One of my top 3 favorite hotels I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down, Best Hotel in NYC I've Ever Been To (and probably anywhere....)”
Reviews.Author: CassandraRae
Reviews.Content: I recently stumbled upon the Hotel Roger Williams quite by accident. I was originally checked in at the Kitano Hotel, which was a nightmare from beginning to end, and I decided quickly that I needed to find somewhere else. I vaguely remembered someone telling me about the Hotel Roger Williams, so I thought I would take a stroll down Madison Avenue to check it out and see what kind of rates they could offer. From the moment I stepped in, I was greeted with the kind of friendliness usually reserved for somewhere where people still wave to strangers. As I spoke to the woman at the front desk, I was almost alarmed at her helpfulness. It can really catch you off guard in a city like New York. Before I knew it, I was checked in for the weekend, and so was my colleague (who hadn't even wanted to change her hotel, but was so charmed by the woman at the front desk and the overall quality the hotel, that she decided to book in as well). The stay itself lived up to the hype - and actually surpassed my expectations. The rooms were a good size for Manhattan, very well decorated, with super, super comfortable beds, and the overall attention to detail was truly impressive. I was in the city partly for business and partly for pleasure, and the hotel did a great job of meeting requirements for both. Their creative use of space meant that we had a desk, with ample space for working, without feeling cramped. The free wireless was also helpful (donâ€™t you hate it when hotels charge for internet?). We found a Time Out New York, and a book on New York City's hidden treasures waiting for us in the room, Aveda products in the bathroom, and a whole host of useful toiletries which you could purchase for a very reasonable price. (For anyone who travels as much as I do, I'm sure you'll appreciate how convenient this is - if I had a penny for every time I've forgotten my toothpaste or razorblade...) The customer service was absolutely top-notch throughout our entire stay. Even the food in the restaurant was great! All in all, I had fantastic stay, at very reasonable price for mid-town Manhattan. To put my review in perspective, I travel for work about 6 months out of the year throughout North and South America, Europe, the Middle East and Africa. So, I pretty much live half my life in hotel rooms. I struggle to think of a better overall experience Iâ€™ve had anywhere else. Certainly, in New York City, this is will be my top-choice from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “A really cute, colourful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornishKirsty
Reviews.Content: This hotel has luxuriously comfortable beds, and the beautiful and colourful decor in the rooms were a joy to come back to. It feels warm and individual. Our bathroom was small but had a large shower which was perfect, (I put the plug in had a 'mini bath' anyway!) and the free Aveda products were a treat! Every morning we walked up Madison Avenue to Grand Central Station and had breakfast at The Pershing Rooms...amazing breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, discriminatory staff”
Reviews.Author: TripAdMemberNYC
Reviews.Content: The snobby hotel staff was rude and condescending. They even let several people go in front of me even though I was standing right in front of them! This hotel should be avoided at all costs. Moreover, the rooms are so small you cannot even open your suitcase. This is not an exaggeration. I had to put my suitcase on my bed to get things out.

Reviews.Title: “Homey, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ffarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roger Williams for four nights mid August for business mostly. I was on my own so wanted a hotel that was accessible, comfortable and safe. I did tons of searching re: price, convenience, location and comfort and decided on this hotel. The exterior pictures concerned me a bit because it looked so austere in a neighbourhood that seemed almost deserted, strange for NYC. I was pleasantly surprised that it was not really so - Madison at 31st is so close to everything - and the hotel's interior is so warm and inviting I felt instantly at home. A beautiful fresh arrangement of orchids greets you as you walk in with brightly coloured chairs in the lobby; in the evening lots of candles. The doorman was very pleasant and brought my suitcase right in - had a hello and "have a good day" every morning and an open door and hello every evening. I agree, the staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. My room had no view (;c( and although the windows opened for some fresh air, the air circulating/conditioning units 5 floors down were very noisy. I did have a problem with the tub holding water (a hot bath was a must after pounding the pavement all day) but the front desk moved me to another room after they found it would not be a quick fix. All in all, this hotel helped to make my trip very enjoyable. Even with the slight problems mentioned above, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Staff and Value”
Reviews.Author: JWORD
Reviews.Content: A colleague of mine stayed at the hotel for extended periods in 2005 and 2006 during a long term assignment. We both fell in love with the place: 1) Amazing Staff - very friendly, bend-over-backwards helpful and kind. Good management comany (Oceana Hotel Group), they own four properties in LA and NYC. The concierge (Neil) is a young guy and a New York native and has legitimately good restaurant / nightlife recommendations. 2) Great Lounge - the hotel was recently renovated by a notable NYC archtect (I forget the name) and the lounge was designed to feel like your living room at home, which it does. The drinks are great, and food is quite exceptional. They have a great cheese board, as well as a number of appetizers, sandwiches, and a small selection of entrees. The portions are a tad on the small side but fine. Prices are standard NYC hotel bar prices but way above par in terms of quality. 3) Nice Rooms - the rooms are well-decorated and modern. Internet is free throughout the hotel via WIFI. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is slightly oddly configured (there is a church attached to some of the property) so there is a large varielty off room designs and layouts. Room size note - any 'standard price' hotel room in New York City, especially in an older building, is going to be small. Rooms range in size from tiny to generous, with the bulk being just fine. The tiny rooms are ones that are only sold on high-occupancy nights and the staff will gladly switch you to another room if one is available. 4) Excellent location - located only five blocks away from several large companies, Madison Square Park, nice walk to Union Square, three blocks from Empire State Building, a good number of restaurants in the area (and growing). Short cab ride to Central Park, Lower East Side, Village, etc. 5) Price - the company I work for has a prenegotiated rate with the hotel that makes it a no-brainer. If you work for one of the companies in the area I'd definitely check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnIntrepidTraveler
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful hotel! I have had bad experiences in NYC before and was skeptical we could find a good hotel in a convenient location. Granted we cabbed it everywhere, but was as easy to get to the Met as it was to get to the Village. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll go again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 21st wedding anniversary, and they upgraded us to a terrace room for no additional fee. The room was very clean with a view of the Empire State Building, overlooking Madison Ave. We picked it for the location and price, and it's a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: itrapnell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Roger Williams in Feb 2006 for a work trip, and was very impressed. I'm not sure I have ever stayed in a hotel where I was so impressed with the staff. They are super-friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. The hotel itself is nice, although as with many New York hotels the rooms are a bit on the small side but well decorated and quite trendy. The pictures on their website are accurate. the second time I stayed there, I was welcomed back with a room upgrade to a penthouse room, with a huge terrace with a great view of the Empire State building, and a card from the manager - nice touch. The hotel is centrally located on Madison Avenue. Overall, very good. I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: Chasescout
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Roger Williams for a weekend of shopping in March. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Beds were extremely comfortable and you couldn't help but sink into the lovely crisp white sheets and tons of pillows. Fun, modern decor including a blue resin floor lamp and brightly coloured quilts. The bathroom was of adequate size (the shower was actually quite roomy) and stocked with Aveda products. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small small rooms - but good price”
Reviews.Author: juliannac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit trendy with an art deco feel to it. I suppose most hotel rooms in New York are tiny but this literally left room for one bed and dresser. Beware, this is not a room you should plan on hanging out in. It was just me and my husband and we felt like we were on top of each other. With that said, we got a great deal for $199 and this was a very nice clean hotel for that price. The location was good and walking distance to Union Square. It's a quiet area of town so you SHOULDN'T have revelers making noise all night. But the walls are paper thin, that we had to get management to talk to the room next to us to ask them to stop making so much noise at 2am on a Thursday night. The walls are so thin you can easily overhear coversations so if you think you are communicating in private here, think again! Very nice friendly service however and we didn't bother dining here since there are so many wonderful alternatives to this hotel's dining.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fat_elvis_luv
Reviews.Content: I'm infatuated with this hotel. Immaculate, modern rooms,reasonable rates and attentive service. Big, fluffy towels and Aveda amenities. And the bed is amazing. Really. I took the redeye in from L.A. and was allowed to check in eight hours early without any hassle whatsoever. In fact, every staff member I encountered, from front desk to bellhop to server, was, without exception, genuinely friendly, positive, and accomodating. The hotel offers a good European-style breakfast, which was included in my room rate. The location of the hotel makes it easy to walk practically everywhere, although the subway is just a short distance away. The only negative to consider is the noise from the street-facing rooms can be a bit intrusive, but that's NYC. If you want peace and quiet, go to Maine instead.

Reviews.Title: “Much too small!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerPhl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are much too small! The bathroom was so small, you had to turn sideways to get into it! There was no dresser or drawers to place any clothes in. There was a charge for everything! (toothbrush, toothpaste, "free" internet, etc.) Although the restaurant had very good meals, I think that was the only good part about this hotel. The price is much too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kvill79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here and it was marvelous!! From the moment we walked into the hotel the staff was very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were a decent size and had everything you could possibly need right there for you. It was extremely clean!! I am just so overly excited about this hotel. I have never stayed in NY before so I was unsure of what to expect. I will definatly go back and stay here. The location was excellent it was waking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of $250 'Smoking Fee' scam!!”
Reviews.Author: dagneytaggert
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is cute, and in a decent location. Rooms are small, but trendy and modern. Overall, an OK stay, but not worth the rack rate. My big gripe, however, is that about a week after checking out and getting my credit card bill, I saw that they stuck a $250 charge on my credit card, separately from the total charge for the hotel stay. When I called to find out what this was, I was transferred to Accounting, and finally told that this was a "Smoking Fee". Given that I am a nonsmoker, I was shocked! Apparently, the housekeeping staff reported that my room had been smoked in. It took a week and three calls to get the situation cleared up. In the end, they weren't even apologetic. They made it seem like they were giving me a "free pass". I was insulted and would never, ever recommend this place. If you do go, I would recommend you carefully check your credit card bill afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 6 night stay at The Roger Williams. Everything about it was perfect. After a very long and tiring journey arriving to such warm, friendly and helpful staff really made an excellent start to our holiday. The hotel is very well located - near a subway, short walk to Empire State Building with plenty of good delis and restaurants nearby. We could not have asked for more. We got a great rate on our room which made it extremely good value for money. The rooms were bright and colourful and the beds SO comfortable. I agree with other reviews, the bathroom was very tiny, but the shower itself was roomy and very good. This really is a lovely hotel and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; super-friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: BLB100
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect!! My husband and I stayed here at the end of March '06. Great room, very clean, and given NYC standards, it was decent size. The beds were so comfy! Bathroom a bit small; but it's New York. All of the employees were quite nice and helpful. We felt well-taken care of. The European breakfast was an unexpected delight -- excellent food, beautiful dining area. Don't be thrown off by any negative reviews. This is a WELL-PRICED, very chic hotel in mid-town! It's a gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Cute, and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Roger Williams over the weekend of March 10th. We had a late flight and didn't arrive until 1am, just as the restaurant/bar was closing. The staff was very helpful in getting us checked in and had several recommendations for late night food in the area. We also received an upgrade to their garden terrace room on the penthouse floor! While the room was small (normal in NYC, I hear), it, like the rest of the hotel was bright and cheery, clean, and very comfortable. The staff (desk clerks, doormen, cleaning staff) were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a bit pricey, but not really all that much by New York standards and had a good selection of pastries, bagels, cereal, fruit, coffees, and teas. We really liked the area of town, too. It is mostly residential, so feels safe and is quiet at night and was only a 15 minute walk or $5 cab ride from good shopping and busier attractions further up Madison. Only a few blocks from Empire State Building, too. Overall, we really liked the Roger Williams. It was a great value and I know I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little funky and a great value”
Reviews.Author: Dave7702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there the weekend of March 3-5 and really enjoyed it. We booked the rate through their website ($219 a night) and had a great room with good colors with a big bathroom by NYC standards. The hotel is a boutique hotel and with the colors looks like it should be in California or Florida. The service was excellent and I have no complaints at all. The gym has good machines, flat screen TVs and they make good use of the space. We did not eat or drink there, but the bar is open until 1am. Self-service parking or valet parking around the corner was a big help also. Neat little area if you want to get out of Times Square and explore Murray Hill and be within walking distance of shopping on 34th Street or great eats by Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC - stayed at Roger williams. Wow - what a great hotel. Great decor - modern, clean look. The room was pretty big (for NYC that is :)), the bed was super comfortable. Staff very friendly. They also have a gym and a restaurant/lounge... drinks are a bit pricey but its very nice to chill in anyway.... Also - great location. Totally worth the price :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travellinglisa
Reviews.Content: Stay: Feb 19 - 21, 2005 GOOD: Hotel has character. Lobby was very nice - a modern colorful spin...loved the colors throughout the hotel. The room was spacious (deluxe king) and comfy. Loved the NYC travel book in the room for use during the stay - found great spots based on the recommendations. FREE WI-FI. Great lobby. Friendly staff. VERY CLEAN and recently remodeled. Aveda products. Good location - in the middle of everything, but not in the middle of everything. Flat screen TV. Good value for location. Would stay again. BAD: No coffee maker in room. Cold room. A bit loud due to construction. Concierge recommendations so-so. Had candles throughout room but nothing to light with. Tons of goodies - snacks, lotions etc, but for a $$$. Bathroom was small (average NYC size). Warnings: Room was cold. Loud due to construction next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie-O
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the glowing reviews here at tripadvisor. The hotel room was very clean, sleek and modern. Lovely, cozy lobby. Cabs at the door. Most sights within easy walking distance. Unfortunately, it was around 25 degrees our entire trip so it was very brisk walking for us. Do take a trip to the Empire State Building which is a few blocks away at night and see the city in all of its sparkly glory. The beds and down comforters are high quality. They supply AVEDA bath products - nice plus. We did not eat the breakfast but right across the street is TASTY cafe. Not too fancy but you can get a good bagel, coffee and OJ for under $5.00 which can be hard to come by in NYC pricewise. My husband and I will definately be coming back to stay at the Roger Williams Hotel. Also, staff and service were friendly, efficient and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bayblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roger Williams for one night between Christmas and New Year's. The rooms are small but stylish, and the beds are heaven. One elevator was broken, but they were repairing it and everything else-- service, etc. was wonderful. The location was blissfully quiet at night (sometimes hard to sleep in the city that doesn't)yet convenient to all the sights. Just watch out for charge add-ons --the extra basket of goodies in the bathroom all cost extra is you use it and the breakfast served in the morning is not free as intimated when you check in. We got an excellent internet price and I'd definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: maizen621
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roger Williams for a long weekend. We did really like the location as a subway station was close by and we could also walk a lot of places. As other reviews mention, the bedding was really comfortable. I did not think the room was anything special. Really small and we had no view. While we liked the hotel, we would probably try a different hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great service- Great deal! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight stay at the Roger and it was terrific. The staff was particularly pleasant and welcoming. We arrived earlier than we had expected / much earlier than check in time and we were given our room with no fuss and no questions asked. House keeping was great , with super-quick (almost immediate!) response to our request for extra towels. The room itself was very nicely styled, great TV with loads of stations, clean and smallish but standard size for a Midtown hotel. Plenty of storage space in the closet and a lovely bathroom with fantastic shower. Of note was the incredibly comfortable bed and bedding - could have slept for days! It was a great place to come back to after a long day and night on the town. We had not heard of this hotel prior to our visit. We took a chance on the Roger -and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine31
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two children enjoyed our stay at the Roger Williams so much we feel we needed to tell everybody about it. Philip on reception greeted us and was more than helpful. The room was a good size,and was spotless.Looking left out of our window we had a good view of the Empire State Building, which at night, when lit up looked amazing.The most comfortable beds awaited us every night, giving us a fantastic nights sleep.The Breakfast was a little expensive,but most enjoyable. My family now deams of our return trip.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Hotel Roger Williams...there was an atmosphere of beauty and friendliness. The doors were opened for us...we were welcomed as we came in and bid a 'good day' as we walked out! The rooms are all different. When I made the reservation (months before!), I asked for a larger room as we'd have 3 adults. They upgraded me to a Superior Room for no extra charge...but it's not like the rates are bargain rates! The rooms are expensive...but the location is superb. Being a boutique hotel, there are no cookie-cutter rooms. Our room was a decent size by NYC standards, but small by any other city's standards! There were 2 double beds, a desk, a large TV, a tiny closet which included shelves for clothing, lots of lamps, and a nice area of SPACE to spread out your stuff! Each bed had a bench on the foot of it...where we put our suitcases. The room decor is all primary colors - nice to awaken to!! The bedding was wonderful - down comforters and nice quilts. The windows were "very cool" - ours had an electric room darkening shade, and a screen that slid shut instead of drapes. The bathroom was nice - nice sink, nice shower stall, mediocre water pressure but it had a "rain showerhead" as well as a showerhead on hose. The hotel is on the corner of 31st and Madison. We were able to walk everywhere - location was wonderful! I spent many late nights on my laptop in the Mezzanine Lounge - the entire hotel in wireless. The lounge is small and lovely...and I met overfriendly business people! There are numerous private little conversation nooks in the main lobby...velvet with curtains, leather with contemporary tables..so inviting!! In case you don't bring a computer, they have a laptop in the lobby which you are welcome to use 24/7! They will print for you...ANYTHING you want...they will do for you! There is also a nice workout room in the hotel...I didn't use it! :)) Security: You can't push any buttons in the elevators without inserting your roomkey. I would highly recommend this hotel and I can't wait to return. If NYC hotels were just a little bit more affordable..that would be nice. Keep an eye open for specials that the Hotel Roger Williams may run. I noticed one just after I checked out! Overall, the HRW got an A+ rating from me!

Reviews.Title: “A stylish place to stay”
Reviews.Author: poosie
Reviews.Content: We checked in for one night at this hotel on 14 Oct for a treat and were not disappointed. This hotel is very stylish, individual and in a fantastic central location. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful (special mention to the door staff) and the room felt fairly spacious, compared to what I had heard about hotels generally in NYC. The bar on the mezzanine served reasonably priced, tasty food (although we didn't go there for breakfast). I have only one constructive comment to make - when people in other rooms were coming and going throughout the night, their doors slammed shut all the time which made it hard to get to sleep and stay asleep. Perhaps the hotel can rectify this and install slow closing mechanisms on each door. Putting this aside, we enjoyed our stay at the Roger Williams and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel totally exceeded my expectations. From reservation-making thru to checkout. I called to make a reservation and the agent, who explained packages, gave me directions, and even upgraded my husband and i as it was our anniversary. When we checked in, a very friendly doorman helped us out of the taxi and helped with our luggage which arrived at the room 5 n\minutes after we did. SO the guy at the desk (philip) assisted us with dinner suggestions after we checked in and called back upstairs to make sure evrything was up to par. and it was... the bed was so comfortbale and the terrace so romantic. eleveator was slow but it was worth it. I have seen many negtative reviews but i know that the hotel was newly renovated and is still working to transform itself into an even better stay

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Exclusive
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I have just returned from a weeks stay at the Hotel Roger Williams and must say that once again it has kept up it's high standards. It is the 4th time we have stayed at the Hotel over the past 18 months and have always been impressed with both the place itself and the courtesy of the staff..............especially the doormen who are always jovial and happy to assist. The rooms are spacious, the bed fantastically comfortable enabling you to get a well earned rest after a hard day in Manhatten. In my opinion the bathrooms were above standard for New York City, very corporate and clean and tidy with more than enough space to not fall over your own feet. It was also good to see you had an easy to use safe within your room which to keep your money/valuables safe whilst you ventured out in Manhatten. Another good point is that the hotels location being fairly central Manhatten 2 minutes walk from the Empire state building enables you to get both uptown and downtown without any real hassle.........we preferred to stroll around Manhatten itself taking in the sights but its so cheap and easy to get a cab if you don't fancy walking so much. The only negative I would say having being a patron of the Roger Williams for a couple of years is the continental breakfast on the Mezzanine level which if being honest is a rip-off price wise so I would advise you to get your breakfast outside the hotel itself. The hotel used to do a free breakfast/hot drink service before it's renovation which I thought was an endearing feature especially as it is reasonable high priced to stay.........its sometimes the small things that make all the difference. Overall the Roger Williams is well worth a look if you are thinking of staying in New York and I can say that everytime we've stayed it's been very professionally run and we've had a great time. I'd definately recommend a stay at the Hotel Roger Williams but eat your breakfast elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Roger”
Reviews.Author: mitoboy3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roger Williams this past weekend with two friends. We stayed in a room with two double beds. The beds were "extremely" comfortable, with an adequate amount of sheets ann pillows (2 large and 2 small). The goose down comforter was also very comfortable. The AC unit worked great, and kept the room at the temperature you wanted. Staff was very friendly and helpful. As far as the European Breakfast, I did find it a bit overpriced for what they offered. I sugest skipping on the breakfast and do the traditional New Yorker thing - Bagel with Cream Cheese and a coffee from a neighborhood Deli. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Zenmistress
Reviews.Content: I recently made my first trip to NYC over the weekend, and stayed at the Hotel Roger Williams. I found the staff pleasant and accomodating, the rooms clean, well appointed and comfortable. It was raining when we arrived and the hotel provided umbrellas for our use to walk around the city, which was much appreciated. The beds were comfortable, and it was fantastic that they provided 4 pillows on each bed! I felt like I was sleeping in a marshmallow with the down comforter and down pillows. 4 of us shared a room with 2 double beds, and we weren't cramped for space. The only drawback was the frosted-glass enclosed bathroom, which was only slightly uncomfortable with others in the room during shower time. While I could hear street noises, it wasn't enough to keep me awake. Of course, I did have my pillow over my head to drown out the snoring of my travelling companions. Ha! The air-conditioning kept the room rather cool, the way I like it, and the bright quilts on each bed were the perfect weight to keep comfortably warm. I almost bought one when we checked out. The room had an iron and board, a safe, some complimentary Aveda bathing products (that smelled wonderful), flat screen tv, and desk area. There were benches at the foot of each bed, which worked perfectly for a luggage stand. There was a shelf running the length of the 'entryway' with a large mirror that was excellent for use as an additional vanity area. The lobby area was comfortable, and decorated beautifully. The lounge area was also quite nice, and the service friendly and attentive. The European breakfast spread was delicious looking, but I couldn't fathom spending the $12.95 for pastry and croissants and fruit. My husband enjoyed it, though. The only complaints I have are about the bathroom, as explained above and the elevators, which ran slowly at times. I would recommend the Roger to anyone, and would definitely stay there again. The area was clean, safe, and centrally located to our destinations. Also, fairly easy access to the Lincoln tunnels.

Reviews.Title: “Misadvertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, the place was clean, and looked nice. Me and my wife stayed in one of the Penthouse suites. We were shocked when we saw the "Garden Terrace" if that is what you call it. The pictures that are shown on the website are not even close to what we got as a room. You could step out onto the "Garden Terrace", there was even a chair wedged in a little nook, but you wouldn't want to sit, or stand out there, and if one person was out there you couldn't get around them. It was tiny. It had a "lovely" view of some apartment buildings. It was only a "Garden Terrace" in name as there was certainly no garden (unless you consider a plant in a box to be a garden), and ledge with a railing would have been a better way to describe it than terrace. We looked down from our ledge and saw the "Garden Terrace" that they were advertising, but apparently those rooms are for people who are residents of the building. I beleive they may have used pictures of those rooms, hence, false advertising. I was told the square footage of the room was about 250 to 300 square feet when I booked the room, which was quite large to the other rooms you might find in NY, but I did a quick measurement with my feet (didn't take long) and it was maybe 170 square feet. The picutes that you might find on the internet wih the modern bathroom, wrong....The bathroom had a porceline tub and shower curtain. Also, we left the room and locked the door, but when we came back 6 hours later, the door was open. Apparently the card reader failed. Nothing was missing, thank god. Needless to say we were misled with the pictures and description. Also, I found the fact that they clutter the room with things that if you use you get charged an arm and a leg to be completely disgusting. Needless to say, we will be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: phl5110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger this past Friday night - I was only in town for a night so I checked out the next morning, but I had a wonderful stay. The staff was extremely pleasant and went out of their way to help us with dining suggestions, questions about the subway and cabs and holding our luggage for us while we walked around the city during the day after we checked out. LOVED the bright, modern decor, lobby was very nice and had a jazz band playing at night. In the room, the sliding japanese screens over the window were really cool. We kept them closed b/c it gave the room a nice effect. The flat-panel TV was great and bed was super comfy!!! Def the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Loved the down comforter too. Bathroom was very small, but I didnt expect anything else - hotel bathrooms in NY arent exactly roomy. The shower head was great though - one of the ones that hangs from the top of the ceiling so you get the rainfall effect. Also liked the Aveda bath products. The hotel was not noisy at all, we were facing the building next to us so maybe that's why we didnt hear any street noise...but we didnt hear noise in the hallways or other rooms either. Oh, and the rooms do have in-room safes, someone in another post mentioned not having safes so I thought I'd add that in. I will def stay at the Roger Williams again!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLY rude staff, tiny rooms with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I often go to New York and staying here has has to be the most unpleasant experience I have ever had. The staff was so rude they made my sister cry. She asked whether they could hold her laptop for security reasons and they refused. Apparently they have no in-room safes and no safes in their office. That's incomprehensible but not something a guest can do anything about but the fact that they were condescending to her as if she was asking something completely out of the question was just... shocking, absolutely shocking. Making things worse the rooms were so small they could not even fit our two small suitcases. We had to put them on the bed. Bathroom was dark and nasty and maids were shouting all day long in a foreign language right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place,”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-May 2004. I ended up staying here because I needed to change my travel dates, and the hotel I had originally planned to use was no longer available. This hotel cost a bit more than I had wanted to pay, but still, I was glad to stay here. The rooms and lobby are very nice, furnished in simple but stylish blond wood. In the room, everything seemed to work just fine, although it was difficult keeping the room temperature consistent (sometimes a bit too hot, sometimes rather cold). The hotel provides a free breakfast buffet (bagels, cereals, coffee and juice); there is also an Internet workstation in the lobby (although there might be a wait during peak times). The hotel is located in a very nice part of Manhattan, with plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. The subway is just around the corner and cabs and buses are plentiful...

Reviews.Title: “horrible bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LJ1
Reviews.Content: The Roger Williams adds an unadvertised $10 a day "service charge" to the bill for amenities I for one certainly did not use. The standard rooms are small and cluttered although attempting to be modernist and our king bed was small for such a description. The temperature was hard to control (though opening the window worked well). However, easily the worst feature was the bathroom where the shower was big enough to get two people in easily BUT the compromise was that you had to be a contortionist to use the toilet as it was literally behind and underneath the washbasin. Very poor design for a luxury hotel. I've stayed at equally well-designed but much cheaper hotels in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roger !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cheekypeople
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very helpful, from guidance on the city with help to printing vouchers etc and working out which bagel was which for breakfast. We cannot speak highly enough of our visit, it made our first trip to New York a perfect start. Room service was prompt and after a tiring day walking the food was worth staying in for. The Decor was amazing and fresh, excellent layout and so dam confortable. The beds....were the best we have EVER slept in, even our own. If you want an excellent midtown location, close to everywhere, friendly service, a smile everyday mixed with a sexy and sleak look, then the Roger is the one. Our first trip to New York and we picked a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New ROGER”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have frequented this hotel in the past. However, we are much more inclined to stay now than ever before! Since the Remodel of the Roger, the rooms have been transformed into charming and modern studios. We absolutely loved the new lobby. The new restaurant and bar uphold the excellence that is the Roger. The staff was warm and welcoming and the service devine. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Woke Me Up.”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Williams the first weekend in October of 2004. I accompanied my boyfriend to a conference in New York. His work booked it and I was somewhat pleased from what I saw on the website. When we checked into the rooms I was shocked to see how small it really was in person. There was barely enough room for us to unpack our luggage, etc. There were definitely a few negatives. There was construction going on in the hotel. The elevator is so slow too...so often we would just walk down because waiting was too long. We seriously waited 20 minutes the day we checked out because we couldn't carry our bags down. They gave up breakfast vouchers to the deli across the street. Usually there would be a breakfast buffet in the hotel. This wasn't bad as the deli had some pretty good choices. We would usually grab a few things and then head back to our room to eat our breakfast. It was convenient actually. I had 2 complaints though. One was the construction going on in the hotel. Being that we were in NYC, we stayed out late at night. Probably wouldn't go to bed till 4 or 5am. Construction started at 7am or maybe it was 8am. But this was seriously jackhammering or something loud. It was awful. It ruined my day. I couldn't get back to bed because it didn't stop. Second complaint...maybe this is with all boutique hotels but the rooms are too close or the walls are too thin. At night we'd watch tv and our neighbour would bang on the wall and tell us to turn off the tv. It wasn't even loud. I could barely even hear it from the bed. This happened every night. I just need to wind down and watch tv and I couldn't and then construction woke me up so early. One upside for myself is at least there were Aveda bath products. Haha.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Williams for 1 night in April. The hotel is very modern and has comfortable goose down bedding which we liked. The only problem was loud techno music from downstairs keeping me up at from 3:00-4:00 am. Also our room was located outside a stairwell and elevator bank which kept waking me up. The hotel staff is very friendly and made us feel at home. I would recommend this hotel if you want a modern hotel in a good location, however ask to be moved away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Small deluxe room. Stinky hallways!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and was disappointed with the size of the deluxe room. The service was not bad but the room was very SMALL in size and the hallway stunk like cigarette smoke. If you like clean, spacious rooms this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “For $300 a night, you can do better”
Reviews.Author: vraiblonde
Reviews.Content: When my son and his fiancee were on leave from their tour in Iraq, we wanted to treat them to a nice long weekend in New York. And we did have a nice weekend, I just wish I'd chosen a different hotel. The rooms were adorable and the hotel itself is very attractive, with a convenient location. But we were surprised to see that the "complimentary" drinks we had in the little bar area had been added to our hotel bill. Not to mention that the waitress brought us an array of snacks that we didn't order, which went on our bill as well. Be advised that the pretty basket of goodies on your table aren't complimentary, either, and there's no price list to be found. And the candle in your bathroom will cost you $8 if you burn it. I wasn't impressed with the staff, either. My husband and I arrived before my son and his fiancee. After we "ahemed" a few times, the clerk hung up from her personal phone call and checked us in. I explained to her that we had two rooms booked, to be paid on one credit card (which I handed her), and that our son would be there to check in later. When my son arrived, we got a call from him. The desk clerk that had checked us in and was made aware of our situation was asking him for a credit card to pay for his reservation. I asked her again to please bill that room charge to the credit card I gave her. She asked me for the credit card again, even though she had already run it for the first room. Then she became condescending, which I didn't appreciate, considering I was being very polite about HER incompetance. My son and his fiancee were tickled with the hotel and their room, but they had been living in an Army barracks in Baghdad for the past 6 months. My husband and I, however, visit NY frequently and will not go back to the Roger Williams. We don't like snotty desk clerks and we don't like being nickel and dimed.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBrunette
Reviews.Content: Roger Williams Hotel is such a cozy boutique hotel. The staff was the most attentive we've ever seen. We came early in the day, and to our surprise, our room was available. The lobby is very colorful and modern with comfy couches everywhere. Even though the rooms are pretty small, they are designed in a calm, eclectic style with every amenity you can think of. The room even offered an intimacy kit for couples. Of course, things like that are at an extra cost, but the beauty is that it's available. There was a nice cotton white robe, a nice shower, and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. Lots of comfy pillows, great blanket. The hotel itself is only a few blocks from Empire State Building, where you can a great view of the city from the 86th floor. We went there at night, and it was breathtaking. This hotel is also about 15min walk to Times Square. Roger Williams is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest practice has soured me on a once lovely small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mgl48
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend at the Roger Williams. Having stayed there often since it first became a hotel, we were interested to see what the new owners have done. They've done a lovely job of redecorating, and the staff was even nicer than usual, BUT there was a $10 per day 'Service Charge' on our bill when we checked out. Nowhere was there warning that such a charge would be applied. When we asked what it was for, we were told it was for the new 'amenities': Wireless internet (which is advertised as 'complimentary'), the availability of a fitness room (which we did not use), and the unlimited local phone calls (which we also did not use) The amount of the charge is not relevant. This is a deceptive and dishonest practice so be forewarned and factor that into your decision on whether to stay at the Roger Williams, or any hotel owned by that group.

Reviews.Title: “You grew up smelling of cooking oil.....”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly*Euro*Peep
Reviews.Content: I would not advise to stay here - the rooms smell of cooking oil, all of them. There is definitely a ventilation problem with this hotel as we changed a number of rooms and eventually were on the 12th floor and still had problems!!! The rooms themselves are kind of weird, they've tried to make it a trendy place but it just looks like cheaper than Ikea tack - plastic lamps and bright blue carpets. The bathrooms are tiny and if you move the wrong way whilst sitting on the toilet, you will injure yourself on the sink. The ingrained cooking oil smell everywhere will by default make you want to avoid the restaurant. There are only 2 lifts (elevators) and you sometimes wait, I kid you not, up to about 8 minutes for one to come and there are no stairs that you can take (emergency stairs only). The only positive thing this hotel has going for it is it's great location - pretty much walking distance to anywhere if you have the time, and also it's friendly staff - they can't help it if the ventilation system sucks. They have tried to renovate this hotel but to no avail. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but outside noise is too much!”
Reviews.Author: Tanquerochicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish and beautiful. It looks like something out of Wallpaper magazine. The rooms do not dissapoint. They are large for New York, the beds are fabulous and they have minibars. The bathrooms are clean and comfortable. The problem is the noise. After getting a great room on the 3rd. floor I went into my room to take a quick nap but immedietly I noticed the noise. Garbage trucks, cabs honking, etc. I know New york is loud but I should be able to sleep in my room. I called front dest and asked for a quieter room. I was given a room on the 8th floor and went about my day. When I got back that night at well after midnight yet, the noise level was high enough that I could hardly sleep. At that point I stayed up watching t.v. until 3. I fell asleep but was upset that I spent $240 for a great room with so much noise outside. It doesn't make sense. The staff is attentive and professional, the rooms are state of the art, but it is ruined by the loud garbage trucks and other noise makers that permeate the streets as late as 3 in the morning. If you stay here make sure to bring some ear plugs and stay on a one of the top floors.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased, Indeed.”
Reviews.Author: TeriLynn_Atlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying 2 nights at the Roger Williams. We were a little apprehensive because of some negative reviews we read before our trip. As it turned out, all of our fears were unfounded. The hotel was clean and nicely furnished and except for a couple of times, the wait for an elevator was quite minimal. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful all the time. We requested extra towels and glasses two separate times and each time they were sent without delay. I would definately recommend the Roger Williams to anyone who prefers a small hotel with personality over a larger, more impersonal environment.

Reviews.Title: “If you like reservation problems, this is the place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Roger Williams over Dec 3rd to Dec 6th. This ofcourse is the start of the peak holiday season. I booked a penthouse room back in July. (YES, JULY!) I had confirmation of the reservation with a penthouse room written on it, and even talked to a reservation specialist at the hotel to make sure this room was available. They gave me confirmation that I had booked a penthouse room and that it would be available for my stay. We arrived and the hotel was a small, very modern hotel. The lobby has a couple of places to sit, yet right next to the door where it gets a little chilly. There is no fireplace. There is a very tiny bar upstairs. The staff were very helpful to check our bags while our room was being cleaned. Come to find out that my reservation was not what I had booked. I was given a deluxe room, not a penthouse room as I had confirmed. They gave me some ridiculous excuse that the woman who booked my room for me had only been working there 2 days. Maybe the worst excuse I have ever heard. So, we ended up taking the deluxe room, but made sure we were given the room rate from back in July. This was about the only thing they did to accomodate us. They had no explanation as to what happen to our reservation. ?????? If you like shady reservations, then this is the place to stay. If you want to take a chance on getting a different room than what you book, stay here!! Rooms are nice though. I would definitely reserve a deluxe room. There was a plasma on the wall. Bathrooms are small, just like everywhere else in NYC. Elevators are soooo slow and can only fit like 4 people. Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Fun Hotel, what a great deal !”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed NOV 2004. Great location and friendly staff. The decor is ultra modern with a really interesting color scheme. The rooms are a decent size for NY city and the hotel represents extremely good value at the price range. The food is good and the staff very helpful. Only negative is the elevators take forever. My room had a flat panel TV and a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotels are the future!”
Reviews.Author: HaggersinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the NY Marathon 2004 and I have to say the hotel was superb. Although the gym was closed due to renovation (they are extending it) I was still offered a pass to a local gym. The rooms are really comfortable, modern and they have nice touches to make you feel at home from Aveda products, ironing board to CD player. My only advice would be to not drink the hotel water, as it is not free (I thought it was complimentary to the room) and cost an amazing $9.00 per litre. The hotel is perfect for business and leisure, only round the corner from the Empire State Building and near to two subway stations! Really nice hotel if you prefer a boutique hotel as oppose to your mainstream accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went with my mom and dad...Our room was on the 8th floor. The view was of other buildings. The room came with two very clean full-size beds. The room had a weird smell. The bathroom does have frosted glass, but it just felt very uncomfortable knowing that my parents could see me taking a shower(the glass is see-through). The bathroom door, which was also frosted glass, had no lock. The tiles in the bathroom were very dirty, and the edges were growing mold or something of the sort that we had to wear flip flops while showering. We needed three towels, but they always gave us two. The drawer was broken. The hotel does not give complimentary bottled water(very deceiving on their website: rogerwilliamshotel.com). The breakfast was the same everyday, but i did enjoy the croissants and cereal. I also enjoyed the free cappuccino two or three times a day. The hotel's location was very convenient. It's about two blocks from the 6 train(local green subway). There's a church right next to the hotel, around the corner to the left(when exiting) that i would not recommend.(nothing to do with the hotel, but just thought i'd sneek that in). Fitness "studio" had a tv, an exercise bike, two old tredmills with no water bottle holder, and a bathroom. The many halogen lights in the fitness studio made the room hot, so i had to open the window. I liked that there was free access to a computer and internet in the lobby. The people that work at the hotel are very nice. I asked to see a penthouse room and they glady brought us to see one... it was very nice!!... it came with a flat screen tv, clean bathroom with a DOOR, a big bed, nice view, and a patio/terrace. The mezzanine, where the food is, is not a big room. The lighting in the hotel is dimmed; i think they do this so that the dirty spots and scratches everywhere aren't too noticeable. For $130 a night, the hotel was a good deal. My only real problem was the bathroom, and maybe the smell of the room(that you do get used to). The hotel told us that they would be doing a complete remodeling of the hotel in september, or i think they said it would be done by september 2004...So i'm thinking that they'll raise the rates/night, but the hotel will probably be very nice. This is my review. I'm not saying stay at Roger Williams, and i'm not saying don't stay at Roger Williams.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Return to The Roger Williams”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room rate was great at $115 a nite, the room left a lot to be desired. Management needs to do a complete review of rooms, i.e., black mold on the side of the sink; toilet and floor in bathroom had heavy rust stains showing leaks; lightbulb in floor lamp kept flickering and housekeeper kept leaving cleaning spray bottle in room. No ice machines on floors --- just an ice bucket on the Mezzanine level available 24-hours. Bellman has to bring-up ice (if remembers or request is forwarded). Hotel should just provide ice trough on mezzanine level. Video library out-of-date with 5-year old movies. Room faced side of brick building and was noisy. I'd spend a little more money next time for better accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “it was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a woman travelling alone on business, so choose my hotels carefully. From the minute I arrived I knew I had made the right choice. The lobby area was like stepping into another world - sleek yet unpretentious. my room was great - with the huge beds, power showers you'd expect from US hotels, but extras like aveda toiletries, a complimentary Time Out NY and chic colour scheme made all the difference. I loved the mezzanine level - when travelling alone, i don't feel comfortable sitting in bars in the evening, so this was the perfect place to catch up on the newspapers etc, and not feel couped up in your room. Location was excellent - very quiet, and yet 2 blocks away from the action. Staff very helpful - went out of their way to find me a nail bar open at 10pm! will come back - and spend extra on getting a penthouse!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the RW after staying for 5 nights in March. All the staff were very friendly, the facilities the hotel offers are great - the free business centre, the cd and video players in the rooms (with free library), the free hot drinks and iced water, the free breakfast - which filled us up for the day (and only once did we have to take it back to the room). The rooms are stylish and i absolutely loved the bathroom walls and shower (even with the design fault which led to the eventual flooding of the bathroom floor each time). And the location is fantastic - 5 mins from empire state and 15 to times square. The only thing that would have made the hotel even better would be a bar, but it was still no great loss. I would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice hotel but please give us a decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great location.Big room, ask for the top floor, very modern clean and calm. Break fast cool be improved this my only bad point.

HotelInfo.Name: Roger Williams Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 131 Madison Avenue, At 31st Street, New York City, NY 10016
